loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer S. is a distiller of a local gin. He is married, but his wife's income as a seamstress is not sufficient for Ebenezer and their 4 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits. He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina E. sells bananas and plantains. She is a widow whose income is not sufficient for Georgina and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hawa's Jitahidini Group

texts.en:
Hawa is 35 years old, married, and has 3 children, aged 10, 7, and 1. Hawa earns income selling charcoal, firewood and bites. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$25.

In the past, Hawa has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania which she used to expand her business. She now hopes to receive another loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing with clothing and firewood sales.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood for sale

loans.name: Razina's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Razina is 30 years old, divorced, and has 4children. She became a fish seller in 1999. Every day, she works from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140.

Razina now hopes to receive a loan to buy more fish for sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing with basket making and food sales.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort C. sells Banku, a local meal which she prepares for public sale. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer but does not earn enough money to support the family. Demand for Comfort's goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business in order to increase her profits.

She is requesting additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her Banku business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Tatu's Tusife Moyo Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children. She became a clothing seller in 2005. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$110.

Tatu now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Zuwena who owns and runs a cafe.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Mkatawa

texts.en:
Mkatawa is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. She became a food seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. at her business, earning a monthly profit of about US$90.

Mkatawa now hopes to receive a loan to buy additional food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for a business

loans.name: Bon

texts.en: The third time she borrowed from kiva on March 2008. She paid back her loan on time. All of the time she borrowed, she got more profit. Once again she needs a new loan in order to increase her business. She will buy more ingredients to make more soup for selling.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 32 years old and married. She became a clothing (khanga) seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business, earning a monthly profit of about $110 from the sales.

Amina now hopes to receive a loan to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of additional clothes (khanga) for sale

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 25 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$140.

Leticia now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items, such as rice, maize flour, vegetables and bananas, for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have similar businesses.

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. She became a food seller in 1995. She works every day, earning a monthly profit of about US$140 from the sales.

Mauwa now hopes to receive a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas to increase the inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of food items to increase store inventory

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 36 years old, married, and has 8 children. She own and runs a bakery, which she started in 1998. She works every day, earning a monthly profit of about US$155 from the sales.

Fatma is now asking for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 35 years old, married, and has 8 children. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$175.

Asha now hopes to receive a loan to buy more food items, such as rice, maize flour and bananas, for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for sale

loans.name: Hadija's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 25 years old, married, and has a child. She earns income selling charcoal. She works every day, making a monthly profit of about US$90.

Hadija now hopes to receive a loan to buy more charcoal for sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Kibibi, Mwanahamis and Hidaya.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal to increase inventory

loans.name: Abror

texts.en: K. Abror has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2007. He first applied for a business development loan after seeing his brother improve his business after receiving MicroInvest loans. K. Abror applied and received a loan to purchase pedigree bulls. Mr. K. Abror sold the bulls and with the profits he purchased new pedigree livestock from neighboring Kyrgyzstan. He dreams of having a big livestock farm so he would like to increase his amount of livestock and build a big cowshed. Mr. K. Abror applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 3100 STJ for 6 months and thanks KIVA for its grateful support.

loans.use: To increase his livestock numbers and build a cowshed

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 38 years old, married, and has 6 children. She works as a porridge seller. Every day, she works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$90.

Pili now hopes to receive a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 38 years old, married, and has 5 children. She earns income selling food. Every day, she works from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$110 from the sales.

Rabia is now asking for a loan to buy more food items, including rice, maize flour, meat and bananas, for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of food items for a business

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en: M. Feruza became a client in 2008 and showed herself to be very responsible. She makes repayments to her loans on time and has had no problem following loan procedures. She lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and she is 25 years old. Mrs. M. Feruza is engaged in trading home grown fruits and vegetables at the local bazaar. She is also a collective farmer. Mrs. Akbarova Gulnora applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2100 STJ for 4 months in order to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: To improve and increase the business

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: A. Gulnora became a client in 2008 and showed herself to be very responsible. She makes repayments to her loans on time and has had no problem following loan procedures. She lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and is married with 7 children. Mrs. A. Gulnora is engaged in trading home grown fruits and vegetables at the local bazaar. She is also a collective farmer. Mrs. A. Gulnora applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months in order to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: To increase and improve her business

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
U. Gulnoza became a client in 2008 and showed herself to be very responsible. She makes repayments to her loans on time and has had no problem following loan procedures. She lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and is married with 7 children.

Mrs. U. Gulnoza is engaged in trading fruits and vegetables at the local bazaar. She works directly with suppliers so she can sell for low prices and has many repeat customers. Mrs. U. Gulnoza applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2200 STJ for 4 months in order to increase and improve her business.

loans.use: To increase and improve her business

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla A. is 45 years old, is married and a father of 3 children. He lives and works in his own welding workshop in Avétonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. To provide for the needs of his family, he manufactures and resells various metal objects and machine tools at the main local market. With this credit, he would like to build his supplies by buying iron sheets for manufacturing outdoor objects. The profits from this activity will make it possible for him to support the needs of his children and to improve their living conditions. Mr. A. is a good customer since he has already profited from more than three loans and his refunds were respected.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Komla A. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite et travaille dans son propre atelier de soudure à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il fabrique et revend divers objets métalliques et des machines à outils sur un marché général. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite approvisionner en achetant les tôles de fer destiné à la fabrication des objets à exposer. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer ses conditions de la vie. Monsieur A. est un bon client puisqu’il a déjà bénéficié de plus de trois crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers.

loans.use: Purchase of iron sheets for manufacturing outdoor objects

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 41 years old, married, and has 8 children. She became a charcoal and firewood seller in 1988. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm, earning a monthly profit of about US80.

Fatma now hopes to obtain a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and firewood to increase inventory

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 50 years old. She is a divorced woman. She has owned and run a small shop since in 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more items (phone vouchers) for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Annet Kaweesi`s Group

texts.en:
Annet is the leader of this group of five. She lost two of the original members and was joined by other two whose group disintegrated. She is 23 years of age and married with four children, aged 10, 7, 5, and 2. Three are in school. She had never accessed credit until she joined MCDT. The community she lives in is urban within a low-lying slum area.

She buys charcoal from trucks that travel to her area and works for 6 days in a week. Her busiest times are mid-days and evenings. She rents the place where she operates her business and has been in business for 4 years. There is a ready market for her business.

Her main challenge is that she works in an open space and sometimes during the rainy season the area floods and the fast-running water takes away her stock. In the hot season she has to bear the brunt of the sun.

Her benefits include being able to send her children to school and contributing to household expenditures. She has over the years acquired a refrigerator, a calf and goat.

She plans to acquire a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: Buy land to build a house

loans.name: Nali

texts.en:
Nali is 39 years old. She is a married woman with 4  children aged between  16 and 4. She became a clothes seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Nali now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (Khanga) for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura  is 48 years, She is a married woman who takes care of  6 children. She became a snack  seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Zuhura now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Subeha

texts.en:
Subeha is 21 years. She is a married woman with 1 child.  She became a potato chips seller in 2005. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Subeha now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis M., a businessman who owns a butchery in the Kigamboni area,  purchases his meat wholesale and then retails his products to food venders, cafés and households. Although the business is only three years old, demand now exceeds Francis’ ability to supply, so he is requesting a loan of $550 to expand the operation. This expansion will also enhance the living conditions of his family, as Francis is their sole provider.

loans.use: To expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 43 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children aged 26, 18, 11 and 6. She became a juice and snack seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Hamida now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by buying more items

loans.name: Sharifa's Jitahidi Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is 49 years old. She is a married woman with 5 children aged between 5 and 20. She became a charcoal and firewood seller in 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Sharifa now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwajuma, who has a spice selling business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to increase her stock.

loans.name: Asha's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Asha  is 48 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children aged 21, 17  and 14. She became a charcoal and juice seller in 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member who also has business dealing with clothes and shoe sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 32 years old. She is a married woman with 4 children aged 12, 9, 7 and 2.  She became a clothes seller in 2003. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Mariam now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zakia's Usintupe Group

texts.en:
Zakia is 40 years old. She is a married woman with 5 children aged between 5 and 30. She became a food seller in 2002. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Zakia  now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Halima.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura D., a married Tanzanian woman with four children, is a food vendor in Makangarawe in Temeke District. Her current customers are from nearby retail shops and a small market; her business dream is to have a café with an hygienic cooking environment and a stable clientèle. Zahura is requesting a loan of $550 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sirayel

texts.fr:
Sirayel M., a widow with 5 children of whom she takes care, has been a member of the Vélingara Foulbé 2 village bank for the past 5 and a half years. She would like to obtain a loan so that she can buy and sell bread, dried sorrel (a herb), packs of sugar and other ingredients to make fruit juices and ice. Her income will help her take care of the children in her care. This loan will be reimbursed in six months in one installement.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Sirayel M., veuve avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis 5 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter du pain de singe,de l'oseille séché, du sucre, des sachets et des ingrédients pour faire des jus de fruit et de la glace et vendre.Ses revenus lui permettent d'entretenir les enfants à sa charge.Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make fruit juice and ice

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu  is a married woman with 5  children aged between 12  and 3.  She is a bread seller. Every day, she works from 5am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Tatu now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Aziza's Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Aziza  is 50 years old. She has one child, who is aged 15. She became a juice and snack (chapati) seller in 2001. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Aziza  now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mariam, who also has business dealing with juice sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is 28 years old. She is a divorced woman with 2 children aged 8  and 3.  She became a fish (octopus) seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $215 from her sales.

Zuhura now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Greetings from Gasabo in Rwanda! Beatrice is 37 years old, married with three children and one adopted child from the 1994 Genocide.

In  2002, Beatrice started a business selling bed sheets and covers with only $40 as her starting capital. Owing to her commitment and hard work, her capital has grown to $350, and she currently earns about $120 every month.  Beatrice is now requesting a loan of $375 to increase her stock.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Mihneta

texts.en: Mihneta, a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Doboj, earns about $225 per month selling the milk produced by her cow, while her husband works seasonally.  She would now like to expand her business by purchasing a second dairy cow, and is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of $950 for that purpose.  This will be her second loan with Zene za Zene, and it is Mihneta's plan to use any remaining funds from the loan to purchase food for her chickens and cows.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna D. is 24 years old, is married and has 2 children of whom she takes care. She has been a member of the Vélingara Foulbé 2 village bank for the last 3 and a half years. She would like to build her trade of palm oil and food staples (dry fish, onions). This loan will be reimbursed in six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Maimouna D., 24 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé 2 depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de l’huile de palme et de condiments (poissons secs, oignons). Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Trade of palm oil and food staples

loans.name: Miriam Lidia

texts.en:
Miriam is a 45-year-old mother of four children. She lives in a rented house where there are other tenants. Miriam and her husband sell ceramics, glasswork, sheets, bedspreads, and other products to order and door-to-door. Furthermore, her husband buys imported products from the city of Lima and then travels to different provinces to sell their products on credit once a week or every fifteen days.

Miriam is a member of the Generosidad Village Bank. She needs a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to invest in pressure pots, Pyrex products, and sheets.

Miriam's dream is to construct a house in Lima, to have a stable store, and that her children may become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in pressure pots, Pyrex products, and sheets

loans.name: Licet

texts.en:
Licet is a 43-year-old mother of four children. She is a citizen of the city of Tingo Maria and her husband comes from Piura. They have had their business streetside in the city of Ayacucho for many years. Licet and her husband sell children's clothing retail and wholesale in the markets of Ayacucho. They sell on credit and collect on a daily basis. They sell the retail clothes in one of the streets of Ayacucho. Licet's husband also travels to various provinces for their business.

Licet is a member of the Generosidad Village Bank. She needs a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to invest in polo shirts, pants, and sweatshirts.

Licet's dream is to have a stable business, to buy a house in the city of Lima, and that her children might become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in polo shirts, pants and sweatshirts

loans.name: Enisa

texts.en: Enisa, a young woman from the town of Doboj, is married with one child, and her husband is currently employed.  The family receives a small pension through Enisa's mother-in-law as well.  This will be Enisa's first loan from Zene za Zene, which she is requesting in the amount of $800 to buy seeds to grow tomatoes and peppers in her greenhouse.  She may also spend part of the money on fertilizer and pesticides. Enisa will be busy in the early fall planting these seeds after the weather has cooled down and growing conditions are optimal.

loans.use: To buy seeds & supplies for farming

loans.name: Sonia, Antonia And Paulina Group

texts.en:
Sonia is a 27-year-old mother of two children. Sonia sells clothes to business people in the markets of Ayacucho. Her sales are on credit and she collects every day. Her products are from the city of Lima.

Antonia is a 45-year-old mother of six children. Antonia sells food in the park near her house during the evenings.

Meanwhile, Paulina is a 25-year-old woman and is pregnant with her first child. Paulina used to sell jewelry at various regional fairs but has recently stopped due to her pregnancy. With her savings and a loan, Paulina hopes to open a grocery store after her delivery.

Sonia, Antonia and Paulina are members of the Generosidad Village Bank. They need respective loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles to invest in pants, aprons, shoes, meat, vegetables, and fruit.

Sonia, Antonia and Paulina's dreams are to have their own bakery, their own cars, to improve their homes, and to have a sewing workshop.

loans.use: to invest in pants, aprons, shoes, meat, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna Fay is 44 years old, married, has 7 children and takes care of 3 other people. She has been a member of the Lélo village bank in Thiès for the past 8 years. She wants to buy chicks, food and medication for her poultry breeding business as well as suppliers for her restaurant. Maimouna would like to grow her businesses in order to improve the living conditions of her children. She is requesting a loan which will be refunded in six months in one installement.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Maimouna F., 44 ans, mariée, 07 enfants et 3 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lélo à Thiès depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter des poussins, des aliments et des médicaments pour son activité d’élevage et des provisions pour son restaurant. Maimouna souhaite renforcer ses activités pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Running a restaurant and breeding poultry

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from Rwamagana in Rwanda! Claude is 36 years old, married with four children and one adopted child orphaned in the 1994 Genocide.

In 2005, he started a small pub selling various local drinks and beverages in the center after accessing a loan of $200 from Vision Finance Company. He also operates his own shop selling various items including sugar, soap, salt, paraffin for lighting houses in rural areas, matchboxes, rice, cassava flour, cooking oil, beans, and sorghum. Claude employs three people to help him run the businesses and earns about $150 per month. He is applying for a loan of $925 to increase his stock and expand his pub.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Isabel Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a separated, forty-year-old mother of four children. Haydee sells clothing to order and catalog cosmetics that she sells to her friends, co-workers and acquaintances on credit. She acquires all of her products from the city of Lima. Haydee also works as a secretary at the state university. Furthermore, she is studying to become a nurse and is currently going through training.

Haydee is a member of the Generosidad Village Bank. She needs a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to invest in polo shirts, blouses, and shoes.

Haydee's dream is to be able to travel far and work abroad, that her children move forward and become professionals, and to have a store to manage with her daughter.

loans.use: to invest in polo shirts, blouses and shoes for re-sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa And Ayde Group

texts.en:
Rosa is a 37-year-old mother of three children. Rosa sells fruit at the regional fairs, traveling on Saturdays and Sundays to buy cereals, cheeses, etc. to resell in the local markets. Furthermore, Rosa works in a house where she cooks and cleans.

Meanwhile, Ayde is a single, 27-year old-woman. Ayde sells food on the weekends in the Nery Garcia market, streetside in the mornings, and sells catalog cosmetics.

Rosa and Ayda are members of the Generosidad Vilage Bank. They need respective loans of 400 Nuevos Soles each to invest in oranges, bananas, cucumbers, pots, and knives. Rosa and Ayde's dream is to improve their businesses, to have a stable business, and that their children become professionals.

loans.use: to invest in oranges, bananas, cucumbers, pots and knives

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Greetings from Rwamagana in Rwanda! Theoneste is 28 years old, married with two children, one adopted after being orphaned in the 1994 Genocide in Rwanda. 

In 2000, Theoneste started a small shop in Rwamagana’s trading center selling a variety of items including soap, sugar, cassava flour, soft drinks, and clothes. He later expanded his business by growing sorghum and bananas to sell in the markets in order to increase his income. Currently employing four people and earning about $100 every month, Theoneste is applying for a loan of $925 to increase the stock in his shop and grow more sorghum and bananas.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Yusuph

texts.en: Yusuphy M. has been operating a business selling shoes at Vituka in Dar-es-salaam for one year now.  Purchasing his stock from a shopping center, he currently sells to customers around Vituka, but plans to eventually open a footwear shop in Karia-Koo in Dar-es-Salaam. This business provides essential support for his family; he is now requesting a loan of $350 to expand it.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 64 years old, lives in a village close to Saida in South Lebanon. A very hardworking plumber since his youth, he needs a loan of $1,200 to purchase goods and new equipment to better perform his job. Ali has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past five years, repaying all of his debts on time.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing goods and new equipment

loans.name: Godfroid

texts.en:
Greetings from Rwamagana in Rwanda! Godfroid is a 45-year-old entrepreneur, married with five children, one adopted after being orphaned in the 1994 Genocide. Before the  Rwandan Genocide, Godfroid made his income selling dairy products from his cows. During the Genocide, the cows were slaughtered and his house destroyed.

In 1997, Godfroid started a business selling agricultural produce including bananas, sorghum, and beans, and was able to open a small shop in his home area. Earning about $280 every month, he employs two people to help him run the business and is now applying for a loan of $925 to increase his stock for the growing food market in the area.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin, 50 years old, lives with his wife and four children in the suburbs of Aley, in the Chouf region of Lebanon. Amin owns a small bakery specializing in ‘Manakich’, a pizza-like bread stuffed with cheese or thyme that the Lebanese usually eat at breakfast. The bakery is the only source of revenue for his family, and Amin now needs a loan of $1,200 to purchase a second-hand car. This car will not only allow him to provide his clients with ‘Manakich’ delivery service, thereby increasing his sales and revenues, but will also be used for family transportation. Amin has been a micro-credit client of A. Majmoua for the past five years and has repaid each of his loans on time.

loans.use: To purchase a used car.

loans.name: Nassab

texts.en: Nassab is 57 years old, married with two children, and lives in a small village located in the suburbs of Aley. She is a seamstress and also sells clothes. Her enthusiasm and willpower have helped her business grow every day. She now needs $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine. This is the second time that Nassab has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Lusekelo

texts.en: Lusekelo M. is a businesswoman who sells a variety of soft drinks at Mwalimu Nyerere International Airport in Dar-es-Salaam Tanzania. The profit derived helps her to pay schools fees and feed her four children.  In order to expand her business, she is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina owns a women's clothing business in downtown Zaporozhye. She is very creative and full of ideas. She has rich experience working in this business. Moreover, Irina is very enthusiastic about her own small enterprise and has a good attitude. She sets high goals and takes daily action to achieve them. She has been in this business for 12 years. Presently, her monthly income is about $1300.

Irina would like to get a loan of 5060 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital. She believes financial assistance will support her in her endeavors. She is determined to work on her entrepreneurial dreams to make them a reality, understanding real success and wealth takes time. Irina is hoping to generate more profit and continue to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: Irina would like to increase her turnover capital for her women's clothing business.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is married with an 18-year-old son. He has a taxi business in Ivano-Frankivsk. Ivan decided to start this business 11 years ago. His venture has seen considerable growth ever since. Ivan managed to purchase a second vehicle and hired an employee to work as a taxi driver. Currently, Ivan has about $40-60 of income daily.

Ivan is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to install a new type of running gear in his vehicle to reduce his running costs. He believes better quality equipment will help him have fewer repairs, glitches and less down time. Ivan has repaid 3 previous loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. We believe his thorough planning and perfect credit history will secure prompt repayment of the current loan, too.

loans.use: Ivan would like to install liquefied gas running gear into his vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Stanislav

texts.en:
Stanislav is married with a 12-year-old daughter. He is a businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk. Stanislav offers transportation services on the territory of Ukraine. He has been in the business for five years. His daily income is about $30-40.

Stanislav is seeking a loan of 3000 Grivnas to do some repair work on a car he rents and uses to work as a taxi driver. His business is the only source of income for the family. Stanislav served in the military before and is used to discipline and strategizing. We believes focus and determination will help him achieve his current goals and grow his business as a result. Stanislav is hoping to use a portion of generated profit to pay his daughter's college fees.

loans.use: Stanislav would like to do some repair work on his vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married with four grown kids, six grandkids and a greatgrandson. She is retired and runs her own small enterprise in the central wholesale market of Nadvirna where she is originally from. Ganna sells food products wholesale at affordable prices. She launched her venture 18 years ago. Presently, her monthly income is about $1200-1400. Ganna owns two vending facilities and one of her daughters helps her run this other vending kiosk.

Ganna works hard to provide for her family as this business is the only source of income for them. She is aware of some tricks of this industry as she had worked in the sphere of commerce for 35 years before she started her own business. Ganna has an orientation to excellence and desire to achieve outstanding results which attracts many customers to her business. Today she is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to purchase mineral fertilizers and grain for further sale in her kiosk.

Note: this is a short-term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Ganna would like to purchase mineral fertilizers and grain.

loans.name: Perus Katongole’S Group

texts.en:
Perus Kawongole is the leader of a group of five women. She is 37 and married with four children. Two of her children are in school while the other two are independent. Perus lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Perus has been running her bar for the last 6 years. The market for her business is moderate. The greatest challenge Perus faces is making her rent payments.

Perus plans on using this loan to expand her business. In the past she has paid back 18 loans and has used that money to continue to make her business profitable

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Mariette

texts.es:
Mariette has a pension (small restaurant) where she sells food (lunch at midday and at night grilled meat and silpancho, a Bolivian dish with meat, rice and potatoes). Her husband is a driver and they have two school-aged children.

This credit will be used to buy tables and chairs for the implementation of the business, as the business has the space to attend to customers, but does not have furniture. The loan will be a great help and will increase her income and improve her quality of life. Her home is located in the Villa San Antonio Bajo neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time that she has requested a loan and the second time that she has needed Kiva’s help. Her history qualifies her for the loan, as she has paid back what she has borrowed in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Mariette tiene una pensión (pequeño restaurant) donde vende comida ( almuerzo a medio día y por las noches silpancho y asado) y su esposo es chofer, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de mesas y sillas para la implementación en el negocio ya que cuenta con espacio para la atención de comida pero no cuenta con muebles, por lo cual será de gran ayuda este crédito ya que aumentara su nivel de ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa san Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito, y la segunda vez que requiere la ayuda de Kiva su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her restaurant

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou B., is 43 years old, is married and has 5 children of whom she takes care. She has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambienne bank for the past 4 years. She would like to get a loan so that she can buy and sell honey, palm oil and lemon. The income gained from this will help her improve her living conditions and health. This loan will be reimbursed in six months in one installement.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Aissatou B., 43 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 4 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre du miel, de l’huile de palme et du citron. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de santé.Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and resale of honey, palm oil and lemon.

loans.name: Nyiramuhanda

texts.en: Greetings from G. in Rwanda! G. is a 44-year-old businesswoman, married with seven children and three orphans adopted after the 1994 Genocide. In 2004, G. joined a credit association to access micro loan to start her business of selling drinks and beverages as a whole seller. She is renting a store where she sells beverages in large quantities to retailers in the area and far in the rural areas. She earns about $145 every month. She is applying for a loan worth 613,575 Frws to increase her stock.

loans.use: Gorette would like to increase the stock of her small beverage store.

loans.name: Mariama Bagna

texts.fr:
Mariama Bagna D. is 36 years old and cares for four children. She has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian village bank for six and a half years, and deals in dyed thioub fabric and palm oil. In her desire to improve the standard of living, health and education of her children, she has requested a loan that would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariama Bagna D., 36 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des thioubs (tissus teintés) et des effets de toilette dans une cantine. Elle commercialise aussi de l’huile de palme. Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Buying and selling thioub dyed fabric and palm oil

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Greetings from Martin in Rwanda! Martin is 42 years old, married with three children and two adopted orphans from the Rwandan genocide of 1994. Martin has been a tailor with his workshop for 27 years. He makes different clothes for both women and men in the area. He makes school uniforms for primary children. He has 15 sewing machines and employs 5 people in the workshop. He is training young girls and boys who never had a chance to continue with school to sew for a skill in life. He earns about $250 from the sewing workshop. Besides sewing, Martin has two milking cows, which earn him about $35 from selling the milk to his neighbors. He is requesting a loan worth 504,495 Frws to buy more sewing materials for his workshop.

loans.use: Martin would like to buy more sewing materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Diariatou

texts.fr:
38-year-old Diariatou Sané, married with seven children in her care, has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian bank for five years. She trades in dried fish, peanuts and vegetables. She wishes to improve her standard of living, and the health and education of her children The loan that she has requested would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Diariatou Sané 38ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 5 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des poissons séchés, de la pâte d'arachides et des légumes(oignions, aubergine ,etc..). Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Vente de poissons séchés, pâte d'arachide et légumes

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou F. is married and has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian bank for seven years. She trades in peanuts, also known as monkey nuts, and makes a beverage whose ingredients include monkey bread fruit, dried red hibiscus flowers, milk and sugar. Aissatou wants to improve their standard of living and please her customers. She is seeking a loan that would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Aissatou F., mariée est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 7 ans. Elle achète et revendre des arachides et fait des jus à base de pain de singe, bissap, lait et sucre. Aissatou souhaite améliorer ses conditions de vie et satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sale of peanuts and fruit beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Neretse would like to increase his working capital for his small homegoods store.

loans.name: Aissatou Ibra

texts.fr:
58-year-old Aissatou Ibra D. is married and cares for one child. She has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian village bank for two and a half years. Aissatou Ibra trades in a dyed fabric called thioub, other fabrics and cloth. She wishes to improve their standard of living and health. The loan which she is requesting would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Aissatou Ibra D. 58 ans, mariée avec 01 enfant en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des thioubs(tissus teintés), tissus et draps. Elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Fabric sales, including thioub dyed fabrics

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Adama D. is 37 years old, married and cares for eight children. She has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambian village bank for two years, and trades in wax and thioub, a dyed fabric. Adama wishes to improve their living conditions, as well as the health and education of her children. She is seeking a loan which would be repaid in a lump sum in six months’ time.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Adama D. 37 ans, mariée avec 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 2 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des wax et des thioubs(tissus teintés). Adama souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité des enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sale of thioub dyed fabrics and wax

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) Andina.

She lives in the community of Ninachiri, in the sector of Laja, in the province of Los Andes (3 hours and a half away from La Paz).

Petrona is married to Leonardo Huanaca, who is a farmer, and they have three children (ages 8, 12, and 18).

This is the second loan Isabel requests to Impro and Kiva; she will use it to buy cattle and produce more milk. The loan evaluation that was realized, qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Petrona se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Su domicilio es en la comunidad Ninachiri, sector Laja de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz, ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. Petrona esta casada con Leonardo H. (agricultor) y tiene 3 hijos de 18,12 y ocho años de edad respectivamente.

El monto del crédito será usado para la compra de ganado vacuno.

Este es su segundo crédito con Impro y el segundo en el programa Kiva, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cattle and produce more milk

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) Andina.

He also works as a construction worker in his hometown, he lives in the community of Chijipina Chico, in the province of Omasuyos (3 hours away from La Paz).

Rene is married and has three children (ages 12, 16 and 18). This is the second loan he requests to Impro and the loan evaluation that was realized qualifies him to receive the loan. Rene will use the loan to buy better cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Rene se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, su producción de de leche es vendida a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Asimismo, se dedica a la albañilería en el pueblo donde vive (comunidad Chijipina Chico de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.)

Tiene una esposa y 3 hijos de 18,16 y 12 años de edad respectivamente.

El crédito será usado para comprar ganado de raza mejorada.

Este es su segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: COMPRA DE GANADO VACUNO

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) Andina.

He lives in the community of Chijipina Chico, in the province of Omasuyos (3 hours away from La Paz). Anastacio is married and has seven children (ages 4, 8, 15, 18, 23 and 24).

This is the second loan Anastacio requests to Impro and the loan evaluation that was realized qualifies him to receive the loan.

Anastacio will use the loan to buy forage in order to produce more milk and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Anastacio se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Chijipina Chico de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Anastasio es casado y tiene 7 hijos de 24, 23, 18, 15, 11, 8 y 4 años de edad respectivamente.

El monto del crédito será destinado para adquirir forraje para su ganado, de esta manera incrementará su producción de leche y por lo tanto sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy forage in order to produce more milk and increase his income

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL Andina.

She lives in the community of Chahuira Chico, in the sector of Achacachi, in the province of Omasuyos (3 hours and a half away from La Paz).

She lives together with her husband, who is a teacher and their three children (ages 12, 18 and 20).

This is the first loan Isabel requests to Impro; she will use it to buy more cattle. The loan evaluation that was realized, qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Sabina se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, produce leche que es vendida a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Su vivienda esta ubicada en la comunidad Chahuira Chico, sector Achacachi de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz (a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz.)

Vive junto a su esposo (de profesión maestro rural) y sus 3 hijos de 20, 18 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. El crédito será destinado para la compra de ganado vacuno Es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cattle and produce more milk

loans.name: Jhonatan Vincenth

texts.es:
Jhonatan lives in the street of “Eduardo Abaroa” at Obispo Indaburo, in the city of La Paz. He is single and lives with his parents.

He works for a company that installs gas cylinders at houses located in the city of El Alto.

This is the first loan he requests to Impro and the loan evaluation that was realized qualifies him to receive the loan. Jhonatan will use the loan to buy welding tools in order to improve his work.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhonatan vive en la calle Eduardo Abaroa, zona Obispo Indaburo en la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y continúa viviendo en casa de sus padres.

Su ocupación laboral es ser empleado en una compañía de instalación de gas domiciliario en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de un equipo de soldadura, indispensable herramienta para poder mejorar su desempeño en el trabajo.

Es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy welding tools in order to improve his work

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel breeds cattle and later on sells the milk to a company called PIL Andina.

Isabel lives in the community of Ninachiri, in the sector of Laja, in the province of Los Andes (3 hours away from La Paz).

Her husband, Basilio Huanca, is a farmer. Together, they have six children (ages 2, 4, 6, 8, 10 and 12).

This is the first loan Isabel requests to Impro; she will use it to buy more cattle. The loan evaluation that was realized, qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, es así que produce leche, la cuál es vendida específicamente a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).

Isabel vive en la comunidad Ninachiri, sector Laja de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz (ubicada a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz.), tiene un esposo (Basilio Huanca, agricultor) y seis hijos de 6 hijos de 12, 10, 8, 6, 4 y 2 años de edad respectivamente.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro (el monto será destinado para la compra de ganado), la evaluación realizada califica favorablemente su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cattle and produce more milk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Amor Y Caridad Group

texts.es:
Hello.  We belong to the Amor y Caridad Group.  Our ages are 58, 42, 46 and 54 and we all reside at the base of Juan A. Lainez Hill in the capital city of Tegucigalpa.  We have known each other for more than 20 years. 
We all work making and selling tortillas.  It’s worth mentioning that the tortilla is a staple food in our city because it always accompanies breakfast, lunch and dinner respectively.  The majority of our population eats tortillas with all three meals.  We sell our product to our neighbors and to nearby eating establishments in our neighborhood.  Around here there are many places to eat because our national soccer stadium is located very close to us.
With our jobs we have helped our families get ahead.  But we need financial assistance in order to increase our production and make more sales and with the earnings be able to feed our families.  Thank you.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.



hola nosotras pertenecemos al grupo Amor y Caridad, nuestras edades son 58, 42, 46 y 54 años, todas residimos en las faldas del Cerro Juan A. Lainez en la ciudad Capital Tegucigalpa, tenemos mas de 20 años de conocernos, todas nos dedicamos a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, cabe mencionar que las tortillas es un alimento primario en nuestra ciudad ya que este se acompaña con el desayuno, almuerzo y cena respectivamente, la mayoria de nuestra poblacion come tortillas en los tres tiempos de comida.

nuestro producto lo vendemos a nuestros vecinos y a comedores cercanos de nuestra colonia, ya que por estos lugares hay bastantes comedores ya que el estadio nacional de futbol queda muy cerca de nosotras.

con nuestros trabajos hemos logrado sacar adelante a nuestras familias, pero necesitamos ayuda crediticia para poder aumentar nuestras producciones y tener una mayor venta, y con las ganancias poder alimentar nuestras familias. gracias

loans.use: Purchase corn, corn meal, firewood, lime, salt and water.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Hello. We belong to the Mujeres Emprendedoras Group and are Jesus Henríquez, 60 years old, María Ramírez, 28, Lidia R., 41, and Mirta R., 37 years of age. We’ve known each other for several years and are good friends. Our quality is punctuality in our payments and we are very honest in our daily activities.

All of us work doing different things. For example, one of us works as a seamstress making women’s clothing like dresses, blouses and pants. Another of us sells chickens. Another sells cosmetics and, lastly, one of us has a store called a “pulpería” where she sells products that are commonly consumed every day like milk, cheese, beans, rice, sugar, salt, tortillas, lard, etc.

At this time, we are requesting monetary assistance because we want to grow the businesses that, with a lot of effort and dedication, we have established. For that reason, we’re asking you for help so that you will assist us. With the earnings we obtain we will be able to maintain our homes because life in our country gets harder all the time. Thank you. Goobye.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

hola nosotras pertenecemos al grupo Mujeres Emprendedoras las cuales somos Jesus H. de 60 años, Maria R. de 28 años, Lidia R. de 41 años y Mirta R. de 37 años de edad. tenemos varios años de conocernos y ser muy amigas, nuestra cualidad es la puntualidad en nuestros pagos y que somos muy honrradas en nuestras actividades diarias. todas nos dedicamos a diferentes cosas por ejemplo una de nosotras se dedica a la costura de ropa para dama como ser vestidos, blusas y pantalones, otra de nosotras se dedica a vender pollos, otra de nosotras se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y la ultima tiene una tienda de venta de productos de consumo popular (pulperia) en la que vende leche, queso, frijoles, arroz, azucar, sal, tortillas, manteca, etc. en estos momentos estamos solicitando ayuda monetaria ya que queremos sacar adelante nuestros negocios que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacion logR. establecer, por tal razon pedimos la ayuda a ustedes para que nos ayuden. con las ganancias que obtengamos podremos mantener nuestros hogares ya que la vida en nuestro pais se vuelve cada vez mas dificil. gracias, adios.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics for sewing, chickens and products to be sold in a general store

loans.name: Brenda Leticia

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Brenda M..  I work selling products that are commonly consumed every day.  I have had my business for several years and, together with my husband, have worked to make it successful.  I have two children and we have managed to help them get ahead in their studies.

At this time I need help in order to increase my inventory because the demands of my clients are great and they are insisting that I buy other products and offer a larger variety.  The truth is, this business is the only thing that generates income to sustain my family and for that reason we have decided to grow it in order to support both my business and my family.  The good thing is that in the evenings I have the help of my two children who tend to my business and, thanks to God, everything is going well for us.  Thank you very much.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.



hola mi nombre es Brenda M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace varios años, junto con mi esposo hemos luchado para sacar adelante nuestro negocio, tengo dos hijos los cuales hemos logrado sacarlos adelante en sus estudios, en estos momentos nesecito una ayuda para poder incrementar mi inventario ya que la demanda de mis clientes es grande, y ellos me estan exigiendo que compre otros productos y que tenga mayor variedad, la verdad esta actividad es la unica que me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, por lo que hemos decido hacerla mas grande y asi poder sacar adelante mi negocio y mi familia.

lo bueno es que por las noches tengo la ayuda de mis dos hijos para la atencion de mi negocio, y gracias a Dios todo nos esta saliendo muy bien

muchas gracias.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, basic grains, eggs, beans, lard, salt, sugar, jellies, gelatins, churros, crackers, bread, candies, coffee, razors, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Maria Antonia's Group

texts.en:
Antonia is married and a 48-year-old mother of 5 children. She has a grocery store at her home in the Vista Alegre neighborhood. She also travels to the regional fairs where she sells fruit. 

María is separated. She is 56 and has 3 children. She travels to the regional fairs 3 times a week where she sells sweets and breads she first buys wholesale in the Ayacucho bakeries.

As for Lidia, she is married, is 59 and has 6 sons. She sells groceries in a stall at the F. Vivanco market in Ayacucho. On Saturdays she travels to fairs to sell groceries.

Antonia, Maria and Lidia belong to the Rubí Village Bank. They need respective loans of 300, 200, and 600 Nuevos Soles to buy oranges, apples, bananas, lollipops, gum, biscuits, rice, and sugar.

They would like their children to be professionals. They also dream about being in good health and expanding their businesses.

loans.use: to buy oranges, apples, bananas, lollipops, gums, biscuits, rice, and sugar for their businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.en:
Marina is married. She is a 40-year-old mother of 3 children. She sells meat at the Nery García market on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys animals at the cattle fair in Ayacucho. She also works as a member of the teaching staff in the local school.

Ceverina is married. She is a 49-year-old mother of 7 children. 3 times a week, she travels to the regional fairs where she sells fruit and carrier bags wholesale to the merchants. She also buys cereals and cheeses which she resells wholesale in Ayacucho. 

Fortunata is married, is 59 and has 6 children. She sells clothes in different fairs in the surrounding villages. She buys her products in Ayacucho. She also weaves pullovers on a machine and sells them at fairs. She buys cereals and cheeses at these fairs, then she resells them to her neighbours in Ayacucho.

Marina, Ceverina and Fortunata belong to the Rubí Village Bank. They need respective loans of 400, 1000, and 800 Nuevos Soles to buy pigs, bananas, apples, peaches, pullovers, blouses, and pants.

They dream that their children might become professionals, about expanding their businesses, and having their own business capital.

loans.use: to buy pigs, bananas, apples, peaches, pullovers, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Martha Teresa's Group

texts.en:
Luisa is married and is a 39-year-old mother of 3 children. She has a farm in the Chiara district, about 2 hours from Ayacucho, where she raises cattle which produce milk. She makes cheese she sells in Ayacucho. She also works at cereal and root crop farming.

Marcelina is separated, is 55 and has 5 children. She has a store at her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and meat. She travels to fairs twice a week where she sells clothes, fruit, vegetables, and groceries and she buys animals and cereals which she resells in her neighborhood.

Martha lives with her common-law husband and is a 28-year-old mother of 3 children. She has a car she uses as a taxi in Ayacucho, employing a driver. She travels to fairs where she sells fruit and buys cereals which she resells at the Nazarenas market.

Luisa, Marcelina and Martha belong to the Rubí Village Bank. They need respective loans of 600, 600, and 500 Nuevos Soles to buy rice and sugar but also for maintaining their houses and to buy a dairy cow. 

They dream about expanding their businesses, improving their houses, and having a dairy factory.

loans.use: purchasing rice and sugar, also maintaining their houses, and to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe belongs to the Rubí Village Bank where she learned to be punctual, responsible and to save money. She is married and is a 47-year-old mother of 7 children. Five live with her. She travels every Thursday to the Ayacucho jungle where she sells groceries and vegetables at the Pichari fair. She buys fruit from the producers which she then resells wholesale at the Ayacucho market. She also has a grocery store.

Cleofe needs a loan in the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles  to buy a refrigerator so that she can make lollipops and sell meat. She dreams about expanding her business and buying a car to carry her products. She also wants her children to study and to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator so that she can make lollipops and sell meat

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FINCA Peru - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Máximo Silvano

texts.es:
Máximo is 44 years old and a widower. He currently lives with his 3 children and his elderly mother.

He has always been a very hardworking person who does not allow himself to be defeated by trying circumstances. In spite of losing his entire crop due to freezing weather, he decided to raise animals, both small ones and larger ones, such as cattle. However, what he mostly does, because of its profitability, is raise guinea pigs. Every day he sees to their feeding, helped by his three children, who serve as his right arm to maintain the household.

When his wife passed away, Máximo had to take care of his family by himself and to this day he continues to do so because of the love he has for them. Being the only means of support for the family and his responsibilities as a father have motivated him to become reliable in meeting all his obligations.

Máximo would like to make improvements to his guinea pig breeding farm and his livestock stable and to be able to plant his fields for his own consumption. For this reason, he is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Máximo tiene 44 años, es viudo, actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos, y con su anciana madre.

Es una persona muy trabajadora, siempre está dedicándose a ello y no se deja derrotar por las circunstancias adversas, a pesar que ha perdido sus cultivos debido a la helada (perdió todas sus cosechas) decidió criar animales, tanto menores, como ganado, sin embargo, a lo que más se dedica, por su rentabilidad es a la crianza de cuyes, diariamente atiende su alimentación, ayudado por sus tres hijos, que son su brazo derecho para mantener su casa.

Al morir su esposa, tuvo que sobrellevar sólo a su familia, y lo ha vendido haciendo hasta hoy por el amor que le tiene. Ser el único sostén de su hogar y su responsabilidad como padre, le ha motivado a ser cumplidor de sus deberes.

Máximo desea mejorar su criadero de cuyes, mejorar su establo de animales y poder sembrar para consumo propio en sus campos de cultivo, por tal motivo es que presenta esta solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: Make improvements to his guinea pig breeding farm and livestock stable.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives with her common-law husband and is a 29-year-old mother of 2 children. 

She sells coca leaf (a leaf consumed by the area farmers as an ancestral tradition) streetside at the Ayacucho market. She buys the coca leaf at the National Firm of Coca and she is an accredited seller. She also sells cigarettes. She works from 4am to 5pm. She also has an urban transport vehicle that her husband drives.

Julia is a member of the Rubí Village Bank. She needs a loan in the amount of 1400 Nuevos Soles to repair her car. 
She dreams about expanding her business, buying another, more modern car and rebuilding her house out of better materials.

loans.use: to repair her car

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela is a 53 year old woman who lives with her current partner and a 17 year old daughter.

She sells groceries in her small store that took a lot of work to open four years ago in her community. She likes her business because she can take care of it and her home at the same time. She has some problems with the purchase of products and merchandise which she accomplishes in the nearby cities, which are located an hour away from her community, this makes the transport of her products very costly. The reason for her work is her 17 year old daughter, to whom she wishes to provide a quality education.

The money that she is currently requesting is for the purchase of more merchandise which will enable her to satisfy the needs of her customers and make her store the most popular in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Marcela es una mujer de 53 años que viven con su actual pareja y una hija de 17 años.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, en su pequeña tienda que abrió con mucho esfuerzo para su comunidad, hace ya 4 años, negocio que le agrada realizar porque atiende su hogar y su negocio al mismo tiempo, durante todo el día.Sin embargo, tiene ciertas dificultades en la compra de productos y mercadería, porque lo realiza en las ciudades más cercanas, que está a una hora de su comunidad y trasladar sus productos le trae muchísimos gastos. El motivo de su trabajo es su hija de 17 años, a quien desea brindarle una educación de calidad.

El dinero que requiere y solicita hoy es para la compra de mayor mercadería, y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, para lograr ser la tienda más concurrida dentro de su comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (groceries) for her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is a farmer dedicated to the growing of plantains. In spite of the fact that their fields are very far from their home, she and her husband are there early every morning to fertilize and cultivate them. They have been farming since they got married and this way supporting their home. This work takes almost all day, therefore they get up at dawn to prepare food for their children and then go to their fields. They consider their work beautiful since they can spend several hours a day together, the difficult part is the time in route in the sun.

The main driver of their work is the children, who being in school require a large financial investment.

This is the reason for the request of a loan for the purchase of plantings of plantains that will help increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda tiene 35 años y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Es agricultora, se dedica al cultivo de plátano, a pesar de que sus terreno se encuentran muy lejos de su hogar, ella y su esposo cada día muy temprano están ahí para abonarlos y cosechar. Desde que se casaron empezaron juntos con esta actividad para el sustento de su hogar.Este trabajo casi les toma gran parte del día, por ello se levantan de madrugada para preparar la alimentaron de sus hijos y luego marchar hacia sus terrenos.Consideran que su trabajo es muy hermoso, puesto que pueden compartir juntos varias horas, lo más difícil es el tiempo de caminata bajo el sol.

El motor de su trabajo son sus hijos, quienes son escolares y requieren de mayor inversión para su educación.

Es así, que solicitan este préstamo para la compra de plantaciones de plátanos que les ayude a incrementar sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Purchase of plantings of plantains to increase production.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Reyna's Group

texts.en:
Virginia lives with her common-law husband and is a 44-year-old mother of 4 children. She sells vegetables at the 12 de Abril market. She buys them in the mornings at the Ayacucho market.

Miriam is a 24-year-old single woman. She sells recorders, radios, and CDs; she resells them at the regional fairs where she travels 3 times a week.

Reyna is separated and is a 28-year-old mother of 2 children. She lives in the Chiara district. She has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat.

Virginia, Miriam and Reyna are members of the Rubí Village Bank. They need respective loans of 400, 600, and 600 Nuevos Soles to buy tomatoes, carrots, recorders, rice, sugar and flour. 

They dream about having a bigger business and having their own house. They want their children to be professionals.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, carrots, recorders, rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four school age children in a small house that they own, a house that took them a lot of effort to build.

Together with her husband, she makes a living in farming and as of late in the raising of chickens, the latter is going very well due the orders that she gets from her community. The tasks on the fields she performs in the afternoons and the tending of the animals in the mornings. She has a lot of affection for her animals. It is a complicated process to get the proper and balanced food for her chickens.

The main drivers behind her work are her children, especially her 17 year old daughter who wants to become a professional. Hilda and her spouse put all their effort to be able to make their daughter’s wishes come true.

The money that she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of chickens, to fatten them up and then sell the in the local markets. She ultimately would like to have a large quantity of animals in order to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda tiene 39 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos estudiantes, en una pequeña casa propia, que logró construir con mucho esfuerzo.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y hace poco tiempo, a la crianza de gallinas, donde le está yendo muy bien debido a los pedidos que tiene en su comunidad.Las tareas del campo las realiza por las tardes y la crianza de animales por las mañanas, ella le tiene mucho cariño a sus animales, sin embargo es complicado obtener el alimento adecuado y balanceado para sus gallinas.

El principal motor de su trabajo son sus hijos, sobre todo su hija de 17 años quien desea estudiar una profesión, para ello Hilda y su pareja se esfuerzan de poder realizar los deseos de su hija.

El dinero que solicita se invertirá en la compra de gallinas, para engordarlas y luego venderlas en los mercados de su localidad, y con el tiempo, tener una gran cantidad de animales para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Increae the quantity of chickens that she raises for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is 41 years old; some time ago she separated from her spouse and now bears the responsibility of her three children alone.

She is a farmer, dedicated to the growing of plantains, an activity that she has been accomplishing for more than 25 years, since she was very young. Her parents were farmers and they taught her the tools of the trade. This is the only way that she makes a living, therefore she spends most of her day on the fields, without neglecting her home. The growing of plantains is gratifying, for the profits that it brings and also for the contact with nature, which brings her a lot of joy. The most difficult part is to maintain her soil productive, due to the high prices of fertilizers. Her three children help her by giving her a reason for which to improve and grow day by day.

She needs to invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of fertilizer for her fields which will enable her to increase her production and sales in the next harvest. Little by little she can reach her goal of having a big store of fruit where she can buy and sell in large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Paulina tiene 41 años, hace un tiempo atrás se separó de su pareja, y ahora lleva sola la responsabilidad de sus tres hijos.

Es agricultora, se dedica al cultivo de plátano, actividad que realiza por más de 25 años, desde que era muy joven, ya que sus padres eran agricultores y fueron ellos quienes enseñaron a Paulina los gajes de este oficio. Con esta actividad es la única forma con la que ella se gana la vida, por ello, se dedica a sus terrenos de cultivo la mayor parte del día, sin descuidar su hogar. El cultivo de plátano es gratificante no solo por las ganancias que pueda darle, sino también por el contacto con la naturaleza, eso la llena de alegría. Lo más difícil es mantener a sus terrenos productivos, debido a los costosos precios de los abonos. Son sus tres hijos el motivo que le ayuda a mejorar y crecer día con día.

Requiere invertir el dinero que solicita en préstamo, en la compra de abono para sus terrenos, y así incrementar su producción y sus ventas para la próxima cosecha para que poco a poco pueda tener una gran bodega de fruta donde compre y venda por cantidades mayores.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for the planting of plantains, which will increase production.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children, having a stable family life makes her very happy.

She dedicates her time to growing plantains and yucca, hard work that she performs with her husband on their small farm located away from their home. They have been farming for 20 years. Farming takes up most of her day, for this reason she organizes her time so as not to neglect her children. They also help on the farm in the afternoons; their company makes this activity very pleasant for her. However, she is worried about the price increase of the fertilizers and other products that help to get good yield from her soil. Adelina’s goal is for her children to become professionals, this is the reason for her earnest work.

The proceeds from the loan that she is currently requesting will go toward the purchase pf plantings of plantains, yucca and beans which will increase her production and make it more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Adelina tiene 30 años vivir con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, lo que le alegra mucho, por tener una familia estable.

Se dedica al cultivo de plátano y yuca, que con mucho esfuerzo produce en compañía de su esposo en sus chacras, que están alejadas de su casa, viene realizando esta actividad hace 20 años. La agricultura le toma gran parte del día, por ello, se organiza de manera adecuada para no descuidar a sus hijos, quienes también le ayudan en las tardes con sus chacra, lo que hace de su actividad algo placentero y agradable, por la compañía de sus hijos. Sin embargo, le preocupa el alza de precio de los abonos y los demás productos que ayudan a una buena producción de los terrenos. La meta de Adelina es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales, por ellos trabaja con ahínco.

El préstamo que pide hoy será invertido en la compra de plantaciones de plátano, yuca y frijoles para aumentar sus productos y hacerlos más rentables.

loans.use: Purchase of plantings of plantains, yucca and beans to increase her production.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Mrs. Rum T. and her husband are farmers in Preak Kranh village in the Kandal province. She has infertile soil in the plantation field. Mrs. Rum T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and more vegetable seed to grow in her field.

Mrs. Rum T. is 55 years old and the mother of three children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending high school. Mrs. Rum T. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and more vegetable seed to grow on her plantation.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin U. lives in Preak Kranh village in the Kandal province. She grows vegetables in the field next to her village. She is a widow with five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The other four children help their mother in the field. Mrs. Yin U. faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support her field or to purchase more vegetable seeds to cultivate. Mrs. Yin U. decided to ask for loan to solve these obstacles.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field and purchase more vegetable seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. grows vegetable in Tep Or Chun village in the Kandal province. Her husband, Mr. Sokleng Seng, owns a small garage in the local village. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. Mrs. Sokha P. decided to ask for a loan to buy car equipment to meet the customer demand of her husband's business.

Mrs. Sokha P. is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy car equipment to meet customer demand  for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
