Mrs. Sarom S. sells dry fish in the local market in Tep Or Chun village in the Kandal province. Since her business is now going well and she has a lot of customers with different demands, Mrs. Sarom S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more dry fish to resell.

Mrs. Sarom S. is a 53-year-old widow with four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, while the others help with their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Koemsroeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Koemsroeng L. is a villager in Duem Pring village in the Kandal province. She is farmer and grocer. Some of her customers use credit to buy groceries. As a result, Mrs. Koemsroeng L. does not have enough money to invest in her business. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods in order to expand her current business.

Mrs. Koemsroeng L. is a widow with two children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods in order to expand her current business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao P. is a grocer in the local market in Svay Chuor village in the Kandal province. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Mao P. would like to expand. She has asked for a loan in order to buy more grocery products to sell to her customers.

Mrs. Mao P. is 43 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are employed in different jobs. The youngest child is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Ny Rann, grows vegetables in the local village. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroeb R. is a villager in Tep Or Chun village in the Kandal province. She is a farmer who does not have enough rice equipment to cultivate rice. She would like to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with cows to plow her rice field. Additionally, Mrs. Chroeb R. would use the rest of the loan to buy more rice seed to grow.

Mrs. Chroeb R. is a 49-year-old widow with five children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, while another is a construction worker. Another child is attending school while the remaining two are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with cows to plow her rice field. Mrs. Chroeb Ros would use the rest of the loan to buy more rice seed.

loans.name: Dai

texts.vi:
In the years prior to 1990, the financial situation of Ms. D. Thi Dai's family was met with difficulties and hardship. Her children were young and unable to help out the family. She did not farm and did some miscellaneous sales at the market, enough only to feed the family. In 1998 she joined TYM and her first loan was 30.00 USD to raise and sell chicken and raise pigs with average monthly income of 42.00 USD. After 10 years borrowing from TYM, she invested in retail business and raising animals which provided her family with a stable income and greatly improved their livelihood, Presently her family has a house located right on Highway 3 so she opened a shop selling refreshment and repairing cars and motorcycles. She also raises geese and chickens, and no longer has to sell at the market. Her children are now grown and are employed with outside companies. Their family's average monthly income is 605.00 USD and with the loan term of paying weekly, she finds it very agreeable. She herself has always been exemplary in carrying out the stipulations of the fund, and is always eager to assist other women in the group. Thus during her time with the fund, the other women liked and trusted her and elected her into the management group. This time she wishes to borrow 1150.00 USD to invest in a car-cleaning business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Nhung năm 1990 trở về trước kinh tế gia đình chị Đồng Thị Đãi còn gặp nhiều khó khăn, vất vả. Con còn nhỏ chưa giúp được gì cho gia đình, không làm ruộng nên chị đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ kiếm đủ ăn hằng ngày. Năm 1998 chị tham gia quỹ và vay vốn vòng 1 là 500.000 đồng để buôn bán gà thịt và chăn nuôi lợn nái mỗi tháng cũng cho thu nhập khoảng 700.000.đồng. Đến nay qua 10 năm vay vốn từ Quỹ chủ yếu đầu tư vào buôn bán và chăn nuôi kinh tế gia đình chị đã ổn định, đời sống ngày một nâng cao. Hiện tại gia đình chị có ngôi nhà ngay mặt đường quốc lộ 3 nên chị đã mở cửa hàng bán giải khát và làm dịch vụ rửa xe ô tô, xe máy. Ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi thêm ngan, gà thịt, mà không đi buôn bán ở chợ nữa, các con của chị đã trưởng thành và đi làm công ty. Tổng thu nhập của gia đình chị mỗi tháng khoảng 10.000.000 đ do vậy với cơ chế hoàn trả theo tuần chị thấy rất phù hợp. Bản thân chị luôn gương mẫu thực hiện quy định của Quỹ và sẵn sàng giúp đỡ chị em trong cụm nên trong suốt thời gian tham gia Quỹ chị luôn được chị em tin yêu và bầu vào ban quản lý cụm. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào làm sạch nội thất ô tô.

loans.use: Invest in services clean car

loans.name: Thin

texts.vi:
With 1 acre of rice paddy, her family in the years prior to 1995 had been growing rice, as well as raising pigs and fish to expand their income. She joined TYM in 1995 and her first loan was 18.00 USD to buy additional pigs and feed. After starting to see a profit, she continued to invest in raising pigs. For the past 10 years, the loans she borrowed had been invested in raising pigs and fish, which brought in good income averaging about 1815.00 USD per year. Because of the continued improvement in her income, her children were able to go to school. Presently her family still raises pigs, and she spends about 605.00 USD in expenses and costs for a litter of 15 pigs, and brings in about 1210.00 USD for every litter. Therefore, repaying the loan every week is very agreeable for her. Besides, her husband and children also go to work and thus help increase their family's income. She wishes to borrow this time 1150.00 USD to invest in her pig farm.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Với một mẫu ruộng nên những năm trước 1995 gia đình chủ yếu làm ruộng, ngoài ra còn chăn nuôi lợn thịt, nuôi cá giống để phát triển kinh tế. Năm 1995 chị vào Quỹ và vay lần đầu với số tiền 300.000 đồng mua thêm lợn và thức ăn chăn nuôi , bước đầu chị thấy có lãi và tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Qua hơn 10 năm vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vào nuôi lợn và nuôi cá cho thu nhập khá cao, mỗi năm cũng được khoảng 30.000.000 đồng kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển nên các con chị cũng được học hành đầy đủ hơn . Hiện nay gia đình chị vẫn tiếp tục chăn nuôi và chi phí cho mỗi lứa lợn khoảng 15 con là 10.000.000 đồng, thu nhập từ mỗi lứa được 20.000.000 đồng do đó việc hoàn trả tiền tuần rất thuận lợi, ngoài ra chồng và các con chị còn đi làm thêm và cho thu nhập cao nên cũng chị rất nhiều trong việc xây dựng kinh tế gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 19.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Thi Tuyen's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. D. Thi Minh, born in 1962 (MS 03050003), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000 to buy marketing supplies. Her husband is a carpenter at the family business. Every day she sells pork meat, bringing in an average income of 150.000vnd/day. She and her husband struggL. with 3 very young children that is currently in school. She hopes to obtain a loan to help improve her family income. Presently, she is the leader of her loan group. She believes that this loan will give her the opportunity to D. more business. Her loan group consists of the following members:

  • Ms. D. Thi Minh, born in 1962 (MS 03050003), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to buy marketing supplies.
  • Ms. L. Thi Hoan, born in 1962 (MS 03050004), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to invest in woodshop.
  • Ms. N. Thi Thoi, born in 1961 (MS 03050006), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to invest in woodshop.
  • Ms. N. Thi Nha, born in 1962 (MS 03050007), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to buy marketing produce supplies.
  • Ms. D. Thi Khuong, born in 1977 (MS 03050002), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd for wood sculpting.
  • Ms. N. Thi Hoan, born in 1964 (MS 03050005), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to buy supplies for her tofu business.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

    Đinh Thị Tuyến, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 03050001), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc tại xưởng gỗ của gia đình, bản thân chị hàng ngày đi chợ bán thịt lợn có thu nhập theo ngày khoảng 150.000 vnđ / ngày. Vợ chồng chị có ba con đang đi học nên gia đình chị vẫn còn vất vả. Chị luôn mong muốn được vay vốn để đi chợ giúp kinh tế gia đình cải thiện. Đồng thời chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn sẽ tạo cơ hội để chị mạnh dạn, hoạt bát hơn trước. Nhóm vay của chị còn có: Đỗ Thị Minh, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03050003), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đi chợ. Lê Thị Hoan, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03050004), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng gỗ. Nguyễn Thị Thơi, sinh năm 1961 (Ms 03050006), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng gỗ. Nguyễn Thị Nhã, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03050007), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ hoa quả. Đỗ Thị Khương, sinh năm 1977 (Ms 03050002), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ gỗ. Nguyễn Thị Hoàn, sinh năm 1964 (Ms 03050005), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để mua đỗ về làm đậu phụ.

loans.use: sản xuất

loans.name: Thi Mai's Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Mai, sinh năm 1983 ( Ms 03070042 ), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng gỗ. Hai vợ chồng chị cùng nhau làm việc tai xưởng gỗ của gia đình, chồng chị là thợ mộc, còn chị phụ giúp những việc khác. Hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học nên vợ chồng chị luôn cố gắng làm việc để nuôi dậy các con trưởng thành. Bên cạnh nghề mộc, vợ chồng chị vẫn làm nông nghiệp. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.500.000 vnđ / tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn và được bầu làm nhóm trưởng năm người bao gòm: Trần Thị Quý, sinh năm 1968 (Ms 03070041), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng mộc. Đỗ Thị Hồng Lương, sinh năm 1973 (Ms 03070043), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư mua gỗ làm đồ thủ công. Trần Thị Vân, sinh năm 1953(Ms 03070040), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư kinh doanh đồ điện tử. Lê Thị Luân, sinh năm 1981(Ms 03070044), mức vay: 2.204.000 vnđ để đầu tư gỗ làm trạm khảm.

Ms. N. Thi Mai, born in 1983 (MS 03070042), is requesting a loan of 3.604.000vnd to invest in woodshop. Ms. Mai and her husband both work at the family woodshop, her husband is a carpenter, and their children help with other works. She has 2 small children that are school age. Her children motivate her and her husband to work hard to nurture and provide them with a better future. Beside carpentry, she and her husband are both farmers. The average family income is 3.500.000vnd/month. She has been elected leader from a group of five who are actively seeking loans.

  • Ms. T. Thi Quy, born in 1968 (MS 03070041), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to invest in woodshop.
  • Ms. D. Thi Hong Luong, born in 1973 (MS 03070043), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to invest in wood craft.
  • Ms. T. Thi Van, born in 1953 (MS 03070040), is seeking a loan of 3.604.000vnd to invest in electronic business.
  • Ms. L. Thi Luan, born in 1981 (MS 03070044), is seeking a loan of 2.204.000vnd to invest in wood sculpting.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: sản xuất

loans.name: Thi Phuong's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. N. thi Phuong is 37 years of age, MS 11040017, she is quick-minded and a well-rounded person. After losing her husband, she became a single mother to 3 young children. Every day she looks after her livestock and buys produce to market. Her daily income is 150.000vnd. She was able to repay her last loan successfully. This time she is requesting a loan of 1.534000vnd to increase her produce inventory. Her group consists of the following members:

  • Ms. N. thi Tuong, MS 11040020, is seeking a loan of 2.006000vnd to buy food supplies for her livestock - pigs.
  • Ms. N. thi Anh, MS 11040029, is seeking a loan of 3.186000vnd to buy food supplies for her livestock – pigs.
  • Ms. N. thi Phuc, MS 11040009, is seeking a loan of 2.912000vnd to buy food supplies for her livestock – fishes.
  • Ms. N. thi Lien, MS 11040030, is seeking a loan of 2.006000vnd to buy seeds for farming
  • Ms. N. thi Chuc, MS 11040031, is seeking a loan of 3.186000vnd to increase her investment in livestock and woodshop/construction businesses.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

    chị Nghiêm thi Phương năm nay 37 tuổi ,MS 11040017 chị là một phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, đảm đang. Chồng mất,một mình chị nuôi 3 con nhỏ,hằng ngày chị chăn nuôi lợn, và đi chợ hoa quả mức thu nhập mỗi ngày được 150.000 VND / ngày. chu kỳ trước chị hoàn trả vốn rất tốt. Nay chị tiếp tục vay 1.534000 VND để bổ sung vốn đi chợ hoa quả. Nhóm chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Tường MS 11040020 vay mức 2.006000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Ánh MS 11040029 vay mức 3.186000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Phúc MS 11040009 vay mức 2.912000 VND để mua cám nuôi cá
  • chị Nguyễn thị Liên MS 11040030 vay mức 2.006000 VND để mua thóc bán
  • chị Nguyễn thị Chúc MS 11040031 vay mức 3.186000 VND để thêm vốn chăn nuôi lợn, làm nghề mộc

loans.use: Vay vốn để đi chợ và chăn nuôi

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
H. Khosiyat is 32 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She is a hard-working mother struggling to feed her children and parents (who are living with her) by selling the for traditional dresses. Khosiyat has survived despite difficult circumstances thanks to her optimism and strives above all to care for her two children. Like any mother, Khosiyat is doing her best to educate her children and to make them happy.

Khosiyat has a trading place in the central market of Dushanbe city. All the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring town Istaravshan. Khosiyat is trying to have a wide range of goods to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of clients with different levels of income. Today Khosiyat feels that with more working capital her business could generate more income, so she is asking for a loan of 1000 USD with a term of 12 months to jump-start the business and raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase new fabrics

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Hour E., 32, is married with four children and works with her husband on their plot of farmland growing rice crops and various kinds of vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers. They collectively earn approximately five dollars per day from selling their crops at the market.

The prices they can get for their rice and vegetables are increasing from day to day. The couple would like to take advantage of the price increases by improving their crop yields. A loan would allow them to purchase more vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and gasoline to operate a water-pump for irrigating their crops. They would then have a higher inventory of produce and would increase their sales.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seeds, fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Thi Man's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. Man Thi D., MS 11040006, 45 years of age is very focused and hard working. Besides working in the field (growing wheat and seasonal vegetables), she also raises livestock that include pigs and chickens. She was able to pay her last loan successfully. Her last business loan was also a success. Through good money management, she was able to purchased things for her family. Her accomplishment made her happy and even more motivated to continue doing business, seeking out more loans. This time she is asking for a loan of 3.828000vnd to invest into her family tradition of woodshop/construction work, stabilizing and increasing hers and her family income. The following are members of her group:

  • Ms. T. thi Thu, MS 11040011, is seeking a loan of 3.360000vnd to buy wood for her wood shop business.
  • Ms. N. Thi Lan, MS 11040027, is seeking a loan of 2.242000vnd to buy pigs for breeding.
  • Ms. N. Thi Thi, MS 11040007, is seeking a loan of 2.434000vnd to buy machinery for her family carpentry business.
  • Ms. N. thi Nhinh, MS 11040018, is seeking a loan of 2.242000vnd to buy livestock food supplies - ducks.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

    chị Mẫn thị Đố MS 11040006, chị Đố năm nay 45 tuổi là người rất chăm chỉ. Chị không chỉ làm ruộng ( trồng lúa, hoa màu theo mùa), chăn nuôi lợn, gà...Chu kỳ trước chị đã trả vốn rất tốt và đã hỗ trợ được Chị trong việc tích kiệm tiền để mua tài sản trong gia đình. Điều đó đã làm Chị rất vui và rất muốn tham gia vay tiếp, chu kỳ vốn này Chị đăng ký vay mức 3.808000 VND để thêm vốn phát triển nghề mộc của gia đình nhằm ổn định, phát triển kinh tế gia đình mình hơn nữa. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm chị :

  • chị Trương thị Thu MS 11040011 vay mức 3.360000 VND để mua gỗ phát triển nghề mộc
  • chị Ngô thị Làn MS 11040027 vay mức 2.242000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thi MS 11040007 vay mức 2.464000 VND mua máy làm mộc của gia đình
  • chị Nguyễn thị Nhinh MS 11040018 vay mức 2.242000 VND để mua cám vịt

loans.use: vay vốn chăn nuôi và làm nông nghệp

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Mrs. Theng S. L., 27, is married with one small child and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She weaves silk cloth and twice a month she sells the cloth to a broker. The silk cloth will be used by a tailor to sew a very traditional dress commonly used for Cambodian people when they attend weddings, festivals and other important ceremonies. The price of silk cloth can cost from $50 up to $120 per dress.

Mrs. Theng S. L. can make around $40 to $50 every two weeks. In order to make her business more sustainable and meet her growing customer needs, Mrs. Theng S. L. would like to use her loan to purchase silk in bulk to produce more silk cloth.

loans.use: To buy silk in bulk to produce more clothes.

loans.name: Thi Thanh's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. N. Thi Thanh, MS 11040008, is 48 years of age. Every day she and her husband (who also work for hire), raises, breed and sell cattles. Her family average daily income is about 100.000 vnd/day. She has been a part of this organization for quite some time and has been good with repaying past loans. Presently, she is asking for a loan of 2.912000 vnd to buy food supplies for her livestocks. The following people are members of her group:

  • Ms. N. Thi Hao, MS 11040028, is seeking a loan of 2006000vnd to buy marketing supplies.
  • Ms. N. Thi Dinh, MS 11040013, is seeking a loan of 3.808000vnd for convenience store business.
  • Ms. T. thi Minh, MS 11040019, is seeking a loan of 3.808000vnd to buy livestock food supplies.
  • Ms. T. Thi Vui, MS 11040016, is seeking a loan of 1.534000vnd to buy marketing supplies.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn N., Kiva volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn thị Thanh MS 11040008 năm nay chị 48 tuổi,hàng ngày chị và chồng đi làm thuê, chăn nuôi lợn giống để bán,mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình mỗi ngày từ 100.000VND/ngày.Chị đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình qua một chu kỳ và trả vốn rất tốt. Nay chị tiếp tục đăng ký vay 2.912000 VND để mua cám lợn. Các thành viên trong nhóm chị :

  • chị Nguyễn thị Hảo MS 11040028 vay mức 2006000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Định MS 11040013 vay mức 3.808000 VND để kinh doanh
  • chị Trần thị Minh MS 11040019 vay mức 3.808000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • chị Trần thị Vui MS 11040016 vay mức 1.534000 VND để thêm vốn đi chợ

loans.use: làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi

loans.name: Tik

texts.en:
Mrs. Tik T., 41, is married with seven children and works as a rice farmer. She earns approximately three dollars per day. In her area, she can grow rice twice a year, dry season and rainy season. The process of growing rice in the dry season takes six months from planting to harvesting. In the rainy season, the process takes three months.

Mrs. Tik T. is requesting a loan to purchase piglets to breed during the time when she is not harvesting rice. This would provide her family with some additional income.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed for additional income.

loans.name: Nghia's Group

texts.vi:
Ms. C. Thi Nghia was born in 1964. She is asking for loan amount of 250.00 USD to invest in her retail shop and to purchase things for her family. She and her husband have 2 grown sons, who work as carpenters, and thus they have a stable and steady income. Every morning, Ms. Nghia would go buy pork and re-sell them to the community. Once the meat are all sold, she would return home to help her family with household chores and the retail shop. Her family's average income is 310.00 USD per month. By borrowing and slowly repaying the loans, she feels it agrees with her family so she likes it very much and, along with others in her village, she signs up to borrow money. Her loan group consists of: Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, born in 1981, loan amount 225.00 USD to invest in a wood mill; Ms. Đỗ Thị Cảnh, born in 1967, loan amount 225.00 USD to invest in raising chickens; Ms. Phạm Thị Nguyện, born in 1962, loan amount 225.00 USD to invest in small retail business; Ms. Đỗ Thị Thắng, born in 1962, loan amount 225.00 USD to invest in a restaurant; Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hưởng, born in 1963, loan amount 225.00 USD to invest in a shop selling sweets and refreshment.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

C. Thị Nghĩa, sinh năm 1964 (Ms 03050008), mức vay: 4.028.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng tạp hóa và đi chợ. Vợ chồng chị có hai con trai đã trưởng thành và là thợ mộc nên có thu nhập thường xuyên, ổn định. Vào mỗi buổi sáng, chị Nghĩa thường đi mua thịt lợn về đầu làng bán lẻ phục vụ những người dân. Hết hàng, chị lại chở về nhà giúp chồng con các công việc nội chợ và bán hàng tạp hóa. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 5.000.000 vnd / tháng. Với những khoản vốn vay trả dần là rất phù hợp với gia đình chị nên chị rất thích và cùng những người trong làng đăng ký vay vốn. Nhóm vay của chị gồm có: Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, sinh năm 1981(Ms 03050011), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư xưởng mộc. Đỗ Thị Cảnh, sinh năm 1967 (Ms 03050010), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi gà. Phạm Thị Nguyện, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03050012), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đi chợ buôn bán nhỏ. Đỗ Thị Thắng, sinh năm 1962 (Ms 03050009), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng ăn uống. Nguyễn Thị Hưởng, sinh năm 1963 (Ms 03050013), mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để dầu tư cửa hàng bán bánh kẹo, nước ngọt.

loans.use: manufacture

loans.name: Mun

texts.en:
Mrs. Mun T., 35, is married with two children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has worked as a rice farmer since 1991. At the same time, her husband started operating a recycling business. He buys recycling items from different locations and resells them to the recycling plant.

Her two dollar daily income and her husband's four dollar daily income is barely enough to cover the family's expenses. This couple is requesting a loan to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to use for his business. A motor-bike will allow him to travel further distances to collect recyclable items, thus improving his amount for resale to the plant. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Mun T. is not available).

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for business transportation

loans.name: Phov

texts.en: Mrs. Phov P., 26, is a mother of two children who are too young to attend school. She and her husband are rice and livestock farmers. Collectively they earn approximately eight dollars per day. The couple would like to use a loan to increase the number of chickens they raise and purchase a motor-bike for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and a motor-bike for the buisness

loans.name: Harriet Kyosimire` S Group

texts.en:
Harriet K. is the leader of a group of four women. She is 35, married and has three children that are 15, 13, and 11 years of age.  All of her children are currently in school.  

Harriet has been selling old clothes in Owino Market, one of the largest markets in Kampala, for the past ten years.  She buys the shoes from other sellers in the market and then resells them.  Harriet works six days a week selling her clothes to men and women.  The biggest hurdle she faces in running her business is the escalating price of clothes.

Harriet plans on using this current loan to increase her stock of clothes.  She has been working with MCDT for the past five years.  Harriet originally decided to work with MCDT because they help women and she didn't have her own money to make her business successful.

Since Harriet began working with MCDT, she has been able to pay school fees for all her children and purchase enough food to feed her family.  Harriet hopes to one day buy a plot of land and build a house rather than rent a house as she does currently.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Mrs. Khoem L. lives in Ank Doung Village in Kandal Province and makes a living by fishing. Her business faces a problem because she does have enough equipment, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more of the items she needs to do her work. Her husband, Mr. Phath Phan, is a pig breeder. Mrs. Khoem L. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who attend school. Last year, one of her children got dengue fever and she had to spent $75 to cure the disease. This is why Mrs. Khoem L. does not have enough money to buy the equipment on her own.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Mrs. Soem S. lives in Ank Doung Village in Kandal Province. She is a garment-factory worker who makes a small salary with which she supports her family. Her husband, Mr. No Thol, is a recycling collector who gathers cans, empty bottles and plastic to sell. Mrs. Soem S. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or attend school. She and her family live in an old house because they have a small income. Mrs. Soem S. would like to build a new house but does not have enough money, so she has decided to ask for a loan, which she will add to her savings to achieve her goal. Previously, Mrs. Soem S. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy a new motorbike and has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To improve her living conditions by building a new house.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Mr. Soy T. is a farmer and pig breeder in Ank Doung Village in Kandal Province. Because his rice field is far from an irrigation system, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump. His wife, Mrs. Lab Veth, sells Khmer noodles in the local village. Mr. Soy T. is 64 and the father of a child who is employed in a garment factory. Previously, Mr. Soy T. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy piglets for breeding and has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a pump to water his rice field.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Mrs. Muth K. is a villager in Roka Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. La Touch, are fishermen who can gather little fish because they do not have enough equipment to catch larger ones. Mrs. Muth K. is applying for a loan to buy equipment to catch larger fish as a way to improve her business and her living conditions. Mrs. Muth K. is 33 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom breeds fish while the others attend school.

loans.use: To buy equipment to improve her business and her living conditions.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov K. and her husband, Mr. Seng Suon, are farmers in Roka Village in Kandal Province. They grow two crops a year on their land. During the rainy season, they grow rice, and in the dry season they grow vegetables. Mrs. Pov K.’s plantation faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer for her field and rice seeds to plant. That is why she is applying for this loan.  Last year, Mrs. Pov K. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to buy fertilizer and hire a laborer with cows to plow her rice field. She has paid it back fully.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

loans.name: Ki

texts.en: Mrs. Ki C. lives in Takul Village in Kandal Province. She makes a living growing different kinds of vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Heang Heng, is a contractor who earns a small income. They have one child who is too young to work or study. Mrs. Ki C.’s family lives in poor conditions in a very old house. Mrs. Ki C. is applying for a loan which she will add to her saving to build a new house. Last year, her child came down with typhus and she had to spend $100 to cure the disease. This is why she does not have enough money to build the house without the loan.

loans.use: To pay for part of the cost of building a new house.

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mrs. Kea C. is a farmer in Takul Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Phalla Sok, sells vegetables for a living and also helps his wife farm when he has time. Because his business is doing well, he would like to expand it. That is why Mrs. Kea C. has decided to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike which he can use to carry vegetables door-to-door for resale. Previously, Mrs. Kea C. obtained a loan from TPC (Thaneakea Phum Cambodia, Ltd) to grow vegetables and paid it back successfully.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to carry vegetables door-to-door for resale.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Mrs. Toch K., 28, is a grocer who lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. K. sells vegetable and fruit that she buys from growers in her area and resells for a profit. She earns approximately $1.8 per day while her husband is a farmer and earns around $1 per day. They have two children, both of whom are in school. Because her business is growing and to reduce the cost of transportation, K. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to use to transport vegetables and fruit to sell.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to use to transport vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng S. and her husband, Mr. Thorn Tong, are farmers in Chek Village in Kandal Province. They have two children who attend school. Last year, Mrs. Yeng S. faced a problem in the rainy season because water flooded her plantation and damaged her crops. Because of this, Mrs. Yeng S. does not have enough money to grow a rice crop this year. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to grow rice.

loans.name: Vochleang

texts.en: Mrs. Vochleang L. is 56 years old and lives in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. She practices a form of Khmer traditional healing among the people in her village. Since business is strong, Mrs. Vochleang L. wants to expand her practice by getting a loan to buy more traditional medicines to sell. Mrs. Vochleang L. is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more traditional medicine to sell.

loans.name: Daisy Nabukalu's Group

texts.en:
Daisy N. is the leader of a group of four women.  She is 46 and single with four children.  All of her children are in school.  Daisy lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Daisy has a small retail shop in Mpererwe. The market for her business is fair.  She plans to use this loan to add more stock to her business which will help her to pay her children's school fees and sustain her current living standards.

Daisy has successfully repaid four loans since she began working with MCDT.  She hopes to one day own her own house.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mr. Lun C. is 69 years old and lives in Bang Village in Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sok Chiv, are farmers. They have a child who is employed in a garment factory. Since their child’s work place is far from their home, Mr. Lun C. spends a lot of money on his child's commute. That is why Mr. Lun C. decided to ask for a loan which he will combine with his saving to buy a new motorbike for his child to use to commute to and from work. The motorbike will mean a big reduction in his family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his child to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run R. is 62 years old and lives in Makak Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who grows rice during the rainy reason and vegetables in the dry season. This is the rainy season, so Mrs. Run R. needs to cultivate rice, but unfortunately she does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in the field and to buy fertilizer for her crops. That is why she is applying for a loan to achieve these goals. Mrs. Run R. is a widow with five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend school.

loans.use: To hire laborers to work on her rice field and to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Thi Thoa Chu Group

texts.vi:
Ms. C. Thi Thoa is 30 years old. She is a very dynamic and responsible woman. Her family has several businesses: selling coal, selling pork, raising pigs, and farming. She has borrowed before and has repaid the loans. This time she would like to borrow 240.00 USD to buy feed for pigs. In her group there are the following members: Ms. C. thị Lâm, loan amount 140.00 USD to invest in retail shop; Ms. C. thị Huế, loan amount 205.00 USD to buy pigs; Ms. Ngô thị Tý, loan amount 210.00 USD to raise pigs and buy feed for pigs; Ms. Nguyễn thị Duyên, loan amount 240.00 USD to raise pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

Chị C. thị Thoa năm nay 30 tuổi MS 09050066 chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động, đảm đang, gia đình chị có khá nhiều hoạt động tạo thu nhập: bán than, bán thịt lợn, chăn nuôi lợn, ttrồng trọt...Chị đã tham gia vay vốn và trả rất tốt, lần này chị đăng ký tham gia vay ở mức 3.808.000 VND để bổ sung vốn mua cám lợn. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên

  • Chị C. thị Lâm MS 09050015 vay mức 2.242.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng
  • Chị C. thị Huế MS 09050065 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • Chị Ngô thị Tý MS 09050045 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để chăn nuôi và mua cám lợn
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Duyên MS 09050043 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn

loans.use: retail

loans.name: Fatuma Kazigati's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma K. is the leader of a group of four women.  She is 50 and married.  Fatuma lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.
Fatuma runs a small restaurant in Kiguli Zone.The market for her business is fair.The greatest challenge Fatuma faces is the limited availability of capital.

Fatuma plans to use this loan to expand her business.  In doing so, she will also be able to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Chamruen

texts.en: Mrs. Chamruen T. is 51 years old and lives in Makak Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Cheang Phang, are farmers. They have five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The remaining two are attending school. Mrs. Chamruen T.’s house does not have a kitchen so she must cook under the house, which makes it difficult for her to prepare good food for her family. That is why she decided to apply for a loan to build a kitchen.

loans.use: To build a kitchen to cook food for her household.

loans.name: Chu Thi Nghien Group

texts.vi:
Ms, C. Thi Nghien is 40 years old. Her family has 2 children and very good income. Her husband delivers merchandise and selling to businesses. She raises pigs and sells chickens and pigs. She had borrowed money before and repaid. She would like to borrow 205.00 USD to purchase additional merchandise to sell. In her group there are the following members: Ms. Phạm thị Ngà, loan amount 205.00 USD to buy pigs to raise; Ms. Ngô thị Bình, loan amount 205.00 USD to invest in a retail shop; Ms. Ngô thị Liên, loan amount 205.00 USD to invest in a silkworm shop; Ms. Hoàng thị Thức, loan amount 130.00 USD to raise chickens and ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị C. thị Nghiên năm nay 40 tuổi MS 09050017,gia đình chị có 2 con và có khá nhiều thu nhập: Chồng lái xe ô tô chuyên vận chuyển hàng hoá kinh doanh, buôn bán. Chị vừa chăn nuôi lợn, bán cám gà, cám lợn...C. kỳ trước chị đã tham gia vay vốn và trả rất tốt. Nay chị tiếp tục đăng ký vay 3.360.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên :

  • Chị Phạm thị Ngà MS 09050019 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để mua lợn giống
  • Chị Ngô thị Bình MS 09050020 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để bán hàng tạp hoá
  • Chị Ngô thị Liên MS 09050021 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để làm hàng tơ tằm
  • Chị Hoàng thị Thức MS 09050093 vay mức 2.242.000 VND để chăn nuôi vịt gà

loans.use: retail business

loans.name: Regina Bayiyana's Group

texts.en:
Regina Bayiyama is the leader of a group of five women.  She is 55 and widowed with five children.  Her youngest child is in school while the eldest four are married and working.  Regina lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Regina has been sewing and selling charcoal for the last 10 years.  She travels to the village to get her supply of charcoal and then sells it to families in small quantities. The greatest challenges Regina faces are thieves, floods and competition.

Regina plans on using this loan to purchase more charcoal.  Since she began working with MCDT, Regina has been able to purchase lorries of charcoal rather than just sacks.  This increase in stock has allowed Regina to garner more profits.  She has used this increased revenue to pay her children's school fees, to expand into selling roasted chickens and to purchase a house.  

Regina hopes to continue diversifying her businesses by one day expanding into selling dried fish.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla S. is 37 years old, is married and a father of 3 children. He lives in Avétonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Mr. S. has been running a general food store for many years. With this second credit, he would like to build the supplies of goods such as drinks, sandals, boxed and canned goods and various other products with the goal of increasing the capacity of his trade. The income from this activity will help him to better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Komla S. est âgée de 37 ans, marié et Père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur S. tient une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis des années. Avec ce second crédit, il souhaite faire davantage d’approvisionnement de ses stocks de marchandises et autres comme les boissons, les sandalettes, les boites de conserves et les autres produits variés en vue d'augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les benefices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Build stock of goods such as drinks, sandals, boxed and canned goods, and other products

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla D. is 28 years old, is married and a father of a child. To earn money he operates a spare parts shop on two wheels in Avétonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. With this credit, his second from FECECAV, he would like to build the supplies for his shop in order to meet the requests from his customers. Specifically, he wwould like to buy and resell motor bike parts imported from Nigeria. With the improvement of his activity, he can better provide for the needs of his child and thus take part in the development of his community.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Komla D. est âgé de 28 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Pour gagner de l’argent il opère une boutique des pièces détachées à deux roues à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, son deuxième de FECECAV, il souhaite augmenter le stock de sa boutique pour répondre aux demandes de ses clients. Spécifiquement, il veut acheter les pièces moto généralement importées du Nigeria pour revendre. Avec l’amélioration de son activité, il peut mieux subvenir aux besoins de son enfant et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: Build supplies for his shop

loans.name: Kweku

texts.en: Kweku A. sells drinks at the seashore and his main customers are the fishermen. He is also a fisherman as an extra job. He is married, but his wife's income is not sufficient for Kweku and his 4 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew A. sells wood and he says life can be better if you assist him to buy more wood to increase his profit margin. He is married, but his wife's income as a fishmonger is not sufficient for Mathew and his 3 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Zineta

texts.en: Zineta Krličević is a 50 year old woman from the town of Doboj.  She is married and her husband receives a small pension.  To support themselves, they have been farming. They grow tomatoes, peppers, and potatoes. This is Zineta's 2nd loan from ŽZene za ZŽene. She is requesting $950 to buy more seeds as well as pesticides and compost for farming.  In the next months, Zineta will be growing lots of potatoes, as these will be a good item to sell through the fall and winter.  Her husband's pension is too small for the both of them, so she needs the additional income from these sales to make sure they can support themselves.

loans.use: to buy seeds and materials to help grow potatoes

loans.name: Regina Namuli's Group

texts.en:
Regina N. is the leader of a group of 5 women.  She is 43 and a single mother with four children ages 20, 18, 16 and 14.  Regina lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Regina has been selling beer at her bar for the past 8 years.  The market for her beer is fair.  Regina plans to use this loan to boost her business by increasing her stock.  

Since she began working with MCDT, Regina has successfully repaid eight loans.  With these loans, Regina's business has prospered and with the profits she has been able to educate her children and look after her family.

Regina hopes to one day be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
Fatima N. is 46 years old, married with 4 children and 1 other person in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Lélo in Thiès for 8 years. She would like to strengthen her business selling local fruits, such as mangoes. Fatima hopes to improve the living conditions of her children. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Fatima N., 46 ans, mariée, 04 enfants et 1autre personne en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lélo à Thiès depuis 8 ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de fruits locaux comme les mangues. Fatima souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell local fruit

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru:
Gulsonoy Morodova lives in Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is 34 years old, married and has 4 children. Gulsonoy has high school education. She has been in the retail sector for 6 years. Gulsonoy has a small trading location at a local market where she sells children clothes and shoes. This business helps her support her large family. Gulsonoy's husband is currently out of work. Before the start of the new school year, the client wants to increase the variety of goods she sells. This is why she needs money. Gulsonoy decided to obtain a loan; she plans to repay it within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Муродова Гулсуной жительница города Вахдат .Возраст 34 года, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее .Вот уже более 6 лет клиентка занимается торговлей. На местном рынке она имеет небольшую торговую точку,где торгует детской одеждой и обувью. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ей содержать свою большую семью.Муж Гулсуной временно не работает. Перед началом нового учебного года клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Для чего ей нужны деньги.Гулсуной решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase goods variety

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa G. is 53 years old, widowed with 7 children and 10 other people in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Lélo in Thiès for 8 years. She is seeking a loan to buy and re-sell local fruit such as mangoes. With her income, she improves the living conditions of her children. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Awa G., 53 ans, veuve avec 07 enfants et 10 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lélo à Thiès depuis 8 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre des fruits locaux comme les mangues. Avec ses revenus elle améliore les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell local fruit

loans.name: Davrigul

texts.ru:
Davrugul B. lives in Vahdat, Tajikistan. She is 30 years old, married and has two children. She has a high school diploma. Davrigul has been in business for over five years. She has a small trading location where she sells dishes and equipment. Davrigul buys goods from wholesalers and then resells them. She is able to support the family with her profits. This business is one of the sources of income for her family. Currently, the client wants to purchase goods from wholesalers and needs money for this. Davrigul decided to ask for a loan and plans to pay it back within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бердыева Давригул жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 30 лет, замужем , имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее.Более 5 лет клиентка занимается бизнесом. Она имеет небольшую торговую точку , где торгует посудой и бытовой техникой. Давригул закпаету оптовых поставщиков товар и реализует его в розницу .На доходы от своего бизнеса она содержит свою семью. Бизнес является одним из источников дохода ее семьи. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков товар,на что ей нужны деньги. Давригул решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna Diémé is 56 years old, married with 7 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Belfort for 6 and a half years. Her business consists of buying and re-selling honey and palm oil. She takes part in improving the living conditions, health, and education of her children. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Maimouna Diémé, 56 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 6 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre du miel et de l’huile de palme. Elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell honey and palm oil

loans.name: Oysifat

texts.ru:
Oysifat S. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 25, married with two children. She has finished high school. Oisifat buys and then sells children's clothing and shoes. She has a small selling spot at the market. Oysifat has been in this business for over four years. Currently, the client would like to increase the variety and amount of goods by purchasing fall shoes and clothes. She needs money to do this. This is why she decided to ask for a loan for 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Сафарова Ойсифат Эшонкуловна жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 25 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее. Ойсифат занимается куплей продажей детской оджеды и обувью .На рынке города она имеет небольшую торговую точку. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 4 лет. В данный момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки, закупить сезонную обувь и одежду. Для чего ей нужны денежные средства.Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase variety and amount of goods

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
Gulnora H. lives in the city of Tursunzade. She is 25 years old and has a high school education. Gulnora has a small trading location at the local market. She sells sugar and sweets. Gulnora lives with her parents who are retired. Therefore,she has to provide for the family. Business is the main source of income for her family. Gulnora wants to buy products from wholesale traders, which is why she needs money. She would like to receive a loan and plans to repay back within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Хайдарова Гулнора Юсуповна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 25 лет,образование среднее. Гулнора имеет на рынке города Турсунзаде небольшую торговую точку. Она торгует сахаром и сладостями. Гулнора живет с родителями пенсионерами. Поэтому содаржать семью ей приходится самой. Бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Клиентка хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков товар ,для чего ей нужны деньнги.Гулнора обратилась в нашу организацию за кредитом,планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Mahbuba N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. She sells glass jars at the local city market. The business helps provide her family with essential food products. Due to the current conservation season, Mahbuba wants to purchase additional merchandise. If she earns well this season, she will be able to feed her family during the winter. Her business earns no income during winter and spring. This is why Mahbuba decided to obtain a 12-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Нишонова Махбуба Эргашевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 30 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Махбуба на местном рынке города Турсунзаде торгует стеклянными банками. Этот вид деятельности помогает ей обеспечивать свою семью самыми необходимыми продуктами питания. Сейчас киентка хочет закупить товар,так как сейчас сезон консервирования.Если в этот сезон она хорошо поработает ,зимой она сможет прокормить свою семью.Так как с зимы до весны этот вид деятельности уже не приносит дохода. Пооэтому она решила взть кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Diariétou Raby

texts.fr:
Diariétou Raby Sané is 43 years old, married with 5 children in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Tenghory Transgambienne for 4 years. She would like a loan to buy and re-sell vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, and carrots. With her income, she contributes to paying her family's expenses. She would like to improve the living conditions, health, and education of her children. The loan she is asking for will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Diariétou Raby Sané, 43 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 4 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre des légumes comme des oignons, des tomates et des carottes. Avec ses revenus elle participe aux charges familiales. Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell vegetables

loans.name: Zarbibi

texts.ru:
Zarbibi M. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. She has a secondary education. Zarbibi sells sugar at the local Tursun-zoda market and has over 3 years experience in this business. She purchases sugar wholesale by bags and then sells it retail by kilograms. She needs the loan in order to purchase product wholesale. Zarbibi plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Зарбиби жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 51 год,замужем, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей сахарного песка. Реализует сахар на местном рынке города Турсунзаде. Имеет опыт в этой дейтельности более 3 лет. Она покупает сахар мешками оптом,а потом реализует его килограмми в розницу. Планирует закупить оптом товар, для чего ей нужны деньги.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase product

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Arame F. is 45 years old, married with 2 children and 3 other people in her care, and has been a member of the village bank of Lélo in Thiès for 8 years. She would like to buy and sell local fruits such as mangoes. Arame hopes to strengthen her business and improve the living conditions of her children. She is asking for a loan which will be reimbursed at the end of six months in a single payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Arame F., 45 ans, mariée avec 02 enfants et 03 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lélo à Thiès depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter et revendre des fruits locaux comme les mangues. Arame souhaite renforcer ses activités et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To sell local fruit

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Abdusalom N. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. He has a higher education and is a jurist. Because the low salary of law practice is not enough to support Abdusalom’s big family, he has a side business. He buys crop directly from local farmers and sells it to wholesale buyers. The business allows him to support his family. Currently, Abdusalom wants to increase cash flow and decided to obtain a 15 month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Носиров Абдусалом житель района Шахринав.Возраст 45 лет,женат , имеет 5 детей. Образование высшее, по специальности юрист. Так как заработная плата очень маленькая и ее не хватает на содержание его большой семьи клиент занимается бизнесом. Он скупает у местных крестьян товар прямо на полях и сдает товар оптовым закупщикам. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ему содержать свою семью. В данный момент Абдусалом хочет увелить денежный оборот ,поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase cash flow

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla A. is over 37 years old, married and a father of 3 children. He lives 100 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. He owns an air pump machine with which he repairs car and motor bike tires. With this new credit, he would like to invest into a new engine which seems to already be defective and causes frequent breakdowns. The renewal of his equipment will help him to spend less and save more.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Komla A. est âgé de plus de 37ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. II est propriétaire d’une machine de pompe à air dont il tient son exploitation pour réparer les pneux des voitures et moto. Avec ce nouveau crédit,il désire investir de nouveau en renouvellant le moteur qui semble être déjà amorti ce qui est source de fréquentes pannes . Le renouvellement duson équipement lui permettra de dépenser moins et d’épargner plus.

loans.use: Purchase of new motor

loans.name: Juramurod

texts.ru:
Juramurod B. lives in the Shahrinav district. He is 39 years old, married and has 5 children. He has an incomplete higher education and is a teacher by profession. However, he does not work as a teacher because the pay is low. Instead, he has been a taxi driver for the last 5 years. This work is the sole source of income for his big family. Juramurod’s wife takes care of their household and children. The loan is needed for car repairs. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina, Kiva Volunteer.

Бокиев Джурамурод житель района Шахринав.Возраст 39 лет, жнат, имеет 5 детей. Образование незаконченное высшее,по специальности учитель. Но по специальности не работает,так как заработная плата маленькая. Клиент 5 лет как работает таксистом. Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода его большой семьи.Так как жена клиентка не работает,она ведет домашнее хозяйство и воспитывает детей. Кредит клиент берет для ремонта автомашины.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi A. is a 42 year-old married craftsman and father of four children. To provide for the needs of his family, he carves wood with a reel-based machine in Avétonou, a village located approximately 95 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. With his first credit from FECECAV, Koffi would like to increase the capacity of his company. Specifically, he hopes to arrange his workshop (which was damaged in a storm) and to equip it with new equipment. Thanks to Kiva for the opportunity to improve his life.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Koffi A. est un artisan âgé de 42 ans, marié et père de quatre enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il tourne les bois grâce à une machine qui fonctionne à base des bobines à Avétonou un village situé à environ 95 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, Koffi veut augmenter la capacité de son entreprise. Spécifiquement, il espère aménager son atelier (qui avait subi un dégât causé par une tempête,) et doter son atelier de nouveaux équipements. Merci à Kiva pour l’opportunité d’améliorer sa vie.

loans.use: To arrange his workshop and to equip it with a new machine

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa Z. is a small business owner and is 32 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. To earn money, she works at the general market in Avétonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. With this first credit from FECECAV, she would like to buy bags of rice, sugar, salt and other products in order to build her supplies and subsequently resell them. With this growth, she could better answer the requests of her customers and provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Yawa Z. commerçante de petits détails est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent elle opère un marché général à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, elle espère acheter des sacs de riz, du sucre, du sel et autres produits variés pour augmenter son stock et revendre en détail. Avec cet agrandissement, elle peut mieux répondre aux demandes de ses clients et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of rice, sugar, salt and other products

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She is the mother of five children. She runs a malt business at Makangarawe in Temeke District. She also runs an animal feed shop, maintaining both layers and broilers and also is an agent for chicks from wholesale producers. The profit derived is used to feed her family and pay school fees for her children, and partly used for capitalization. She wants a loan of $1,200 to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her poultry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua O. is a fishmonger. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Efua and her 4 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Christian Rural Aid Network (CRAN) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ally

texts.en: Ally H. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. He sells a variety of fruits in a small market in Vituka. He purchases fruits from the Kariakoo city market in Dar-es-Salaam and sometimes direct from farmers then sells them for retail. The business helps him overcome his family's daily needs. He wants to expand the business but capital is limited. He requests a loan for $950 to expand his business.

loans.use: Expand his fruits and vegetables business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is divorced and is raising her son, Edward, alone. She is a new entrepreneur from Kahovka, Ukraine, where she runs her women's clothing business in the local city market. Valentina started her business because need forced her to support her family and find ways to provide for her son and herself. She is only a beginner in business, since she launched her venture only 7 months ago. Her turnover capital is about $2000. Net profit is about $700 each month.

Valentina is a determined entrepreneur. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Today, she is requesting a loan for 2500 Grivnas ($550 USD) to generate additional profit which will allow her to feel more financially secure. She believes that financial assistance in combination with her zeal, perseverance, and diligent work will someday help all her entrepreneurial dreams come true. 

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a daughter named Darya. She runs a small café in Kahovka, Ukraine. Her business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Tatyana has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in the trade for 13 years. Presently, her turnover capital is over $2000. Her monthly net profit is about $500.  

Tatyana would like a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($550 USD) to generate additional profit. We believe her natural ability to please her customers -- guessing their needs and offering speedy and courteous service -- will help Tatyana to achieve her goals, sustain her success, and consequently win the entrepreneurial game.  

Note: This is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando started his business when he was deported from the United States after working there illegally.

Once he arrived in Mexico, he started with part of the money he had sent to his wife and which she had saved. He bought his first lambs 3 years ago and from there, began a business buying and selling these animals. which has allowed him to generate income to support his wife and 3 children who are 10, 8 and 3 years old.

He needs a loan for US $300, which will be repaid in 6 months, to purchase more lambs. With your support, Armando will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Armando inició el negocio cuando lo deportaron D. Estados Unidos, ya que estaba trabajando ilegalmente en ese país.

Comenzó una vez que llego a México y con parte del dinero que había enviado a su esposa, mismo que ella ahorro, compro los primeros borregos hace 3 años y D. ahí comenzó el negocio D. compra y venta D. estos animales, lo que le ha permitido generar ingresos para mantener a su esposa y sus 3 hijos D. 10, 8 y 3 años.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas borregos. Con tu apoyo Armando saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase lambs.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with grown kids. She lives in Kahovka and runs her business located in the city market. Tatyana became an entrepreneur as a result of a desperate need to provide for her family's basic needs. Without money or savings she bravely started her small venture selling children's clothing. Tatyana has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $2400. Her monthly income is over $300. 

Tatyana is planning to use the loan of 4000 Grivnas to increase her seasonal stock. She is always ready to venture to realize her personal and financial goals. We believe the client has the determination to make her business expand following the route of success in providing a supplemental income to her household.

loans.use: To generate additional profit

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana lives in Nikopol and raises two sons. She owns a small vending store called "Men and Women" where she sells household chemicals and cosmetics. Tatyana offers a nice selection of inventory in her store and receives a good income. Currently, she has about $2000 in merchandise. Her monthly income is about $200. 

Tatyana has been running this business for two years already. She has been consistently increasing her stock and sales as a result. Today she is hoping to get a 3000 Grivna loan to add to assortment of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosk. Tatyana is hoping to see her business continually growing and expanding.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Jorge Saul

texts.es:
Jorge started his business when he got married and needed to support his wife, and now he supports her and his 2 children, who are 4 and 1 years old. He began 3 years ago with money he had saved, starting off buying 4 calves which he raised and sold.

He currently needs a loan for US $800, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy more livestock for resale. With your support, he will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge inició el negocio ya que cuando se caso, tuvo la necesidad de mantener a su esposa y ahora a ella y sus 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año. Comenzó hace 3 años que con dinero que tenia ahorrado, inicio comprando 4 becerros, mismos que crio y vendió iniciando así su negocio.

Actualmente el necesita un préstamo por US $800 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas animales para la venta. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase livestock.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two children, Oleg and Diana. He is a businessman from Zaporozhye. He runs his clothing venture in the local covered market. Vitalyi is very thorough and hard-working which helps him run his business efficiently. He has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, he has about $2400 in inventory. His gross income is about $1600. 

Vitalyi is seeking a 5500 Grivna loan to increase his turnover capital and increase his income as a result. He has seen different challenges along the way as after the reconstruction of the marketplace he had to move his to a different location. However, nothing could stop him, he says, and he decided to persevere and achieve even greater success. We believe this strong desire to strive for more and see his business develop will guarantee outstanding results and current loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase sales stock

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma is married and has 3 children, 17, 15, and 12 years old. She started her business to help out with the family ´s expenses. Seven years ago she began selling soft drinks and candy from her home to neighbors, and this allowed her to grow her business little by little until she was able to establish what is now her general store.

She needs a loan for US $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and have a better selection and as a result, to increase her sales. With your help, Emma will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Emma es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años. Inició el negocio para ayudar al gasto familia. Comenzó hace 7 años vendiendo en su casa refrescos y golosinas a sus vecinos y esto le permitió hacer crecer poco a poco su negocio hasta lograr establecer lo que es ahora su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y tener un mayor surtido, por ende aumentar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda Emma saldra adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #59787

loans.name: Silvanus

texts.en: Silvanus M. is a Tanzanian carpenter. He makes a variety of home and school furniture. He has been in the business for two years now. His customers are schools and home users. He needs a loan of  $550 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es:
Lázaro started his own business because any other job paid very little and he needed a higher income to take care of his family´s expenses and the needs of his children, who at that time were little and were studying. What he was paid in any company was not enough, so for this reason he started his own business. Taking advantage of his knowledge of metalworking, he started off more than 20 years ago making screens, doors and windows for acquaintances. Little by little his clientele grew until he was able to devote full time to metalworking; now he has more work and even an apprentice.

He needs a loan for US $1,200, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy another soldering machine so he can deliver his orders more quickly. With your help, he will continue to grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Lázaro inicio el negocio porque pagaban muy poco en cualquier otro empleo y el necesitaba un ingreso mas alto para solventar los gastos familiares así como las necesidades de sus hijos que en ese entonces eran muy pequeños y estaban estudiando y con lo que le pagaban en alguna empresa no completaba por ese motivo emprendió poco a poco su negocio aprovechando sus conocimientos sobre herrería comenzó hace mas de 20 años realizando mosquiteros, puertas, ventanas a conocidos y poco a poco fue aumentado su clientela hasta que definitivamente se dedico de lleno a la herrería ahora ya tiene mas trabajo e incluso cuenta con un ayudante.

El necesita un préstamo por US $1200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar otra maquina de soldar para que sea mas rápido la entrega de pedidos. Con tu ayuda el seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy machinery for soldering.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo has always had his business as a way of having his own source of employment, to cover the needs of his family, and to be able to educate his children and to buy his house. As he used to help one of his brothers in his repair shop when he was young, he learned to do this work, and this is why he started his own business. He started almost 20 years ago in his house, and he later started to save his profits and bought the land next to his house to locate his business. He could then give better service to his customers and generate more income.

He needs a loan of $1,200, which he will repay in 6 months, to purchase 2 machines for his repair shop. With your help, Guillermo will progress with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Guillermo siempre ha tenido su negocio como una manera de tener sui propia fuente de trabajo y cubrir las necesidades de su familia y asi poder darle estudios a sus hijos y comprar su casa. Como ayudaba a un hermano en su vulcanizadora cuando era pequeño ahí aprendi a trabajar la vulcanizadora asi que por eso emprendio su propio negocio. Comenzó desde hace ya mas de 20 años en su casa y posteriormente con las ganancias empezó a ahorrar asi que compró el terreno contiguo a su casa para poner su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y asi generar un mayor ingreso

El necesita un prestamo por US $ 1,200 que pagra en meses para comprar 2 maquinas para la vulcanizadora, con tu ayuda Guillermo seguira con su negoico.

loans.use: To purchase two machines

loans.name: Sayda Asucena

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Sayda Sánchez and I work selling products that are commonly consumed every day.  I am 32 years old.  My business is located in the San Miguel neighborhood of Tegucigalpa.  This business generates income to be able to sustain my home and my family because my husband is in another country and it’s up to me to cover all of the expenses.  

At this time I need monetary assistance in order to have a wider variety of products to sell.  I want to start selling meats and dairy products because in our neighborhoo there are no supermarkets nearby.  People tell me to sell meats so that they don’t have to go all the way to the supermarket.  With this type of sale of products, my business is going to grow a lot and, because it is the only source of income I have, things will go much better for my son and me.  Thank you for your help.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.



hola mi nombre es Sayda S. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 32 años de edad, mi negocio esta ubicado en la colonia San Miguel en la capital, este negocio me genera ingresos para poder sustentar mi hogar y mi familia, ya que mi esposo esta en otro pais y a mi me toca cubrir con todos los gastos, 
en estos momentos necesito una ayuda monetaria para poder tener mas variedad en los productos que venda ya que quiero empezar a vender carnes y lacteos ya que en nuestra colonia no hay supermercados cerca y la gente me dice que venda carnes para que ellos no tengar que ir hasta el supermercado.
con este tipo de venta de producto mi negocio va a crecer mucho y como es la unica fuente de ingresos que tengo pues nos iria mejor a mi y a mi hijo.
gracias por su ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, churros, crackers, basic grains, toilet paper, dairy products, meats (pork, beef and chicken), light bulbs, pills, sanitary napkins, envelopes, paper, pens, candy, lard, cooking oil, bread, sweet breads, matches and batteries.

loans.name: Jose Socorro

texts.es:
Jose started his business because he earned more income there than at his job in a factory, and he saw the need to help his wife. He is now the owner of the business. His wife started the business 10 years ago, and at the beginning only sold plastic items, yarn, and notebooks. With time, she started to sell other products until she started a grocery store. Jose left his job to dedicate himself completely to the store. They also sell various plastic items, making the most of the store's clientele.

He needs a loan of $1,200, which he will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise to be able to invest it so that each day he will have a bigger business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Jose inició el negocio porque le dejaba mas ingreso que su trabajo en la fabrica y vio la necesidad de ayudarele a su esposa y ahora el es el dueño del negocio. Su esposa empezo con el negocio hace 10 años en un principio solo vendia plasticos, hilos y libretas, pero con el tiempo empezo a vender otros productos hasta que formo una tienda de abarrotes y el dejo su trabajo para dedicarse por completo a la tienda, y tambien venden articulos diversos de plastico aprovechano la clientela de la tienda.

El necesesita un prestamo por US $1,200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y poder invertirlo, para que cada dia vaya teniendo un negocio mas grande

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela grew up in a family that was always dedicated to making bread. She knew this business very well, so she decided to dedicate herself to it to take good care of her children.

She had the need to make an income, since she was widowed at a very young age and had the responsibility of being both mother and father, since she had two children and a third one on the way.

She started in April 1982, making the most of her knowledge and the ease with which she could make bread. At that time she also sold clothing, gold jewelry, chorizo, queso, shoes, etc. She always sold things to obtain income to take care of her children. Now she only makes cakes because her children are adults and take care of themselves.

She needs a loan of $1200, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase supplies so she can fill the orders of her clients, making the most of graduation season in the schools.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Graciela creció en una familia que siempre se dedicó a la elaboración de pan, conocía muy bien el negocio, por lo que decidía dedicarse a esto para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso, ya que enviudo muy joven y se quedé con la responsabilidad de ser padre y madre a la vez, ya que tenía dos hijos y venía en camino un tercero. Comenzó en Abril de 1982 aprovechando el conocimiento y la facilidad que tenía para elaborar pan, aunque en ese entonces también vendía ropa, joyería de oro, chorizo, queso, zapatos, etc. siempre dedicada a las ventas para obtener un ingresos que le permitiera sacar adelante a sus hijos pero hoy en día ya solo se dedica a elaborar pasteles pues sus hijos ya están grandes y ya se valen por sí solos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes aprovechando que es temporada de graduaciones en las escuelas.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Aramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Aramatoulaye S., aged 40 and married, has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for seven years. She buys and sells fruit (mangoes and the like), and contributes towards her family’s daily expenses and the improvement of their living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Aramatoulaye S., 40 ans, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 7ans. Elle achète et revend des fruits(mangues et mades). Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Fruit sales

loans.name: Alba Sobeyda

texts.es:
Hello, how are you?  My name is Alba R. and I work selling a variety of products that are commonly consumed every day.  I am 36 years old.
