My business is my only source of income for sustaining my home.  Unfortunately, I have difficulties with my daughter because she has an illness that has incapacitated her for life and she is paralyzed.  So, because of this illness I spend a lot of money each month.  Thank God I have the help of my husband to get ahead, but I need to grow my business.  At this time we are selling lottery tickets and that has helped us a lot because the tickets sell a great deal in our country.  For this reason I need monetary assistance to get ahead with my business, my home and my family.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.


hola como estan, mi nombre es Alba R. me dedico a la venta de varios productos que son de consumo diario, tengo 36 años de edad, mi negocio es mi unica fuente de ingresos para el sustento de mi hogar,  lastimosamente tengo problemas con mi hija ya que ella tiene una enfermedad que la tiene incapacitada de por vida, tiene paralisis, entonces con esta enfermedad gasto mucho dinero mensualmente, gracias a Dios tengo la ayuda de mi esposo para salir adelante, pero necesito hacer crecer mas mi negocio, en estos momentos estamos vendiendo loteria lo cual nos ha ayudado mucho ya que la loto se vende bastante en nuestro pais.
por tal razon necesito ayuda monetaria para salir adelante con mi negocio mi hogar y mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains (rice, beans, corn, etc.), sugar, coffee, toilet paper, churros, soft drinks, lard, juices, salt, eggs, cereals, crackers, candy, batteries, bread, etc.

loans.name: Fatoumata Lamine

texts.fr:
Fatoumata Lamine C., married with three children in her care, has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for six and a half years. She buys and sells brushes and bananas, contributing towards her family’s daily expenses and improving their living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatoumata Lamine C., mariée avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle achète et revend des balais et des bananes. Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and sell brushes and bananas

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a married mother of three children, all of whom are currently in school. She is 42 years old and trades in charcoal, charcoal being a very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Through this business, she has supported her first-born to complete senior high school.

Juliana obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Tema and sells it to her customers. She is seeking a loan to increase her stock of charcoal and expand her business. This will thereby increase her savings and provide for the educational needs of her children. She belongs to a community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another and support one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mariama M., aged 64 and married with five children in her care, has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for four years. Her business consists of buying and selling palm oil and stocking up on hibiscus, lemons and monkey bread (the fruit from the baobab tree) to make fruit juices and creams. She is contributing towards improving the children's living conditions and schooling. The loan she is requesting will be repaid after six months in one installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariama M., 64 ans mariée avec 05 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 4 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme et de s’approvisionner en bissap, citron, et pain de singe pour faire des jus de fruit et des crèmes. Elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie et de scolarité de ses enfants. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sales of palm oil, hibiscus, cream and lemons

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 40-year-old divorced mother of four. Two of her children have completed senior high school. She sells baby clothes, diapers, baby powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles and the like through hawking, balancing her stock on her head and walking miles to her customers' doors.

She is seeking a loan to increase her stock and thus expand her business, making her better able to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of a community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group members provide guarantees for one another and assist one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of baby care supplies

loans.name: Francisca Ataide

texts.es:
Francisca began her business because she was short on money. At that time she did not have the money for expenses or food and one of her children was sick with kidney problems. She started the business 15 years ago with homemade food and when it went well she was offered a stand at a school. She accepted, and since then everything has worked wonderfully, and that is where she sells her food.

She needs a loan of $1,200, which she will repay over 6 months, in order to buy another stand. The stand she has is old and damaged and she needs a new one, as required by the Secretary of Public Education for the children’s hygiene.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Francisca inició el negocio por que no les alcanzaba el dinero, en aquel entonces la necesidad fue el no tener el dinero para los gastos por que ni para la comida tenían y uno de sus hijos estaba enfermo con problemas de riñón. Comenzó hace 15 años con su negocio de comida casera, cuando le fue bien le ofrecieron una caseta escolar lo acepto y hasta ahora todo le funciona de maravilla, ya que es ahí donde vende sus comidas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $1,200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una caseta mas por que la que tiene además de antigua y dañada necesita una nueva ya que se lo exige la Secretaria de Educación Publica por higiene hacia los niños.

loans.use: Buy a new stand

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, a 48-year-old trader, is a widow and mother of seven children who are all currently in school. She trades in yams, millet, shear butter, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, and other items in the local market. Through this business, she has supported two kids through senior high school.

Emelia is seeking this loan to enable her to buy increased stock of yams, millet, shear butter, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to grow her business. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education and give them hope for a brighter future. She belongs to a community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a business owner in Tema who trades in lace and satin clothes. She is married and blessed with two kids who are currently in school. Mary provides a great deal of support to her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past three years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds.

Amina hopes that this loan will enable her to revive the business and make it more viable. She plans to purchase bulk lace and satin clothes to increase her inventory. She believes she would be able to save more to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the Gold Trust Group. The group provides assistance and support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase lace and satin clothes in bulk

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou S., aged 55 and a widow with three children in her care, has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for seven years. She sells vegetables and juice at the Tilène market where she has a table. She buys and sells tomatoes, peppers and hibiscus. Her income enables her to contribute towards the family expenses. Fatou is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou S., 55 ans, veuve avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 7 ans. Elle est vendeuse de légumes et de jus au marché Tilène ou elle détient une table. Elle achète et revend des tomates, des piments, du bissap. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la charge familiale. Fatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Vegetable and juice sales

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 36 years old and is married with four children who are currently in school. She is a petty trader who trades in spices like pepper and onions by "hawking": she balances her stock on her head and walks to her customers' doors to sell. Her business has enabled her to support two children to finish senior high school; they are now ready to enter university this year (the other two are in junior high school).

She is seeking a loan to buy more bags of pepper and onions to increase her inventory. She hopes to thereby double her savings to take care of her children in school. She belongs to the community group the Diamond Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another and provide assistance to one another in repaying their loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of wares

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr:
Diénaba S., aged 43 and married with eight children in her care, has been a member of the 2nd Bridge Lyndiane Village Bank for seven years. She buys cloth (embroidered cloth and cotton damask) and pays a tailor to make outfits for subsequent sale. Her income enables her to contribute towards the family expenses. Diénaba is requesting a loan which will be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Diénaba S., 43 ans, mariée avec 08 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lyndiane 2eme pont depuis 7 ans. Elle achète des tissus (brodé, bazin et billet coton) et paie les services d’un tailleur pour confectionner des ensembles et les vendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la charge familiale. Diénaba sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Clothing manufacture and sales

loans.name: Rukayia

texts.en:
Rukayia is a 48-year-old married mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a food vendor and has been preparing and selling rice and beans for twenty years. With her excellent customer care and good taste, she has a large number of customers buying from her stand. She recognizes how profitable it would be to expand her market since she has already established so much customer goodwill.

Rukayia plans to use this loan to buy more bags of rice, vegetable oil, beans, spices and meat to scale up her production. She believes this will provide her with increased income to send her first son to medical school this year. She belongs to the community group called the Diamond Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy stocks of rice, vegetable oil, beans, spices and meat

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a resourceful and enterprising forty-one-year-old businesswoman; she is married and blessed with four children. She has supported three children to graduate from high school through her business. She operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku." (Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with soup; banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup.)

Felicia says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditure. She is seeking a loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Felicia is a member of Gold Trust Group. In this group, members provide support to one another and provide guarantees to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 58-year-old trader who is married with four children. She has sold used clothes and shoes in a local market in Accra for twelve years. With this business, she has been able to support three children through senior high school. Her major challenge over the years has been getting the funds to expand her business. Mary has amassed lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to make remarkable business progress.

Mary is seeking this loan to buy more bales of used clothes and shoes, increasing her inventory and its variety. She says her greatest joy would be to provide all of her children with a quality education and allow them a brighter future. She hopes to save enough to fulfill this dream of hers. Mary is a member a group called Nyame yie Trust Group. Members in this group support one another in the repayment of their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of used clothes and shoes

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a 24-year old mother of three marvelous children who lives with her husband, David. He is a timber worker and both of them want to get ahead in order to give their children what they need and what is fair so they can grow up to be good people. Beatriz sells beauty products from a cosmetics line that is very well recognized on a national level. She has been doing this for three years, and she takes the products around the area to sell, for cash or on credit. She only works in the afternoons and she likes her job a great deal, as she is able to meet a lot of people and get to know them. Sometimes she has difficulty when customers do not pay what they owe. She considers herself a very dedicated woman and a fighter, and she finishes what she starts. She would like to supply herself with more beauty products and buy a showcase in order to show them, and at the time make them more secure. In the future she would like to have a clothing and perfume store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz tiene 24 años, es madre de 3 hijos maravillosos, vive con su esposo David que es maderero, ambos se han propuesto salir adelante para brindar a sus hijos lo justo y necesario para que sean hombre de bien. Beatriz vende productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, desde ya hace 3 años, estos productos los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona, dejándolos al contado y al crédito. Trabaja solo por las tardes y le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que por medio del mismo conoce a mucha gente y se relaciona más. A veces tiene dificultades cuando las personas incumplen con su pago. Ella se considera una mujer decidida y luchadora, pues lo que se propone lo cumple. Quiere implementarse con más productos de belleza y comprar una vitrina para mostrar sus productos los mismos que estarán más seguros. En el futuro quiere poner una tienda de ropas y perfumería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her cosmetics business and a showcase where she can exhibit her products

loans.name: Melita Gayle

texts.es:
Melita is a very hard-working mother. She has a daughter who is in school and who is her inspiration to get ahead. Melita is a single mother and is very happy with her young daughter, who loves her very much.

Melita has been dedicated to transporting passengers for 6 years. She owns a motorcar and doesn't need a driver because she is a great driver herself and takes good care of her motorcar. She works from 5 a.m. until 6 p.m. without resting, for the only reason of giving her small daughter what she needs so she doesn't lack anything. The loan that she is requesting will be used to have her motorcar repaired, to continue working, and to buy another motorcar in the future to give a job to someone who needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Melita es una madre muy trabajadora, tiene una hija que está estudiando y es su inspiración para seguir adelante. Melita es madre soltera y es muy feliz con su pequeña hija, quien la ama mucho. Melita se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años, es propietaria de un motocarro, no necesita de un chofer, ya que ella misma es una gran conductora y lo cuida muy bien. Trabaja desde las 5:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde, sin descansar, por la sola razón de darle a su pequeña hija lo necesario y que no le falte nada. El préstamo que solicita es para mandar a reparar su motocarro, para continuar trabajando y más adelante comprarse otro para dar oportunidad de trabajo a quien lo necesite.

loans.use: To repair her motorcar to continue with her transportation service.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 32 yeas old and has a two year old son who is his motivation to keep moving forward. He lives with his wife Rosibel, who supports him in everything, and both have a goal that through their hard work and effort, their son will someday study to be a good professional.

Carlos has worked driving passengers for 8 years, and thanks to his good money management, he now owns two moto-cars, which help him strengthen his household finances. His wife, Rosibel, works taking care of their farm and brings their crops to a market stall in their area to sell. Carlos does not have set work hours and he doesn’t have a problem with that as everything is going well.

He is requesting a loan in order to repair one of his moto-cars, buy spare parts and some parts that will make his job tools work. In addition, he would like to work selling groceries and have a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos, de 32 años es padre de un niño 2 añitos que es su motor para seguir adelante. Vive junto a su esposa Rosibel quien lo apoya en todo, ambos tienen una finalidad, y que mediante el trabajo y esfuerzo que desempeñan su hijo estudie par ser algún día un buen profesional.

Carlos se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 8 años, gracias a su buena administración del dinero, ahora es propietario de dos motocarros, lo que le ayuda a fortalecer la economía de su hogar, Rosibel, su esposa, se dedica al cuidado de su chacra y lleva a vender sus productos a un puesto del mercado de su zona. Carlos no tiene horario de trabajo establecido y no tiene problemas con ello ya que todo le está saliendo muy bien.

Solicita este préstamo para reparar uno de sus motocarros, comprar repuestos y algunas piezas que harán que su herramienta de trabajo funcione. Adicionalmente quiere dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y tener su bodega.

loans.use: Repair one of his moto-cars and open a small general store.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia is 50 years old and mother of four children, two who are independent and two of them students who live with her. She lives with her husband Mauricio and they work together to get ahead. Her business sells groceries and essential products. Eugenia is a woman who always works hard to get ahead, and she began this business a long time ago. Thanks to her friendly customer service and above all, good financial management, she now has a moto-car, which gives her children work. She feels good about the work she does as it provides an inventive to dream of greater and greater things. She would like to expand her business and repair the moto-car, and for this reason she is requesting this loan. With your help this mother will be able to get ahead in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Eugenia, D. 50 años D. edad es madre D. 4 hijos, 2 D. ellos independientes y 2 estudiantes que se encuentran a su cargo, vive junto a su esposo Mauricio y ambos se propusieron seguir adelante. Su negocio es la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad, Eugenia es una mujer que lucha duro por salir adelante, empezó con este negocio desD. mucho tiempo atrás, gracias a su amable atención y sobre todo buena administración, tiene ahora un motocarro, con el cual brinda trabajo a sus hijos. Se siente bien con el trabajo que realiza ya que le incentiva a soñar cada vez más alto. Quiere ampliar su negocio y reparar su motocarro, para realizar esto necesita del préstamo que ahora solicita. Con tu ayuda esta madre saldrá adelante en muy corto tiempo.

loans.use: Expand her general store and repair her moto-car

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is 48 years old and is mother of 5 children, all of whom are an inspiration to her to keep going. Together with her husband Arnulfo (is retired and a pensioner) who supports her in everything especially her business. Her responsibilities rest in providing all that is necessary to their children, and it is the reason why she works so hard.

She sells fresh squeezed fruit juices in the market. She has been working at this for many years now and she has been very successful. Her stand is located in a very attractive place and best of all, it is well travelled. Marina wants to rise above and see more success. She wants to make this happen and she has been doing everything with great enthusiasm. She works to meet the family's needs and above all to improve their standard of life.

Her wish is to build a kiosk so that with time her business will be located in an even better locale. To make this dream come true she requires working capital, which she is requesting here. Your support will help her reach her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina tiene 48 años, es madre de 5 hijos, los cuales le inspiran a seguir adelante, junto a su esposo Arnulfo (jubilado, pensionista) quien la apoya en todo y sobre todo en su negocio, son los encargados de brindar todo lo necesario a su hijos, es por eso que le echan muchas ganas a su trabajo. Se dedica a la venta de jugos en un puesto del mercado, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, y le va muy bien, se encuentra en un sitio acogedor y sobre todo muy concurrido. Marina quiere surgir y salir adelante, desde luego cumplir lo que tiene propuesto, y lo hace con mucho entusiasmo. Trabaja para solventar los gastos familiares y sobre todo para mejorar su nivel de vida. Su deseo es construir un kiosco y con el tiempo espera que su negocio se convierta en un lugar de mucha concurrencia, para lograr este propósito ella requiere de un capital, que solicita aquí, el que le ayudará con su objetivo.

loans.use: To build a kiosk to sell fresh squeezed juices.

loans.name: Elías

texts.es:
Elías, 50 years old, lives with his wife Loysi who is his greatest support, above all when it comes to his business. He has 2 children, both of whom are independent and have their own families. He learned to make cakes when he was a youngster, and is now a great baker, and many different shops and stalls in the markets now demand his product. He started this work 9 years ago, and so far it has gone well. Thanks to his hard work and good business management he has bought a tuk-tuk (motocarro) and uses this to deliver products to his customers. He works all day, and what he loves most about his work is the amount of people who enjoy his cakes. He is requesting a loan to build an additional oven so that he can make more cakes. In the future, he would like to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Elías, de 50 años de edad vive junto a su esposa Loysi quien lo apoya mucho, sobre todo en su negocio, tiene 2 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes y de familia. Aprendió a preparar pasteles desde muy joven, ahora es un gran pastelero, ya que muchas vendedoras de distintos puestos de los mercados requieren de su producto. Este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 9 años y por lo visto, hasta la actualidad le va muy bien. Gracias a sus ganancias y su buena administración compró su motocarro, donde lleva sus productos para entregar a sus clientes. Trabaja todo el día, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degusten de sus pasteles. Solicita este préstamo para construir otro horno pastelero y desde luego implementarse con más productos e insumos, posteriormente le gustaría mejorar las infraestructura de su vivienda.

loans.use: To build an additional oven to make his cakes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: María Ema

texts.es:
María is 33 years old and mother to three beautiful children. They are the reason she works so hard along with her husband Pedro, who has always been her greatest support. María has a small sawmill, where they work with the wood that her husband chops down, making it into parquet and other flooring which they sell in the region, as well as exporting to the capital. They have been doing this for 2 years, due to the fact that her husband gets the wood in its raw state so that Maria can work with it. She only does this for half of the day, as she also has to look after the children, and she loves her work as it is so profitable. Her motivation is supporting her husband, helping him to pay the family bills and pay for the childrens' education. The loan María is requesting is to expand her small sawmill or rent a premises to avoid problems with the neighbours, as her business is currently run from home. In the future, she wants to also raise chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

María, a sus 33 años es madre de tres niños preciosos, quienes son la razón de seguir surgiendo junto a su esposo Pedro, quien siempre la apoya en todo. María tiene un mini aserradero, trabajan con la madera que su esposo trae, convirtiendo el mismo en parque y traslapados que lo venden dentro de la región, sí como también exportan a la capital para su uso debido. Se dedican a esta actividad hace 2 años, a consecuencia de que su esposo es quien brinda la madera rolliza para que María la trabaje. Solo lo hace medio día, para luego atender a sus hijos, y le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le es rentable. Su motivación es apoyar a su esposos con los gastos familiares y la educación de sus niños. El préstamo que solicita María es porque quiere ampliar su mini aserradero o de lo contrario alquilar un local para evitar problemas a sus vecinos, puesto que su negocio funciona en su domicilio, más adelante quiere dedicarse a la crianza de pollos.

loans.use: To create a suitable space for her sawmill, so that she doesn't bother the neighbours.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Benigna Mercedes

texts.es:
Benigna, who is 42 and a mother of five children, all of whom are currently in school, lives with her husband Ulises. As a couple, they work hard for their children. She is the owner of a tuk-tuk (motocarro), and she also sells meals in the evenings. Her husband is the tuk-tuk driver and in charge of its maintenance. It has taken 3 years to offer this transport service to customers. She works part-time and then prepares to sell her meals, but her husband works on thetuk-tuk all day. They both work in order to pay for the family bills and their childrens' education. Benigna will invest the money she is requesting in order to maintain and repair her tuk-tuk, improve her food sales and later build a kiosk to sell her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Benigna, de 42 años de edad es madre de 05 hijos que están estudiando, ella vive junto a su esposo Ulises, ambos se han propuesto a seguir adelante por sus hijos. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, al mismo tiempo, se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches. Su esposo es el chofer de su motocarro y quien se dedica al cuidado de este.Ya llevan 3 años brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Ella trabaja medio tiempo y luego se prepara par la venta de comida, pero su esposo trabaja con el motocarro todo el día. Ambos trabajan para sostener los gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos. Benigna invertirá el dinero que solicita hoy en el mantenimiento y arreglo de su herramienta de trabajo, mejorar su venta de comida, y posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco para vender la comida cómodamente.

loans.use: Maintenance for her tuk-tuk and to build a kiosk to sell her meals.

loans.name: Nury Arazeli

texts.es:
Nury is 27 years of age and is married. One of her children is attending school and there's another little one one the way. She lives with her husband Juan who always gives her a hand with the business.

Three years ago she has been selling fresh water. She distributes her product in her neighbourhood. Nury is very active and hardworking which is why she wants so much to keep going with this business, especially because it is so successful. Aside from this, she also helps her husband in his mechanic's shop. She does all of this for the wellbeing of her familly. Nury provides her fresh water services 24-hours a day, 7 days a week and she feels happy just to be able to keep growing. She works to cover the daily expenses and the education of their small son.

The reason why she is requesting this loan is that she wants to provide water to a larger sector. And to make this happen she needs working capital. She also wants to have a chicken coop built.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nury tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y es madre de un niño que está estudiando y otro que viene en camino, vive con su esposo Juan, quien siempre le da la mano en su negocio. Hace 03 años se dedica a la venta de agua, distribuye a las personas que colindan por su alrededor, Nury es muy activa y trabajadora, por eso que tiene muchas ganas de seguir adelante en este negocio, ya que le parece muy rentable, paralelamente a esto apoya a su esposo en su taller de mecánica, todo esto hace por el bienestar de su familia.Nury brinda sus servicios de agua las 24 horas del día y se siente a gusto de seguir creciendo. Ella trabaja para apoyar con los gastos diarios y la educación de su pequeño hijo. El motivo de solicitar un préstamo es porque quiere brindar agua a un gran sector, para ello requiere del capital que ayudará a cumplir su propósito, también quiere mandar a construir un galpón para la crianza de pollos.

loans.use: Capital funds for the investment in her fresh water service and to build a chicken coop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfinanzas PRISMA - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.es:
Luz Angelica is 33 years old and is mother to 2 children that love her very much and are in school. She lives together with her husband, Henry, a traD. instructor for construction. He supports the family without bounds.

She is a very active woman with dreams of bettering herself. She has for a long time sold beauty products such as: perfumes, shampoo, talcum powders, lipsticks, manicure sets etc. Thanks to her great charisma and pleasant disposition she has earned herself a good client base. She takes her products to the farthest regions of Yarinacocha, her village, and she sells them on credit and she also takes cash. She works all day long and she loves her job, especially because she gets to know so many people.

She wants to purchase a display case for her products, the reason for requesting this loan. Further down the road she would also like to sell fashion jewelery.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz Angélica D. 33 años D. edad es madre D. 02 hijos que la quieren mucho y están estudiando, vive junto a su esposo Henry, quien es maestro D. construcción y le apoya desmedidamente. Es una mujer muy activa, con deseos D. superación, se dedica desD. hace mucho tiempo a la venta D. productos D. belleza como: perfumes, shampoo, talcos, lápiz labiales, correctores para uñas, etc. Gracias a su carisma y jovialidad se ganó una gran gama D. clientes, estos productos los lleva a vender por las zonas más alejadas D. Yarinacocha, su pueblo y los venD. a crédito o al contado. Trabaja todo el día y se siente bien con su trabajo ya que conoce a mucha gente. Ella quiere comprar un mostrador para exhibir sus productos, por lo que solicita este préstamo, más adelante también le gustaría dedicarse al arte D. la bijoutería.

loans.use: To purchase a display case for her beauty products.

loans.name: Hermelinda Nelly

texts.es:
Hermelinda is 48 years old and she lives with her little girl of 10 years and her husband.

She has been selling cosmetics for 29 years, carrying the most prestigious brands. She started her business out of great need. At the time her first daughter required many financial investments, and since then she has kept up the business. She sells her products door to door so this way she might obtain the orders that she needs. The hardest part for her is to have to walk on rainy days. But that doesn't stop her and she just keeps going. She is working hard for her last daughter, so that she can continue attending school.

Hermelinda is requesting a loan in the amound of 1300 soles which she will use to purchase cosmetics wholesale and she wants to invest in another business. And for it, she needs to buy a photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Hermelinda tiene 48 años y vive en la actualidad al lado de su pequeña hija de 10 años y su esposo. Desde hace más de 29 años que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de las líneas más prestigiosas en belleza, lo hizo por necesidad, porque en aquella ocasión debido a su primera hija necesitaba bastantes recursos económicos, sigue dedicándose a ello, sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa para que de esa manera pueda obtener los pedidos que necesita, lo más difícil para ella es tener que caminar en días de lluvia, pero eso no la detiene y sigue adelante. Ella trabaja para que su última hija pueda seguir con sus estudios. Hermelinda solicita un préstamo de 1300 soles en que utilizará para la compra de cosméticos al por mayor, además desea invertir en otro negocio, comprar una fotocopiadora.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics wholesale and to purchase a photocopier.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Gumercinda C..  I work selling and producing tortillas.  For more than 20 years, I’ve been doing this same job.  Thanks to my business, I’ve enabled my children to get ahead and have also been building my house little by little.  At this time I need to pour the floor of my kitchen because right now the floor has no bricks.  This is something I desire to do in order to improve my quality of life.  I hope to have help from you.  Thank you.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer. 



hola mi nombre es Gumercinda C., me dedico a la venta y produccion de tortillas, tengo mas de 20 años de estar en esta misma actividad, gracias a mi negocio he logrado sacar a mis hijos adelante y tambien ir construyendo mi casa poco a poco, en estos momentos necesito fundir el piso de mi cocina ya que el piso en este momento no tiene ladrillos.
esto lo deseo para mejorar mi calidad de vida, espero tener una ayuda de ustedes.
gracias.

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, lime and bricks for a kitchen floor.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Miguel G..  I'm 41 years old and I work repairing motorcycles.   My oldest son helps me in the business which helps us meet the growing demand of our customers.   This is a good business as many people in our city drive motorcycles since fuel is very expensive.   I would like to remodel the shop and install an area for the parts I keep in inventory, as well as some seating for my customers while they wait.    I am requesting a loan in order to improve and grow my business, as it is the only source of income to provide for my family.   Thank you.  



hola mi nombre es Miguel G. me dedico a la reparacion de motocicletas, tengo 41 años de edad, mi negocio esta ubicado media cuadra antes de la corte suprema de justicia, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo mayor para la repacion de las motos y hacer mas rapido el servio de reparacion ya que la demanda es bastante grande, este es un negocio muy bueno en nuesra ciudad capital ya que mucha gente se transporta en motos por lo caro que estan los combustibles, en estos momentos deseo remodelar mi negocio, hacer una galera y fundir un piso para poder tener un mejor control de los repuestos que tengo en inventario y tambien para una mejor atencion a mis clientes, poner unas sillas para los clientes que estan esperando no tengan que estar parados.
por tal razon les pido ayuda para poder sacar adelante mi negocio ya que es la unica fuente de ingresos que tengo para poder alimentar mi familia.
gracias.

loans.use: To invest and grow his motorcyle repair business, which is the only source of income to provide for his family.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.en:
Irma Yolanda M. is a hardworking woman of 24 years old. She is married and has one son, but very soon will have a second. She used to work only raising chickens but now has a small business selling gold jewelry. She travels to sell her jewelry and her business has done well. Her desire is to buy more merchandise but she doesn’t have enough capital. Her husband works sewing sweaters and she helps him in that business in her free time. Irma Yolanda is very grateful to God and FAPE for granting her this business and the loan will help her expand it. She dreams of having a store in the market to sell from, as she cannot sell from her home because she lives in a remote area.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

La señora Irma Yolanda M. es una mujer muy trabajadora de de 24 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y muy pronto va a tener el segundo, se dedicaba solo a la crianza de pollos, ahora tiene un pequeño negocio de vender joyas de oro, es un negocio ambulante y le ha ido muy bien por lo que su deseo es comprar mas mercadería pero no tiene el capital suficiente; su esposo se dedica a tejer suéteres y ella en su tiempo libre ayuda a su esposo a la elaboración de suéteres esta muy agradecida con Dios y con FAPE por concederle ese negocio y un préstamo que le ayudará a ampliar su negocio de joyería su sueño es tener un local en el mercado y poner una tienda para vender porque en su casa no puede ella vive muy retirado del centro del pueblo.

loans.use: To buy more gold jewelry to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FAPE - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Pauai's Group

texts.en: Malae Faga is a lovely village with natural and beautiful beaches. They also have very fertile soil suitable for farming and planting. Malae Faga is one of the new centers, and these ladies works on different agricultural businesses such as cattle farming, taro plantations, vegetable plantations in order to earn income for their families. These are their first loans and they are earning $750 each.

loans.use: Buy tools, facilities, and chemicals to start up their businesses.

loans.name: Saini's Group

texts.en: These ladies work on different businesses like pancakes, vegetable garden, farming, and plantations, but most of them are doing plantations and foodstall businesses.  They sell their products at the schools and their taro and taamu at the main market at Salelologa.  These ladies are from one village and they live close to each other. Their husbands help them run their businesses, and they all help each other on their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients, tools, and equipment for starting up their businesses.

loans.name: Hulda

texts.en:
Hulda is 45 years old. She is married with four children aged twenty six, twenty three, twenty, and fifteen years old. She began selling bananas in 2001. Every day she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Hulda now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a tailor and also sells clothing (vitenge). Every day she works from 8am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Frida now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing and tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothing and tailoring items

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is married with a three year old child. She has owned and run a small shop since 2005. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Vicky now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Esta

texts.en:
Esta is 34 years old. She is married with three children aged twelve, six, and three years old. She own a small shop and has been selling clothing since 2006. Every day she works from 11am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Esta now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing and other items for her business to increase profits.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothing and other items at her shop.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a single woman with one nine year old child. She became a charcoal seller in 2007. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Ruth now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 25 years old. She is married with two children aged nine and four years old. She began selling bananas in 2003. Every day she works from 8am to 4:30pm and earns a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Juliana now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business.

loans.name: Asnath

texts.en:
Asnath is 24 years old. She is married with a 7 year old child. She began selling maize and bananas in 2001. Every day she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $86 from her sales.

Asnath now hopes for a loan to buy more maize and bananas to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more maize and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of four and twenty-four. She sells milk and bananas. Every day she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Victoria now hopes for a loan to buy more milk and bananas to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of milk and bananas to sell

loans.name: Rogathe

texts.en:
Rogathe is 32 years old. She is married with four children aged fourteen, twelve, eight, and four. She began selling maize and beans in 2001. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Rogathe now hopes for a loan to buy more maize and beans to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To buy more maize and beans to increase her stock.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two children aged eight and five. She began selling clothing in 1993. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

Rose now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is married with two children aged one and three years old. She has owned and run a small stationery business since 2006. Every day she works from 7am to midnight and earns a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Pendo now hopes for a loan to buy more stationery items to sell in her store to increase profits.

loans.use: To buy more stationery items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Aziza's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Aziza is married with a four year old child. She sells tomatoes and onions. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

Aziza now hopes for a loan to buy more tomatoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Martha who sells fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish and tomatoes for their respective businesses.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is married with a five year old child. She sells chickens. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

Magdalena now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Happyness

texts.en:
Happyness is 27 years. She is married with two children aged five and two. She became a banana seller in 2005. Every day she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Happyness now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Catherine's Omega Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 43 years. She is married with four children between the ages of twelve and twenty one. She became a rice seller in 2003. Every day she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Catherine now hopes for a loan to buy more rice for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who also have retail businesses selling oil, milk, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more rice for her business and help other group members with their retail businesses.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 33 years. She is married with three children between the ages of twelve and six. She became a clothing and cosmetics seller in 2004. Every day she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Faith now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing (vitenge) and cosmetic items for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and cosmetic items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Paulina's Kivulini Group

texts.en:
Paulina is 49 years. She is married with five children between the ages of twelve and three. She has been a farmer since 1999. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Paulina now hopes for a loan to buy more seed and farm instruments. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mariam, Lilian, Elibahati and Happness, who also sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more seed and farm instruments.

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en:
Dinna is 30 years,She is a married woman with 1child aged 5. She is a clothes seller. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Dinna now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en:
Dinna is 30 years. She is married with a five year old child. She sells clothing. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Dinna now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business to increase sales

loans.name: Ndeshifose

texts.en:
Ndeshifose is married with a two year old child. She sells soap. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Ndeshifose now hopes for a loan to buy more soap for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.en:
Adilia is a married woman with a six-year old child. She sell clothing. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Adilia now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business to increase sales

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 32 years. She is a married woman with one four year old child. Anna is a meat seller. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

Anna now hopes for a loan to buy more meat for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more meat for her business to increase sales.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang S., 65, is a widow with two daughters. Both of them are married and one lives outside the family home. Her younger daughter is assisting her in the business. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Leang has been selling grocery items for fifteen years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for re-sale at her shop in front of her home. Currently her business is thriving and she is building another grocery shop at the village market for her daughter, but she lacks the money to complete it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to finish her daughter's store to use for running a grocery business.

loans.use: To build a grocery shop for her daughter

loans.name: Chhengkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhengkea H., 45, and her husband, Mr. Lieng Hun, 43, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1990 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. All of their children study in local schools.

Chhengkea has been farming since she was young, a skill she learned from her parents. She grows many kinds of vegetables in a farm not so far from their home. Besides farming, she also raises pigs. Her husband has been a wooden house builder for three years. Currently he lacks some materials for running his business.

So, Chhengkea is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap E., 39, was married to her second husband in 2006. She has one son with her first husband. Her son studies in secondary school. Sopheap lives with her elderly mother on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sopheap has been a silk weaver for twenty years - a skill she learned from her mother. Her mother has been a silk weaver for forty years. They sell their finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Sopheap's husband is motorcycle repairman in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her and her mother's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Yoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoin Y., 41, and her husband, Mr. Chanrith Ung, 38, were married in 1990. They have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of their children are in the local school. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yoin has been a silk weaver for twenty six years - a skill she learned from her parents. She takes her finished products, buys some from her villagers and than takes it all to Kampong Speu Province. Her husband has been a fisherman and wooden house builder for over twenty years.

Yoin is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk products for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk products for resale.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en:
Mrs. Ang H., 49, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. All of her children are married and two of them live outside the family home. Her daughter lives with her and is assisting her in her business. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about eighteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh.
 
Mrs. Ang has been selling "Unsorm Chrouk", a kind of Khmer cake that is made from sticky rice, beans, coconut, and pork. They take all ingredients to pack in a banana leaf and steam it in boiling water. Unsorm Chrouk is a very popular cake in Khmer culture. Khmer people eat this cake at every ceremony or special event such as a wedding ceremony. Ang and her daughter produce Unsorm Chrouk at their home and take it to sell at Prek Anchan Market.

Now Ang is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase materials to roof her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to roof her house

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokheng K., 28, and her husband, Mr. Sreang Sreng, 29, who live in a small village across the MeK. River about eighteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, have been married for five years and have one daughter.
 
Mrs. Sokheng has been selling fruit since she was young. She buys the fruit from Dem Kor Martke (a fruit market in Phnom Penh) for resale at her shop in Olimpic Market in Phnom Penh City. Mr. Sreang has been a wooden house builder for three years. 

From July until December, Cambodians have a lot of ceremonies according to Buddhism. Fruit selling is a very good business in this season because people will use fruit for praying and to give to the monks at the pagoda. 

Therefore, Sokheng is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more fruit for resale at her shop.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling fruit.

loans.name: La-Oo

texts.en:
Mrs. La-oo S., 36, and her husband, Mr. Ban Eam, 37, who live along National Road Number Six about 18 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1992 and have four children: three sons and one daughter.  Three of their children study in a local school, and the youngest one stays home.

Mrs. La-oo has been selling citronella for two years.  She bought the plants from a farmer in her village to resell at Demkor Market in Phnom Penh.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver and helps her with the business.  Currently, she needs money to buy citronella on a forward contract, which means that she must pay the farmer before harvesting.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase citronella on forward contract and to replace her husband’s motorcycle for his motor taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase citronella on forward contract and replace a motorcycle

loans.name: Soneat

texts.en:
Mrs. Soneat Youn, 29, is a widow with one son and one daughter. Both of her children are in the local school. She lives with her parents on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soneat has been a silk weaver for seven years - a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides her weaving business, she also sells groceries from her home.

Soneat is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Chanveasna

texts.en:
Mr. Chanveasna M., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Sampois Ven, 30, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1995 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children is in school and the other two are still young and stay at home.

Chanveasna has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. His wife sells vegetables at home. Chanveasna travels to work by motor taxi and the cost is very high, so he has decided to buy a motorcycle to drive to work but he lacks the money to buy it. So, he is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to add to his own money to purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Samut

texts.en:
Mrs. Samut P., 50, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Sum, 40, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1979 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. One daughter is a silk weaver and one   son is a construction worker. Their other two children study in local school.

Mrs. Samut was a silk weaver since her youth but now spins thread for her daughter to weave silk. Her husband has been a carpenter for over ten years, building boats and wooden houses for the villagers. The couple is now in the process of building a new family house but lacks the money to finish it. Therefore, Samut is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to finish her house.

loans.use: To add to her money to build a new house.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
Jairo M. is a professor dedicated to his work. He has worked as a teacher in the Rafaela Herrera School for 8 years, where he is known as a hard-worker and a very responsible man. In the time that he has worked he has developed a lot of dedication toward the rural children of the Municipality of New Guinea.

Jairo is single and still lives with his parents. He assumes the household expenses. He does not have children. He has gone about improving the house of his parents with a lot of effort, because he desires a worthy dwelling with all the conditions that a citizen aspires to. The loan will be used for the purchase of wood and zinc for the construction of the kitchen. Through loans he has been able to improve the house of his parents and waits to be able to have stability in his employment so that he can leave his parents a complete house and also be able to think about his future and the formation of a family

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Jairo M. es un profesor dedicado a su labor, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera, desde hace 8 años, identificado en su trabajo como trabajador y un hombre muy responsable, el tiempo que tiene de trabajar ha desarrollado su trabajo con mucho dedicación hacia los niños campesinos del Municipio de Nueva Guinea.

Jairo es soltero y aún vive con sus padres, él asume los gastos del hogar, no tiene hijos. Ha dio mejorando la casa de sus padres con mucho esfuerzo, porque desea una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones que un ciudadano aspira. El préstamo será usado para la compra de madera y zinc para la construcción de la cocina. A través de préstamos él ha podido mejorar las casas de sus padres y espera poder tener estabilidad laborar para dejarles a sus padres una casa completa, y también poder pensar en su futuro y en la formación de una familia

loans.use: To buy wood and zinc for the construction of the kitchen in his parent's house.

loans.name: Flor De Oriente Group

texts.es:
Hello, we are part of a group called Flor de Oriente, or Flower of the Orient. We work making and selling a local snack called rosquillas. We also have small shops where we sell popular, everyday items. We have worked together for a long time, and thanks to the support we've received, we've been able to improve the quality of our lives.

We are involved in the following work; Martha has worked for 5 years making and selling rosquillas. She also runs a small shop from her home as well as selling products in the neighborhood. The income from this business helps support her family.

Marisela has been working for 4 years making and selling rosquillas, which she prepares in her home and then sells around her community. The income helps her and her husband cover household costs and care for their 3 children. And Dilcia set up a small shop in her home 5 years ago. She and her partner have 3 children. The income from her business helps her cover their household costs.

The last few years have been difficult , but thanks to the support they have received, they've all been able to improve their living situations.

hola nosotras somos el grupo Flor de Oriente, nos dedicamos a la fabricacion y venta de rosquillas tambien una de nosotras tiene una tienda de productos de consumo popular, siempre hemos trabajado juntas y gracias al apoyo que recibiremos podremos salir mejorando nuestras condiciones de vida. estas son nuestras actividades: Martha A.: ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas y tiene un pequeñ negocio de venta de productos de consumo popular, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitacion y de manera ambulante, con las ganancias que obtiene puede sustentar su familia. Marisela S.: tengo 4 años de dedicarme a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, actividad que realizo en mi casa de habitacion y mi producto lo distribuyo de manera ambulante dentro de mi misma comunidad, con los ingresos que me genera ayudo a cubrir los gastos que tiene mi esposo en el hogar ya que tengo 3 hijos . Dilcia S.: ella tiene 5 años de haber instalado una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, vive en union libre y es madre de tres hijos, con los ingresos que genera el mismo negocio ayuda en gran oparte a su compañero de hogar a cubrir varios gastos que tienen dentro del hogar. gracias a la ayuda que obtendremos podremos salir adelante con nuestras familias ya que en estos ultimos años la situacion de nuestro pais es muy dificil para gente como nosotros.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make and sell local snacks, as well as stock their small shops with more products.

loans.name: Neysi Nadin

texts.es:
Neysi is requesting the loan to invest in the construction of a kitchen in her dwelling.

She has served as the Sales Executive of CURACAO for 5 years. She has 2 children. The oldest, age 8, is in second grade and she also has a baby of 4 months. Her husband works as a bus driver for public transportation.

Neysi is a hard-working, honest, and very responsible young woman with a lot of professional and work aspirations. At present she is studying in her third year of business administration in the Martin Luther University.

Her dream is to become a professional so that she can offer her small children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Neysi está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la construccion de una cocina en su vivienda.

Se desempeña como Ejecutiva de venta en la CURACAO desde hace 5 años, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 8 años estudia su 2do grado de educación primaria y una bebita de 4 meses, su esposo trabaja como chofer de bus de transporte colectivo.

Neysi es una joven muy responsable, honesta, trabajadora y con mucho deseos de superación profesional y laboral, actualmente está cursando su tercer año de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Martin Lutero.

Su sueño es llegar a ser una profesional para ofrecerle a sus pequeños una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To build a kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Teresa has worked as a superintendent in the Rubén Darío institute for 24 years. She has a 25-year-old daughter who is in her 4th year in the URACCAN University, where she has been able to send her through a lot of sacrifice, because she desires that her daughter become someone significant in life.

Doña Teresa has been an exemplary woman in the municipality of New Guinea; honest and very hard-working. Her dream is to have a dwelling with better conditions since they are a family of scarce economic resources. She is requesting financing to invest in the improvement of her dwelling. She will plaster the walls of her house and buy two wooden doors.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Teresa trabaja como conserje en el instituto Rubén Darío desde hace 24 años, tiene una hija de 25 años de edad la cual esta estudiando 4to año en la Universidad URACCAN, a la que ha podido llevar hasta ahí con mucho sacrificio porque desea que su hija llegue a ser alguien de bien en la vida.

Doña Teresa ha sido una mujer ejemplar en el municipio de Nueva Guinea, honesta y muy trabajadora, su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos está solicitando financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda. Ella repellará las paredes de su casa y comprará dos puertas de madera

loans.use: To plaster the walls of her house and buy two wooden doors.

loans.name: La Montañita Group

texts.es:
We are all part of a group called La Montanita, located in the community of Montanita in the municipality of El Paraiso.  One of the good qualities of our group is that we know each other very well and we've worked together for a long time.   This is important as we all work with a great deal of integreity.  

 We work making and selling traditional snacks,  called rosquillas, in our community. People typically eat them for breakfast, or in the evening with a strong coffee.  Our products are very popular and we sell them around the community and in public offices and private homes, shops and the municipal market.  

 We are requesting a loan so that we can make more products and better meet the demand of our customers.    As we grow our business and increase our income, we'll be able to provide a better life for our children.   Thank you. 

nosotras somo el grupo la Montañita, ubicado en la comunidad de la Montañita, el Chichicaste, municipio de El Paraiso, una cualidad positiva de nuestro grupo es que nos conocemos muy bien y hemos trabajados unidos siempre y lo mas importante es que somo muy honrrados en todas nuestras actividades.

nosotras nos dedicamos a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas, como ud deben saber la rosquilla en nuestra comunidad y en la ciudad de Danli es muy comun ya que es como el pan tipico de nuestras costumbres, y este tipo de alimento se consume en el desayuno y en la cena con un buen cafe negro caliente.

nuestro producto es muy popular y muy vendido, nosotras lo elaboramos y salimos a venderlo de manera ambulante en diferentes oficinas publicas y privadas, pulperias, mercaditos y tambien lo vendemos en el mercado municipal de Danli.

en estos momentos necesitamos la ayuda monetaria para poder tener mas produccion ya que la demanda es muy grande y para nosotras es un reto poder cubrir con todas las exigencias de nuestros clientes. por tal razon estamos solicitando la ayuda, y con las ganancias que obtengasmos podremos tener una mejor calidad de vida para nuestros hijos.
gracias

 Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients and materials necessary to make more of the traditional snacks they sell.  The income from this business enables them to take care of their children.

loans.name: Rosas Rojas Group

texts.es:
Hello.  We are part of a group called Rosas Rojas, or Red Roses.   We all work selling everyday household items and groceries from two shops we run.    Guadalupe del Carmen D. sells her snacks in the neighborhood.  Her customers appreciate the high quality of her products and the reasonable prices.    Marta G. sells merchandise from the shop.  As it's located on a main street, she benefits from a good customer base and is well known in the community.  And Ciriaca G. also works in the shop.  As a single mother, this income from this business helps her take of her 3 children.  

 They are all requesting financial help to continue to grow their respective businesses and improve the quality of life for their families.  


hola nosotras somos el grupo Rosas Rojas, nuestra actividad es el comercio, vendemos mercaderia y tenemos dos pulperias de ventas de productos de consumo popular.

nuestras activiades son:
Guadalupe del Carmen D.: mi actividad principal es el comercio, en la cual vendo oro enchape de manera ambulante, mis clientes me prefieren por la atencion que les brindo y por la buena calidad de mi producto a un bajo costo.

Marta G.: la actividad de ella es la venta de productos de consumo popular, dicha pulperia esta ubicada en la calle principal de la comunidad de sartenejas, jamastran. ella cuenta con un local muy agradable para sus clientes ya que por ello es muy reconocida por todos los habitantes de nuestra comunidad.

Ciriaca G.: cuenta con una pulperia que esta ubicada en la comunidad de sartenejas, jamastran, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, dicho negocio le ayuda a salir adelante con su familia.

todas nosotras solicitamos ayuda para que nos permitan crecer con nuestros negocios y mejorar nuestras condiciones de vida.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their respective businesses, increase their income and continue to improve the quality of life for their families.

loans.name: Aristides Antonio

texts.es:
Aristides is requesting financing to make improvements to his home by constructing a room. He works as a security guard and has been doing this for 10 years. He has two children. His oldest son is 12 years old and is in the fifth grade, and the youngest son is 5 years old and in preschool. This client has been characterized as being responsible, honest and hard-working. His wife is a merchant, and both share their household’s expenses being that they are a very close-knit family. His dream is to have a decent home, work security, health and that his children continue studying so that they may become people of substance.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Aristides está solicitando su financiamiento para hacer mejoras en su vivienda como es la construcción de una habitación, labora como Guarda de Seguridad desde hace 10 años, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 12 años de edad estudia su quinto grado de Educación Primaria y el niño menor de 5 años estudia su preescolar, este cliente se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesto, trabajador , su esposa es comerciante, ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar ya que son una familia bien unida, su sueño es tener una vivienda digna, estabilidad laboral, salud y que su hijos sigan estudiando para que llegue hacer alguien en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilliam is requesting financing to invest in making repairs to her home such as adding ceramic to the floors. Lilliam is an assistant director at a school, and has been doing this for the past 14 years. Currently, she is studying to receive her Masters degree at the UCA.

She is characterized as being responsible, honest and with much desire for self-improvement. She has an 8-year-old daughter, who is in second grade at an elementary school, and her eldest son is 14 years old and in his second year in middle school. Her husband is the director at the Manantial radio station. They both share their household's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lilliam está solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es ponerle ceramica a su vivienda. Lilliam labora como subdirectora de un centro escolar desde hace 14 años, actualmente está estudiando una maestria en la UCA. Se caracteriza por ser responsable, honesta y con mucho deseo de superación personal, tiene una niña de 8 añitos de edad, estudia su segundo grado de educación primaria y el niño mayor de 14 años estudia su segundo año de educación secundaria, su esposo labora como director de la radio Manantial, ambos comparten los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Adding ceramic to the floor of her home.

loans.name: Imara Lisseth

texts.es:
Imara is requesting financing to invest in making repairs to her home; she will construct a bathroom. She works as an educator at Salomón Ibarra Mayorga School and has been there for 5 years. She has no children, but she helps her mother with the household expenses. Her husband is a cab driver.

Imara is a young woman with high hopes of self-improvement and very responsible. She is an educator who loves her job being that she helps many from the Los Angeles neighborhood in the municipality of Nueva Guinea learn to read and write.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Imara está solicitando financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, hará la construcción de un servicio higiénico. Labora como docente de la Escuela Salomón Ibarra Mayorga desde hace 5 años, no tiene hijos pero ayuda a su mamá con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como taxista.

Imara es una joven con alto espiritud de superación personal, responsable, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos a aprender a leer y escribir de la colonia los Angeles del municipio de Nueva Guinea.

loans.use: Construction of a bathroom in her home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lluvias De Gracias Group

texts.es:
Hello, we are part of the group called Lluvias de Gracias, which translates roughly to Showers of Gratitude.   We are located in the neighborhood known as Jasmin, which is in the municipality of Pariaso.  We know each other well and we've been working together for a long time.   

 Our activities include: 
 
Tomasa L. is a single mother with a daughter who attends school.  Tomasa works selling everyday grocery items and sweets in various shops and markets.

 Maura B. makes and sells snacks such as chicken tamales, enchiladas, etc, all of which she makes in her house.  Fortunately, she generates enough income from her business to feed her family.  Her husband died two years ago and now Maura is a single mother of two children.   She has had to work very hard to take care of her family on her own.  

 Mirian M. is a nurse and works in a public health clinic, but her salary is not enough to cover her household costs.   After work, she makes snacks and sweets which she sells around the neighborhood.  She has two children who attend high school, and help her sell her snacks in the afternoons.  

 All of the women work together and with some financial support, they will be able to grow their businesses and more importantly, take care of their families and improve their quality of life.    For this reason they ask for your support to help them reach their goals.    Thank you. 


Hola! , nosotras somos el grupo Lluvias de Gracias, estamos ubicadas en al Barrio el Jasmin municipio del Paraiso, nosotras nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntos, 

nuestras actividades son:

Tomasa L.: me dedico a la venta de mercaderia pero mi fuerte es la venta de pastelitos de piña lo que vendo en diferentes pulperias, mercaditos y en el mercado municipal, soy madre soltera y tengo una hija que esta en la secundaria.

Maura B., ella es comerciante elabora y vende nacatamales de pollo, res y cerdo, tambien hace enchiladas, pupusas, todo esto lo elabora en su casa de habitacion,  gracias a Dios esto le genera ingresos para alimentar su familia, ella es madre soltera ya que hace dos años su esposo paso a mejor vida, sus hijos estan en edad escolar y en secundaria. ella ha tenido que esforzarse para salir adelante y asi cumplir con las obligaciones que tiene con su familia.

Mirian M.: ella es enfermera profesional trabaja en la secretaria de salud publica, pero el sueldo que recibe no es mucho para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar, cuando ella sale de trabajar elabora golosinas que distribuye de manera ambulante, tiene dos hijos que estan grandes estudian en la secundaria, ellos le ayudan en las tardes a repartir su producto.

todas trabajando juntas y con apoyo monetario podremos crecer en nuestros negocios y lo mas importante es que podamos atender nuestras familias, todos nuestros negocios nos ayudaran a cubrir con los gastos familiares y mejorar nuestra calidad de vida, por tal razon pedimos una ayuda monetaria para cumplir o realizar nuestros sueños, gracias

loans.use: To help these single mothers invest in their respective businesses, increase their income and continue to take care of their families.

loans.name: Aly Fernando

texts.es:
My name is Aly M. and I have a business selling everyday household items and groceries,  as well as clothing.   My wife helps run the business in the mornings while I sell clothing in the neighborhood.  In the afternoons I return home to run our shop, which is located in our home.    We do this so we can take care of our 3 children, all of whom attend school.  

 Our business has grown a lot, and we've added fruits and vegetables to our stock, as they are in great demand.   We've run our business well and we have good customers who like the quality and the fair prices we offer to the community.  We are requesting a loan to help us grow our business and continue to improve our family's quality of life.  Thank you. 

 Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes 
hola mi nombre es Aly M. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular tambien vendo ropa nueva, el negocio de la pulperia es atendido por mi esposa en las mañanas ya que yo salgo a vender ropa de manera ambulante y en las tarder regreso a mi hogar que es mi negocio y ahi atiendo el mismo,  esto es para poder cumplir con todas las obligaciones de nuestro hogar, soy padre de 3 hijos los cuales los 3 estan estudiando, 
el crecimiento de nuestro negocio es notable ya que ahora vendemos verduras y frutas, y las verduras tienen una demanda fuerte en las ventas, nuestro negocio lo hemos administrado muy bien y nuestros clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta la calidad de nuestros productos y que vendemos a precios justos para nuestros habitantes de nuestra comunidad
salicitamos a ustedes una ayuda para poder hacer crecer nuestro negocio y tener mayores ganancias y asi poder vivir mejor. gracias

loans.use: To purchase more stock for their business, increase their income and continue to improve the quality of life for the family.

loans.name: Victor Hernan

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Victor D..  I work as a taxi cab driver in the city of Danli, El Paraiso.  My car is in good condition aside from needing a new paint job and new tires (the ones in use currently are very worn).  I'm doing my best to give the best service to my clients.

I have been working at this job for 5 years now and it has provided me with a good income and with this income I have been able to support my family.

For this reason I am requesting help to be able to get maintenance for my car as it is my only source of income.

Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.


hola mi nombre es Victor D., me dedico al servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Danli, El Paraiso, tengo mi carro en muy buen estado, en estos momentos lo que necesita mi automovil es un pintado general y comprar llantas ya que las que tiene estan gastadas, esto lo estoy haciendo para dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes.
tengo 5 años de dedicarme a esta actividad la cual me deja muy buenos ingresos y con estos ingresos salimos adelante con mi familia.
por tal razon estoy solicitando ayuda para poder darle mantenimiento a mi automovil que es mi unica fuente de ingresos,
gracias

loans.use: To purchase paint and tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a variety of merchandise to stock the business.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor R. owns a store where she sells traditional Mexican dresses. This is her only source of income being that she lives alone. She orders the dresses from areas south of Mexico City such as Chiapas, Puebla, Veracruz and Guadalajara, and some dresses she designs herself. She has been in this business for 8 years.
