These dresses are used for fifteenth-birthday parties, festivals and traditional dances in the schools. Currently, she needs more merchandise because the Mexican Independence festivities are coming in September, and she has several orders placed but does not have enough merchandise.

Flor has received a loan from FVP and paid it punctually. She would like to count with Kiva’s support to purchase merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Flor R. tiene una tienda de trajes tradicionales Mexicanos. Esta es la fuente de ingresos de ella ya que vive sola. Los trajes los manda a pedir del Sur de la ciudad de México como es en Chiapas, Puebla, Veracruz, Guadalajara y una parte ella los diseña. Ya tiene 8 años dedicandose a este negocio.

Estos trajes son usados para quinceñeras, fiestas y bailes tradicionales en las escuelas. Ahorita le está haciendo falta más mercancía ya que vienen las fiestas patrias de mes de Septiembre aquí en México y tiene varios pedidos y no cuenta con suficiente mercancia.

La Sra. Flor ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual lo pagó puntualmente. Ella quiere contar con el apoyo de Kiva para la compra de mercancía en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (traditional Mexican dresses) for her business.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José and his wife, Sanjuana, are making repairs to their home. Their roof is in very bad condition and water leaks into their home when it rains.

He is retired but continues to work in order to maintain his family. He had previously built a room made out of wood, but it gets soaked with the rain. He wants to repair the roof and the floor of this room with the support of a loan from Kiva.

He was not present when this photograph was taken because he works during the day. This photo shows his wife Sanjuana in the room that needs repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. José y su esposa, Sanjuana, están reparando su vivienda ya que el techo está en muy malas condiciones y cuando llueve se mete el agua a su casa.

El es una persona pensionada pero todavía sigue trabajando para poder salir adelante con su familia. El mismo había construido un cuarto de madera anteriormente, pero este se moja cuando llueve, y el quiere reparar el techo y el piso del cuarto con el apoyo del capital Kiva.

El no podia estar presente cuando se tomó esta foto ya que trabaja durante el dia. Esta es foto de la Sra. Sanjuana en el cuarto que necesita reparación.

loans.use: Repair the roof and the floor of a room in his home.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma Beatriz works at a company that offers all kinds of office equipment (copy, fax and other office machines). She lives alone with her two children (she is a single mom) and her work is the family’s sole source of income.

Her home needs some expanding being that the rooms are very small and the children need more space. Zulma has received loans from FVP before and has been punctual in her payments. She now looks for Kiva’s support to construct a room for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Zulma Beatriz trabaja en una compañía donde vende todo tipos de equipos de oficina (copiadoras, fax, y maquinas de oficina). Ella vive sola con sus dos hijos (es madre soltera) y su trabajo es la única fuente de ingresos de la familia.

La casa donde vive necesita una ampliación ya que los cuartos están reducidos y los niños necesitan mas espacio. La Sra. Zulma ya ha tenido créditos con FVP el cual ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Ella quiere ahora contar con el apoyo de Kiva para la construcción de un cuarto para los niños.

loans.use: Construction of a room for her children.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther has a general store in her home which she started one year ago. This client started her business with basic merchandise such as chips, bread and soft drinks, and today she has a few more products since she has been able to stock her store with more items. She has been tending to and managing the business so that it is stable.

This is the first time she requests a loan. She decided to make this request from FVP (Kiva’s partner in Nuevo Laredo) to stock her store with more merchandise and see it grow. This business is one of the sources of income with which she and her husband, Jose Fidel, count on to sustain their family (they have two children).

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Esther maneja su negocio de abarrotes de su propria casa desde un año. Este cliente inició su negocio con una mercancía sencilla de Fritos, pan, y refrescos y hoy en dia la señora tiene un poco más de productos ya que ha podido surtir de otras mercancías. Ella se ha dedicado a atender el negocio y administrarlo para que su negocio esté estable.

Esta es la primera vez que ha solicitado un préstamo. Ella decidió solicitar un préstamo de FVP (el socio de Kiva en Nuevo Laredo) para surtir más la mercancía y hacer crecer el negocio. Este negocio es una las fuentes de ingresos con que cuentan ella y su esposo, Jose Fidel, para sostener a su familia (tienen a dos hijos).

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Jonás

texts.en:
This young family recently purchased their first home, where they live with one child of school age. Mr. C. works in a maquiladora (a factory located in a special border free trade zone), and was able to gain access to a government program that helps low-income Mexicans to purchase a basic one room home.

He is requesting a Kiva loan in order to put a fence around the home, since as he said, "We have a young child and I'm worried about security, since there's no protection in the front of the house and the neighborhood is on the outskirts of the city."

The C. family is requesting a loan of $700.

loans.use: Construction of perimeter fence

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
The R. family has already had a previous housing loan from FVP, Kiva's partner organization in Nuevo Laredo, which they paid back punctually. Their plan now is to finish the roof of their house and begin construction of the second floor to create more space for the family of two adults and three children

Mr. R. is requesting a Kiva loan of $1,000 in order to complete this work.

Mr. R. works in a maquiladora (a factory located in a special border free trade zone) that manufactures heating equipment, and his wife, Belia, takes care of their children.

loans.use: Construct part of roof and second floor of family home

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir A. is 35 years old, married and has three children. For the last ten years he has run a small embroidery and tailoring shop. For a long time, he ran it by himself; now he employs two people and business is good.

He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Afghani to expand his shop and build a better life for his family.

In a few years, he would like to run a big store and have clients all over Kabul. He would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for their support, and extends special thanks to Kiva lenders around the world for the help they provide to poor people.

loans.use: He wants to enlarge his shop

loans.name: Abdulsabor

texts.en:
Abdulsabor G. is 20 years old, single and lives with his family. For the last five years he has run a small cosmetics shop in a crowed part of Kabul. Business is good, and he is applying for this loan to enlarge his shop and buy more items, including clothing, to sell to his customers.

Adbulsabor will pay the loan back in 18 months, and would like to thank Kiva and its lenders for their support. He is confident that this loan will help him expand his business, and that he will be able to pay it back in a timely manner.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mohammad Raman

texts.en:
Mohammad R. is 20 years old, unmarried, and runs a shop where he repairs cars. He has done this work for three years and is very good at it and has many clients, despite the fact that he has not been able to get much formal schooling. Before getting his job in Kabul, R. worked at a shop in Iran, but he likes his current position better because he is able to work with his brother.

Mohammad wants to enlarge his shop, and has applied for a loan to make this possible. He will repay the loan in 18 months, and plans to hire two or three new workers as a result of the increased business.

R. is happy to have microloans available in Afghanistan, and wants to thank AFSG, Kiva and the people whose funds make the loan possible.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Sayaad Massoud

texts.en:
Sayaad Massoud is 35 years old, married and has four children. He lives in Kabul, where he runs a construction supplies shop. He has been in this line of work for more than seven years, and believes the time has come to expand his shop by buying more supplies to sell to his customers. 

To make this possible, he has applied for a loan which he will repay in 18 months. He wishes to thank Kiva lenders and both Kiva and AFSG for giving him the chance to improve his family's life and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy additional materials to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nasrullah

texts.en:
Nasrullah K. is 46 years old, married and has 11 children. He has lived with his family in Jalalabad since 2001. Before that time he lived in Pakistan, where he worked while away from his family. Now his four sons have graduated from school and are taking additional computer courses. In their free time, they help their father in his business.

When Nasrullah was about nine years old, he began working with his father, who was a tailor. After five years as an apprentice, he became a full-fledged tailor. He continued to work with his father until he got married. At that time, he opened his own shop. 

Nasrullah worked hard, and in just a few months had many customers and was able to hire some employees to work with him. Because his income was good, he was able to enroll his sons in private courses in addition to their schooling. 

Nasrullah has applied for a loan to expand his business by selling cloth as well as tailoring services. He will buy the cloth in Pakistan, expand his small company and become a well-known and respected businessman. He wishes to thank his lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell from his shop

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.id:
After successful first loan from DINARI, Ni Wayan S. gained higher motivation to grow her kiosk. Her kiosk is now gaining more clients. This is also due to the training assistance from DINARI, in addition to the loan. Her kiosk now appears cleaner. Ni Wayan S. intends to grow her kiosk further by increasing the product offering. She plans to sell more main supplies like rice, soap and cooking oil. Therefore Wayan S. needs another loan that is larger than her first one. Especially now she plans to sell goods with higher prices. Currently she earns about $8 per day in profit. She hopes to gain more profit with the help of the loan.

Translated from Bahasa Inconesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setelah mendapatkan hasil yang cukup lumayan pada pinjaman tahap pertama, Ni Wayan S. semakin semangat dalam mengembangkan usaha warungnya, warung makanan miliknya kini semakin ramai di kunjungi pembeli. Hal ini tak terlepas dari binaan yang telah Ni Wayan S. terima dari Dinari sehingga kondisi warungnya kelihatan lebih menarik dan tampak lebih bersih.Wayan S. bermaksud untuk mengembangkan lagi warung ini menjadi lebih lengkap khususnya untuk barang –barang kebutuhan pokok seperti : Beras , sabun dan minyak goreng. Untuk itu wayan S. masih memerlukan dana pinjaman lagi , bahkan dengan jumlah yang lebih besar ,mengingat barang –barang tersebut harganya cukup tinggi.Dengan begitu keuntungan yang diperoleh kini sebesar Rp 70.000/ hari akan menjadi lebih meningkat, setelah mendapat tambahan modal.

loans.use: Increase product offering

loans.name: Ni Nyoman

texts.id:
Ni Komang W. enjoys her trade very much. She purchases cocoa from farmers and then resell it to wholesalers. She needs additional capital to be able to compete with other traders. She had obtained a loan from DINARI in the past that helped her business grow. Currently she earns about $3.5 to $4.5 per day. However, this profit is not sufficient to grow the business satisfactorily for W., as she needed to pay for daily expenses too. Furthermore, Cocoa prices has been increasing dramatically. She used to purchase Cocoa for $1.1 to $1.3 per kg, now she purchases cacaos at $2.2 per kg. So she intends to increase her working capital to be able to compete with larger traders. With this capital increase, W. hopes to be able to purchase more cacao, especially from her old suppliers/.

Translated from bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Komang W. sangat menikmati pekerjaan yang ditekuninya saat ini. Sebagai seorang pedagang yang membeli kakao dari petani dan kemudian dijual lagi ke pembeli besar, membutuhkan modal yang lebih untuk bisa bersaing dengan pedagang lain. Pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari dirasakan cukup membantu usahanya ini . Keuntungan yang di dapat W. saat ini berkisar antara Rp. 30.000.- s/d Rp. 40.000.- / hari. Namun keuntungan ini belum bisa meningkatkan modal yang di miliki oleh W. karena selain digunakan untuk biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari, W. juga harus bisa mengatur keuntungan ini untuk modal lagi. Hal ini disebabkan oleh karena pengaruh kenaikan harga barang yang begitu drastis. Kakao yang dulunya di beli dengan harga Rp. 10.000.- s/d Rp. 12.000.- / kilo kini melonjak mencapai Rp. 20.000.- / kilonya. Dengan demikian W. bermaksud untuk menambah kembali jumlah pinjamannya sehingga masih bisa bersaing dengan pedagang yang lain. Dengan tambahan modal ini W. berharap bisa membeli barang lebih banyak khususnya semua kakao petani yang sudah menjadi langganannya.

loans.use: Increase trading capital

loans.name: Ni Kadek

texts.id:
M.ś food kiosk has been growing very fast. She started the kiosk with $110 and then later she invested another $130 with loans from DInari. The kiosk started in a simple temporary building, now grown to a permanent building wit larger floor space. This is all due to M.ś hard work. Each day she opens the kiosk at 7 am. Sometimes she opens till midnight. M.ś hard work has started to show result. She saved the profit from her kiosk little by little. Now she is building a new home and kiosk with that savings. M. gained more motivation and is hoping to obtain more loans from DINARI that she plans to use to increase her kioskś offering. So she can increase its profit potential. M. plans to use the incremental profit to pay fore her kidś tuition.

Translated from Bahasa Inconesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Usaha warung milik M. berkembang sangat pesat .Warung yang dengan modal awal sebesar Rp 1.000.000,- dan tambahan modal Rp 1.200.000,- dari Dinari kini sudah menjadi warung yang cukup besar . Bangunan warung yang dulu sangat sederhana kini juga telah berubah menjadi warung yang permanen. . Hal ini tak terlepas dari kerja keras yang telah M. lakukan . Setiap hari M. memulai membuka warungnya dari pukul 07.00 pagi. Bahkan sering kali M. harus berjualan sampai tengah malam. Hasil kerja keras M. kini telah menuai hasil. Keuntungan yang didapat sedikit demi sedikit di tabungnya kemudian di pergunakan untuk membangun sebuah rumah dan tempat usaha yang baru. M. semakin bersemangat dalam menjalankan usahanya dan masih berharap mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari untuk periode berikutnya yang nantinya akan dia pergunakan untuk membeli barang dagangan untuk melengkapi isi warungnya, sehingga dengan demikian usaha warung M. akan menghasilkan keuntungan yang lebih banyak, untuk persiapan biaya sekolah anaknya.

loans.use: Increase Product Offering

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Mr. Keng K., 26, has been a fisherman in Trean Commune, Kampong Cham Province since 2002, earning about $2 per day, while his wife is a fish seller. Fishing is the main source of income for his family, so he needs to strengthen and expand his business to increase their income level. He is therefore requesting a loan of $600 to purchase fishing tools including a boat, gill net, and resin to caulk the boat. The picture shows Mr. K. and his wife.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools including a boat, gill net, and resin to caulk the boat

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung has borrowed 2 times from Kiva. She paid back her loans on time, did her job well and made more profit. She would like a loan from KIVA again in order to increase her store's stock.

loans.use: To increase her shop's stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Mekong Plus - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun N., a grocery seller who lives in Boeung Tras Village, Kampong Cham Province, sells to customers in her village as well as those who travel along the road in front of her house. She earns approximately $2 per day, as does her husband, a fisherman. Mrs. N. is responsible for selling her husband’s catch, and due to the difficulty of transporting the fish to market, she is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a second motorcycle for this purpose. The loan will thus allow her to increase her family's income. The picture is of Mrs. N. and her daughter.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a second motorcycle to transport fish to market.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong has borrowed 4 times from Mekong Plus and Kiva. She paid back her loans on time, did her job  well and made more profit. She is very happy with what she has done with the money she borrowed and now she would like to borrow again in order to continue and increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Mekong Plus - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mrs. Hong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Hong (ID: 09050094), aged 63, is a teacher. Her husband is a retiree, and is raising chickens at home. She has two grown-up children, both of whom are working. Mrs. Hong has never requested for a loan from any source before. Since learning about SEDA’s loan method and repayment term, Mrs. Hong has been very interested. In this round of loan, Mrs. Hong would like to borrow 3.186.00 VND to raise chickens. Other members in her group include:

-Mrs. N. Thi Thanh (ID: 09050090) would like to borrow 3.186.000 VND to raise chickens.

-Mrs. N. Thi Thanh (ID: 09050091) would like to borrow 3.186.000 VND to raise pigs.

-Mrs. N. Thi Chi (ID: 09050059) would like to borrow 4.256.000 VND to purchase food for her pigs.

-Mrs. N. Thi Huong (ID: 09050092) would like to borrow 3.186.000 VND to open a café.

-Mrs. T. Thi Dam (ID: 09050036) would like to borrow 3.360.000 VND to buy and sell fruits.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn thị Hồng năm nay 63 tuổi MS 09050094, cô là một giáo viên, và chồng cô là một cán bộ đã nghỉ hưu, nay ở nhà chăn nuôi gà thịt.2 con đều là công nhân viên, từ trước tới nay gia đình cô chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Khi có chương trình vay vốn và tích kiệm trả dần cô đã đăng ký tham gia và vay ở mức 3.186.000 VND để mua gà giống về nuôi. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của cô gồm có :

  • Chị Ngô thị Thành MS 09050090 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để phát triển chăn nuôi gà
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Thành MS 09050091 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn
  • Chị Ngô thị Chi MS 09050059 vay mức 4.256.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Chị Ngô thị Hương MS 09050092 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để kinh doanh nước giải khát
  • Chị Tạ thị Đảm MS 09050036 vay mức 3.360.000 VND để bán hàng hoa quả

loans.use: vay vốn chăn nuôi

loans.name: Ferooz

texts.en:
This young guy, Ferooz A., is 23. He is married and the father of two children. Ferooz lives with his parents in Shewa district. His father is about 50 years old and can't work, so Ferooz works alone, but sometimes his smaller brother helps him. Ferooz is an active man, and he has accepted to support all his family.

After 18 years of living overseas, when they returned to their homeland, Afghanistan, Ferooz and his father started a small business. They had 30,000 Afghanis of their own capital, so they opened a small retail shop and purchased some goods with this money.

After a few months, his father started farming, because they could not solve all their financial problems. So Ferooz was working in his shop, and his father on the land. Recently, his father has faced some serious illness, so he had to leave off work and rest at home. This is the reason why Ferooz changed his business and bought a CD shop in the bazaar. He thinks that there is much demand for this type of goods. Therefore, he has requested AFSG for 50,000 Afghanis loan for a period of 18 months. He wants to purchase a lot of CDs, cassettes, and radios with this money and find more customers.

Ferooz dreams that through this money he will increase his daily income and improve his business. Also, he hopes to start some computer and English language courses and become a well-educated teacher. He thanks the lenders who are helping poor people, especially when they show new business ways to the younger generation.

loans.use: To buy video cassettes etc. for his shop

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.en:
M. Asatullo is 25 years old. He is married. Asatullo uses his car to provide a taxi service. He has been in this business for the past three years. This business is the main source of income for his large family. 

Asatullo works hard. He gets up early and goes to bed late, trying not to miss any clients. Asatullo is trying to provide high quality service and attractive prices for his customers. 

To lower his fuel costs and reduce the fees for his services, Asatullo is planning to replace the fuel supply system in his car with a system that uses gas. For this purpose, he requests $500 USD for a term of 12 months. This is a first loan for Asatullo. He thanks everyone for their trust and support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a kapron gas cylinder for the fuel supply system.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said R. is a 54-year-old married man, father of five children and one of the residents of the Ningarhar province. He has four daughters and a son. His son is about 17 and he is studying in 10th grade. They live in their own home in Shewa district.

Said R. has been teaching in a public school for about 11 years, but his monthly salary is just about US$ 50, and it's difficult to provide for all the expenditures of his family with this small amount. Therefore, in his spare time, he farms besides his teaching. But even still, it's not enough to solve all his finanacial problems. He says that he can't buy fruit or meat every month for his family, and this is the reason why his family have been faced with different illnesses, and he can't cure them easily.

Now, Said R. has decided to buy some livestock and start another business. Also, he says that his son will help him with caring for them, because after school he has time to bring feed for the livestock.

R. thinks that if he sells their milk and yogurt in the bazaar, he may increase his daily income, and after a short time he will make a large husbandry farm. For this purpose, he has applied for 30,000 Afghanis loan from AFSG for a term of 24 months.

Said R. dreams of the day where he can depend on himself alone and of paving the way for his son to continue his higher education and become a great engineer.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.en:
Khayrullo B. is 37 years old. He and his wife who keeps house are raising two wonderful children. Khayrullo’s kids are small now, but already today he is working hard in order to ensure the best future for them.

For more than 7 years, Khayrullo has been rendering the service of house repairing. Khayrullo is an example of the type of person who cannot sit by and do nothing. He started his house repair business to provide for his family. First, Khayrullo started working as an apprentice, but gradually he has become an expert in this type of activity and now he has his own apprentices.

Currently, he wishes to grow his business and improve his family's quality of life. Today Khayrullo is requesting a loan of 1000 USD, which he will use to purchase the necessary material for repairing houses in order to provide his service with a high quality and to be able to fulfill pending jobs and orders on time. He plans to repay the loan within 18 months. He and his family are very grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing the necessary material for house repairing

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mr. Em S., 53, has been a house construction worker since 1995, earning approximately $2 per day, while his wife is a farmer who earns about $1.50 per day. They have two married and two single children, one a bricklayer and another a garment worker. Mr. S. is now requesting a loan of $250 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers for his wife’s farming business.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for his wife's farming business

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sina U., 25, a divorcee with no children, lives with her widowed mother along National Road Number One about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her mother has been a cotton scarf weaver for many years.

Sina has woven scarves for 15 years, a skill she learned from her mother, and sells her finished products to wholesalers at markets in Phnom Penh City. She and her mother have saved some money from their business to repair their old house but lack the funds to complete the repairs. Therefore, Sina is requesting a loan of $1000 to repair her house and bU. materials for her cotton scarf business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for scarf-weaving and repairing her house.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun T., 43, of Daunlaar Village, Kampong Thom Province, is the mother of four children and has been growing rice since 1998, earning about $4 per day. Assisted by her husband, she works hard everyday in order to provide for her children. They grow the rice crop twice a year: the rainy season and the dry season. Because this is their main source of family income, they are trying to improve and expand their farming business, so Mrs. T. is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a plot of farmland to increase her rice yield.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to expand her rice crop business

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Mr. Chhean C., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Chea Un, 47, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have four  children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory worker, two children study in local school, and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. Chhean has been a mason since 1991. He is also a fisherman, acquiring his catch from the village lake for both sale and family consumption. His wife stays at home taking care of the children. Fishing season is coming up soon, so Chhean is requesting a loan of of $200 to purchase a boat to continue his fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for fishing.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mr. Thol I., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Chanthol Rong, 31, who live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1992 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children study in local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Thol has been a motor taxi driver in Phnom Penh City for eight years, while Chanthol has been a farm worker in the village for two years. As well, the couple raises cows for selling, so Thol is now requesting a loan of $700 to purchase additional cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows for raising.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This 33-year-old, married man is Abdul W., a resident of Ningarhar province. He is the father of five children and the only breadwinner for them.

Abdul W. and his family live in a small rental house in Jalalabad. His two children go to school, but in their spare time, they help their parents at their work.

Abdul W. has been working as a tailor besides his farming and animal husbandry for about 10 years. Before that, he worked in Peshawar (Pakistan) in this field, but when he returned to his homeland, he changed his business and started farming. After a few months, he found himself confronted with a lot of financial problems, because his father was facing some serious illnesses and W. had to spend his own money for his father's treatment. This is the reason that W. lost his capital. Then he borrowed some money from one of his friends and opened a small tailor shop in Behsood district.

As Abdul W. is a hard-working man, he was able to repay the loan just in four months, and finally he bought some new tailoring machines and recruited two other workers for his business.

Now, Abdul W. hopes to expand his business more and increase his daily income, because he wants to enroll his children in some private educational courses and also rent a bigger house for his family. At present, they are living in a small rental house which has just two rooms with a small courtyard.

Therefore, Abdul W. has decided to take a 50,000 Afghanis loan from AFSG for a term of 24 months. He wants to purchase some cloth for the shop with 30,000 Afghanis and buy a cow with remainder of the loan money. He thinks if he does this, he may able to achieve his goals and will bring brilliant positive changes to his life.

Abdul W. dreams of building a big house for his family and of standing on his own feet completely. He thanks the lenders who help him reach his goals in advance.

loans.use: To buy livestock and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat R. is 45 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Muhabbat began a business so she could get ahead and cover household expenses, because her husband´s salary was not enough. She is a market vendor. She sells clothing for teenagers in the local market.

As a rule Muhabbat travels to the neighboring city to purchase the goods she sells with the help of her eldest son. In general the business is stable, having a strong trend for further development. However, Muhabbat stresses that after loans provided by the International Micro-Loan Fund IMON, she managed to accelerate the process of development of her business considerably.

Thus, for instance, thanks to one of the loans, Muhabbat was able to rent an additional booth in the market. Today she is planning to increase her working capital in order to expand her business and thus to be able to meet all the needs of her dearest children as day by day, they are growing up and their expenses are rising, too.

With this purpose in mind, Muhabbat is requesting 1200 US Dollars for a term of 10 months. With this loan she is planning to purchase clothing for teenagers. She promises to manage the current loan with accuracy as she has done all the previous ones. She thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Increasing her working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Mrs. Rem S., 35, and her husband, Mr. Vannak Kong, 36, who live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of their children study in local school while the remaining four are of preschool age.

Rem has been a scarf weaver for two years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for five years, and the couple is currently in the process of building their house (shown in the picture) but lacks the money to finish it. Therefore, Rem is requesting a loan of $1000 for materials to complete construction.

loans.use: To build her house.

loans.name: Malis

texts.en:
Mrs. Malis Nhoun, 38, and her husband, Mr. Tina Sum, 35, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have four children: one son and three daughters.
 
Malis has been selling grocery items for ten years, buying them from Prek Anchan Market for resale at her shop in front of the house, while Tina has been raising pigs for five years. He buys the piglets in the village to raise for sale to the slaughter house. Now Malis is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase additional piglets for her husband to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat K., 33, and her husband, Mr. Voeun Nhim, 32, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 2006 and have one son.
 
Mrs. Sinat has been a silk weaver for five years - a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker.

Sinat is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Mavjuda M. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 31 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has secondary education and stays at home. She had been growing rice for the past 3 years. This allows her not to purchase rice, which is usually expensive, on a market. She mainly uses her crops for her own family and sells any extras. At this point in time, Mavjuda would like to purchase quality seeds for the next sowing. After consulting with her family, she decided to take out a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Мавжуда Эргашевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 31 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее ,домохозяйка. Клиентка более 3 лет занимается посевом риса. Это позвляет ей не покупать на рынке рис,который стоит дорого, Свой урожай она использует для своих нужд , а лишнее реализует на рынке. В данный момент Мавжуда хочет закупить качественные семена для повторного посева. Посоветовавшись с близкими она решила взять кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase quality seeds

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.ru:
Abdulaziz B. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 36 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has secondary education. Abdulaziz owns a large piece of land planted with fruit trees. Every summer, he collects crops and sells it to wholesellers. This activity helps him support his family. At this time, he wants to purchase fertilizers and seedlings. For this reason, he decided to obtain a loan for 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Баракаев Абдулазиз житель района Шахринав. Возраст 36 лет , женат , имеет 4 детей. Образвание среднее. Абдулазиз имеет большой фруктовый сад . Каждое лето он собирает урожай и сдает его оптовым покупателем. Этот вид деятельности помогает ему содержать семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить минеральные удобренияя и саженцы для своего сада. Поэтому она решил взять кредит, сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Nasriddin

texts.ru:
Nasriddin S. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. He is in the business of buying and selling agricultural products. Nasriddin purchases fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices from the farmers and sells them at a local market. He has rich experince in this field after working there for 28 years. At this time, Nasriddin would like to purchase the next set of goods, for which he decided to obtain a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипов Насриддин Нусратович житель района Шахринав.Возраст 46 лет, женат, имеет 5 детей. Клиент занимается куплей продажей сельскохозяйственных продуктов. Насриддин оптом закупает у крестьян товар и реализует на местном рынке. Имеет опыт в этом бизнесе более 28 лет. В данное время клиент хочет закупить очередную партию товара.Для чего решил взять кредит, сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna Kanwal Baji is the wife of R. M. Anwar and lives in an area named Yadgar (a famous historical place) in Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her elder son works in a spare parts shop. The next eldest is an employee in a newspaper company named “Inkilab”. Her younger sons are enrolled in a school and are in 5th standard (level). Her first two daughters completed 12th grade. Her younger daughter is in 6th standard.

Hussna Baji is a housewife but she sews clothes and earns a profit. Her husband, R. M.Anwar, is a newspaper seller. He buys newspapers from a newspaper market and distributes them to various places. He has been in this profession for the last 10 years.

Husna Baji successfully completed three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and expanded her husband’s business. Now she is applying for a loan for the same purpose (to purchase more newspapers).

loans.use: To buy more newspapers

loans.name: Mirzosho

texts.ru:
Mirzosho R. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 61 years old, married, and has 7 children. He has secondary education and is a truck driver by training. Mirzosho would like to purchase a milk cow for his family. Since milk and dairy products are costly, his family cannot afford to buy them. Nevertheless Mirzosho has small grandchildren that need milk products for their growth. For these reasons, he decided to obtain a loan for 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджабов Мирзошо житель района Шахринав. Возраст 61 год, женат , имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее , по специальности шофер. Мирзошо хочет купить для семьи дойную корову .Так как покупать на рынке молоко и кисло-молочную продукцию его семья не может себе позволить. А у клиента есть маленькие внуки ,которым необходимо употреблять молоко.Поэтому Мирзошо решил взять кредит, сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow for a family

loans.name: Abduraim

texts.ru:
Abduraim K. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 48 years old, married, and has 4 children. He has secondary education and is a truck driver by training. Abduraim owns a small gas statioin, where he sells gasoline. He has been in this business for 28 years. His business is profitable, but to further develop it and increase the amount of sales, he would like to obtain a loan. He plans to use the loan to import more gasoline and pay off the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодиров Абдураим Азимович житель района Шахринав . Возраст 48 лет, женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее, по специальности шофер. Абдураим имеет небольшую автозапрвку , где торгует бензином. Имеет опыт в этом бизнесе 28 лет. Бизнес приносить доход , но для того , чтобы развивать бизнес и увеличить объем продаж хочет получить кредит.Клиент планирует на кредит завезти больше горючего, а погасит кредит в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Mrs. Trang's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. B. Thi Huyen Trang (ID: 030028), aged 23, would like to borrow a loan of 2.950.000 VND to run the business. She and her husband are very active and industrious. She purchases ingredients for her husband to make popcorns and sells them to other people in her neighborhood, who bring them to the market and sell them there. By doing this, Mrs. Trang has created job opportunities for people in her neighborhood as well as earned a stable income for her family. Mrs. Trang is very interested in joining SEDA so that she can request loans to expand her business. Her family’s daily income is about 130000 VND. Other members in her group include:

-Mrs. Nghiem Thi Sinh (ID: 030029) would like to borrow 2.950.000 VND to open a tailor shop.

-Mrs. Nguyen Thi Thom (ID: 030030) would like to borrow 2.950.000 VND to purchase ingredients to make popcorns.

-Mr. Nguyen Manh Tuong (ID: 030031) would like to borrow 2.950.000 VND to purchase steels to make doors.

-Mrs. N. Thi Thuy (ID: 030023) would like to borrow 2.950.000 VND to purchase ingredients to make popcorns.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

chị Bùi thị huyền Trang năm nay 23 tuổi MS 030028, hai vợ chồng chị rất năng động, hằng ngày chị thường mua ngô về cho chồng ở nhà nổ bỏng để bán cho các chị em khác trong thôn mang đi chợ bán, công việc đó đã tạo công ăn việc làm cho nhiều chị em khác trong thôn.Đồng thời gia đình chị cũng có thu nhập thường xuyên, chị rất thích tham gia vay vốn của chương trình vì nó giúp chị có thêm vốn hỗ trợ trong việc mở rộng kinh doanh, tiết kiệm tiền, tạo cho chị thêm năng động, mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị từ 130.000 VND/ ngày . Lần này chị đăng ký vay ở mức 2.950.000 VND để kinh doanh. Trong nhóm của chị có các thành viên sau :

  • chị N. thị Sinh MS 030029 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để lấy vốn làm thợ may
  • chị Nguyễn thị Thơm MS 030030 vay mức 2.950.000 VND về mua ngô nổ bỏng
  • anh Nguyễn mạnh Tưởng MS 030031 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để mua sắt làm cửa
  • chị Ngô thị Thuý MS 030023 vay mức 2.950.000 VND để mua ngô nổ bỏng bán

loans.use: vay vốn buôn bán

loans.name: Hairinisso

texts.ru:
Hairinisso M., 35, lives in Gissar district. She and her husband have three children. In order to support her family, Hairinisso has a trading stall at the district market where she sells clothes and shoes. She purchases her goods wholesale in the capital city of Dushanbe and sells them locally for a profit. Hairinisso has been in business for six years and is now applying for a loan to increase her sales volume. This will help her develop her business and increase her family's income.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Мухидинова Хайриниссо проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 35 , замужем и имеет троих детей. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью она занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Мубориз» Гиссарского района. Торгует одеждой, обувью . Привозит товар из города Душанбе , приобретая у оптовых реализаторов .Продает товар в розницу.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже шесть лет. Планирует получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет ей развивать свой бизнес и увеличить доход семьи.

loans.use: to increase her sales volume

loans.name: Adibahon

texts.ru:
Adibahon M., 28, lives in the village of Kipchak in Gissar district. She and her husband have four children. In order to support her family, Adibahon has a trading stall at the district market where she sells clothing. She has been in business for three years and is now applying for a loan to increase her sales volume. This loan will help Adibahon develop her business and increase her family's income.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Мухидинова Адибахон проживает в районе Гиссар в поселке Кипчак. Возраст 28 , замужем и имеет четверых детей. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью она занимается торговлей . Имеет торговую точку на рынке «Мубориз» Гиссарского района. Торгует одеждой. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Планирует получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет ей развивать свой бизнес и увеличить доход семьи.

loans.use: to increase her sales volume

loans.name: Hudoyqul

texts.ru:
Hudoyqul H., 49, lives in Tursun-zoda, Tajikistan. He and his wife have four children. Hudoyqul has a plot of land where he grows wheat. In order to prepare his land for the next planting, Hudoyqul would like to purchase seeds and fertilizer. To raise funds for the purchase, he has applied for a 10-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Хасанов Худойкул проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 49 лет , женат и имеет четверых детей. Занимется земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей. Для того, чтобы подготовить землю к повторному посеву, хочет закупить семена и удобрения. Для этого планирует получить кредит , сроком на 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru:
Bobomurod J. lives in Tursun-zoda, Tajikistan. He is 20 years old and a bachelor. Bobomurod has operated a private taxi business for one year. He wants to improve his business and buy a "Tiko" brand car, but as he needs another $600 to do this, Bobomurod has applied for an 8-month loan. The investment will bring him a steady income, since the car will break down less and require fewer repairs.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Джумаев Бобомурод житель городв Турсун-Заде. Возраст 20 леть. Холост. Занимается частным такси. Опыт работы один год. Собирается купить автомобиль марки « Тико» , но для этого у него не хватает 600 долларов США . Поэтому он обратился к нам за помощью.Хочет получить кредит сроком на 8 месяцев. Это поможет купить новую машину , что обеспечит стабильный заработок , так как не будет частых поломок и не придеьтся постоянно ремонтировать автомобиль.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Nazokat N. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a business selling basic foods. The business is her family's sole source of income. Her husband is unemployed, so she must work very hard to support the family. She decided to take out an 8-month loan, which will help her increase sales, her range of goods, and the business's profitability.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Набиева Назока проживает в городе Турсун-заде. Возраст 30 лет . Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует продуктами питания. Этот бизнес являетсмя единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Муж нигде не работает , поэтому ей самой приходится очень много работать , чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 8 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот, ассортимент и прибыльность бизнеса.

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru:
Mehrinisso N. is a businesswoman. She sells eggs in the Dehkon Market, providing the primary source of income for her family - her husband and two children. At 34 years old, she has 10 years of experience in this business. To further develop the buisness, she wants to increase sales turnover by taking out a loan. She will repay the loan in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурова Мехриниссо бизнесмен. Занимается торговлей на рынке «Дехкон» . Торгует яицами. Опыт работы в данном бизнесе 10 лет. Ее бизнес является основным источником дохода семьи. Мехриниссо замужем и имеет двоих детей. Ей 34 года. Для развития бизнеса хочет увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Tusuubira Women's Group

texts.en:
Harriet N. has been the leader of the Tusuubira Women's Group in Lugazi for 11 years. She is 43 years old and a single mother. She has three children who are in school and she also cares for two other relatives.

Harriet has a business tailoring clothes for women and children. She has over 17 years of experience in this business. Harriet's tailoring business is run from Lugazi. Her customers bring in their clothes for Harriet to sew and she also makes others to sell.

Harriet needs a loan so she can buy bitenge and traditional dress (gomesi). She also needs to settle the electricity bill at her work place.

Harriet has a dream of increasing the number of students to whom she teaches the sewing trade. She now has 5 students. She also hopes to buy more sewing machines in the near future.

loans.use: Harriet needs a loan to buy textiles for her trade.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Gulchehra K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She has a high school education. Her husband is a construction worker, but does not earn enough money to support the family. To bring in more income for her family, Gulchehra decided to buy a Tiko brand car and rent it out. A loan will help her purchase the car. She will pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодирова Гульчехра проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 43 года. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Муж работает на стройке, но его заработка не хватает для того , чтобы прокормить семью. Поэтому Гульчехра решила купить автомашину марки « Тико» и отдать в аренду. Это принесет ее семье дополнительный доход. Купить машину ей поможет получение кредита. Погасить кредит она сможет в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Vehicle purchase

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San E., 52, is a farmer in Sa Ang who lives with her husband, Touch Moa, and their two children. She and her husband work their fields together and make around US$ 1.80 each day. Their two children are students and are interested in continuing their education as much as possible.

San E. has asked for a loan of US$ 500 to do two things to help out her family's income. She would first like to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her family farm. She believes these products can increase her yield and allow her to increase her income as well. With any leftover money, she would like to purchase piglets to breed for additional income.

San E. understands that through diversifying her income sources, she can create a more stable situation for her family. She would like to continue expanding these businesses with any extra profits that she makes and she would also like to continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, insecticide; purchase pigs

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells fish and her husband is a fisherman. They have four children, and their income is not sufficient to meet their needs. Ama can sell more fish than her husband catches, but she needs capital to purchase them. She is requesting a loan so she can expand her fish business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business."

loans.name: Mukagwijje, Tusuubira Group

texts.en:
Hasifah M. is 42 years old and a single mother with 3 children. She also takes care of 1 niece.

Hasifah is the leader of her women's group. She runs a retail shop that sells clothes of various types, shoes, bags, belts, and umbrellas, among other items. Her shop is in Lugazi. Hasifah also has a tailoring business in Kampala. This is where most of the clothes in her shop are made. She also offers classes to students.

She has had her businesses for 15 years and has taken out loans from Pearl Microfinance in the past. Hasifah needs another loan so she can buy another designing machine for her workshop. She will also purchase a sewing machine so she can provide quicker service.

Hasifah employs men and women in her workshop. She feels happy that she can at least help her employees take home some income. She is a friendly person, which has won her more customers.

loans.use: Hasifah needs a loan to help her buy another designing machine and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. sells fish. She is a widow and her income is not sufficient for Cecilia and her three children. There is good demand for her fish, and she would like to sell more to increase her profits. She is requesting a loan to so she can buy more stock and have larger sales.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Neretse

texts.en:
Greetings from Rubona in Rwanda! E. is 47 years old and married with 6 children and two adopted orphans of the 1994 Genocide in Rwanda.

In 2001, E. started his business operating a retail shop. He sells beans, clothes, rice, cassava flour, sorghum, bars of soap, paraffin, and other domestic items needed by in the neighborhood. He earns about $125 every month. He is the sole trader in his shop. He is requesting a loan of 510,490 RWF to increase the stock in his shop.

loans.use: Neretse would like to increase his working capital

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua B. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income as a commercial driver is not sufficient for Efua and her seven children. Because there is good demand for her goods, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sipora

texts.en: Sipora A. is a 55-year-old widow and mother of 6 children. She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, with her children. She is the proprietor of a grocery stall, which she has run for the last 25 years. She sells various products, including fruits, vegetables, and eggs, commonly used in the community. She requires a US$500 loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income as a worker at a beach resort is not sufficient for Araba and her five children. There is a good demand for her fish. She is requesting a loan so she can increase her stock of fish and increase her sales.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business."

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret C. is a 50-year-old widow. She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, with her 6 children. She runs a retail shop in Bware, where she sells basic products such as milk, kerosene, bread, cooking oil, sugar, salt, soap, etc. Besides the retail shop, she also has a grocery stall where she sells vegetables. She needs an additional US$500 to expand her shop by purchasing more stock for sale in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for sale in bulk

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua Y. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income as a fisherman is not sufficient for Ekua and her five children. Because there is good demand for her fish, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock and expand her sales.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Mrs. Cuc's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Cuc (ID: 09050052), aged 54, has finished paying back the loan she requested in the previous round. She raises pigs and sells necessities in the market for a living, which generates a fairly stable amount of income for her family. Mrs. Cuc is very interested in the loan method and repayment term of SEDA. She has been using the loans from SEDA very effectively. In the next round of loan, Mrs. Cuc would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to renovate the breeding facilities and purchase more food for the pigs. Other members in her group include:

-Mrs. Ngo Thi Bon (ID: 09050062) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to purchase food for her chickens.

-Mrs. N. Thi Lan (ID: 09050061) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to purchase food for her pigs.

-Mrs. Ngo Thi Luyen (ID: 09050060) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to raise chickens and go to the market.

-Mrs. N. Thi Thu (ID: 09050064) would like to borrow a loan of 2.242.000 VND to breed pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva Volunteer.

Cô Nguyễn thị Cúc MS 09050052, năm nay 54 tuổi Cô đã tham gia vay vốn của chương trình qua một chu kỳ và hoàn trả vốn rất tốt. Hằng ngày Cô đi chợ và chăn nuôi lợn nên mức thu nhập của gia đình Cô cũng khá ổn định.Cô rất thích hình thức vay vốn này, vì nó đã giúp Cô có được những khoản tiền mà Cô đi chợ và chăn nuôi tiết kiệm được để sử dụng vào những mục đích lớn trong gia đình. Lần này Cô đăng ký vay ở mức 3.808.000 VND để sửa chuồng lợn và mua cám lợn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm của Cô :

  • Chị Ngô thị Bốn MS 09050062 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để mua cám gà
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Lân MS 09050061 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Chị Ngô thị Luyện 09050060 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ
  • Chị Nguyễn thị Thu MS 09050064 vay mức 2.242.000 VND để mua lợn giống

loans.use: vay vốn chăn nuôi

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana A., who is a 52-year-old married mother of 8 children, requires a US$500 loan to help expand her vegetable stall business.

loans.use: To expand her vegatable business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. sells fish. She is married, but her husband's income as a carpenter is not sufficient for Patience and her five children. Demand for fish is good, and she is requesting a loan to increase her stock and her sales.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Nakaweesi, Tusuubira Group

texts.en:
Milly N. is a mother of 4 children. In the photo she is holding her last born. She is 33 years old and the leader of this group. She has had a retail shop in Lugazi since 1999. She has been a client of Pearl Microfinance for 5 years.

In her shop, Milly sells sugar, salt, soap, vaseline, hair chemicals, braids and clothes of various types. Her husband has his own businesses, but he usually helps her in her shop on busy days, like weekends and public holidays.

Because Milly has many products in her shop, she has won many customers. Most of all, she has succeeded because she is careful with her funds and plans accordingly. She does not entertain unnecessary spending. Milly now needs a loan to help her restock her shop with more products to sell.

loans.use: Milly needs a loan to help her buy more sugar, salt, soap, vaseline, hair chemicals, braids and children's clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells Kenkey, a local meal which she prepares. Ama is married to a fisherman, but their income is meagar. She normally buys the maize she uses for the preparation of the food in small quantities. Her profits would increase if she could buy maize in bulk and make more Kenkey at a time. So she is requesting a loan so she can increase the amount of food she makes and increase her sales. Her Kenkey is a very good seller.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business."

loans.name: Eside

texts.en: Eside is a 65-year-old widow and mother of 7 children. She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya. Eside, who also supports 10 orphans left behind due to HIV/AIDS, is the proprietor of a grocery stall. She is able to generate enough income from her business to pay for her daily upkeep. She has applied for a US$500 loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Peter  Mhari

texts.en: Peter Mhari M. is a business man in the Buguruni area. He runs a shop selling cereal crops and soft drinks in Makoka Street. He purchases the commodities from Kariakoo city Market and wholesale shops around Buguruni market. He has been in this business for more than four years. He is requesting a loan of $750 so he can increase his stock and expand his business. His profits go to support his family.

loans.use: To increase his stock and expand his businesss

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 38-year-old married mother of 5 children, 3 of whom are in school. She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, and is a member of the Buchwa women's group. She sells secondhand clothes in the marketplace. She gets her products, especially children's and women's clothes, from Nairobi at a lower price and sells to her clients; thus she is able to maximize her income. Emily requires a US$600 loan to buy more stock of secondhand clothes in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Yen's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Yen (ID: 09050051), aged 39, is an energetic and optimistic woman. She and her husband have two young healthy sons. In addition to farming at home, Mrs. Yen breeds silkworms and sell their products, which help her family earn a fairly stable amount of income each month. Mrs. Yen started requesting for loans in the previous round and finished paying back the loan. In the next round of loan, Mrs. Yen would like to borrow 4.256.000 VND to invest in her business. Other members of her group include:

-Mrs. N. Thi Tam (ID: 09050054) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to invest in breeding silkworms.

-Mrs. N. Thi Hue (ID: 09050056) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to run the business in the market.

-Mrs. N. Thi Binh (ID: 09050058) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to purchase facilities to raise pigs.

-Mrs. N. Thi Viet (ID: 09050023) would like to borrow a loan of 3.808.000 VND to collect and resell refuse.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa N., Kiva volunteer.

chị Ngô thị Yến năm nay 39 tuổi, MS 09050051 chị là một phụ nữ rất năng động và tích cực,chồng chị là một cán bộ nhà nước. hai vợ chồng chị sinh được 2 cháu trai rất mạnh khoẻ. Chị ở nhà vừa làm ruộng, lại đi buôn bán thêm một số sản phẩm từ nghề làm tơ, nên mức thu nhập của gia đình cũng khá ổ định. Chu kỳ trước chị Yến tham gia vay vốn và trả rất tốt, chu kỳ này chị đăng ký vay ở mức 4.256.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ. Trong nhóm chị có các thành viên sau:

  • chị Ngô thị Tám MS 09050054 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để thêm vốn làm tơ kén
  • chị Ngô thị Huệ MS 09050056 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ
  • chị Nguyễn thị Bình MS 09050058 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để mua cám chăn nuôi lợn
  • chị Nguyễn thị Việt MS 09050023 vay mức 3.808.000 VND để kinh doanh phế liệu

loans.use: vay vốn buôn bán

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun M., age 51, is the mother of two children and resides with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has a business selling a variety of fruits in front of a garment factory, earning around US$ 12 in revenue per day. Her husband has worked as a village chief since 2000. Noun M. also gets support from one of her children who is married and works in a garment factory earning US$ 40 every month.

Noun M. says there are many people doing the same business as she so she needs to diversify her products to better serve her customers. She would like to borrow from Kiva through Credit, Kiva's local partner, to purchase many kinds of fruit to sell.

In the future, she wants her son to finish at least high school. Noun M. is pictured at her stand in front of the garment factory.

loans.use: To diversify her inventory

loans.name: Mwanahamina

texts.en: Mwanahamina A. is a married business woman who lives in Tanzania. She has a retail shop in Makangarawe in Temeke District. She sells a variety of commodities including serial crop products. Her business is two years old and her customers are local families. She purchases the items from Kariakoo city market and from wholesale shops. Her income is used to feed her family. Mwanahamina is requesting a loan of $550 so she can expand her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nyiramuhanda

texts.en:
Greetings from G. in Rwanda! G. is a 44-year-old businesswoman, married with 7 children and three orphans adopted after the 1994 Genocide.

In 2004, G. joined a credit association to access a micro loan to start her business selling drinks and beverages as a wholesaler. She is renting a store where she sells beverages in large quantities to retailers in the area and far into the rural areas. She earns about $145 every month. She is applying for a loan worth 510,490 RWF to increase on her stock.

loans.use: Gorette want to Increase her working capital

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
Ouch K. H., 55, lives in Sa Ang with her husband, Ouch Sengly, and their two working children. She sells porridge out of her home every day and makes about US$ 2.50 per day, while her husband teaches in the local school. Their children work growing vegetables and selling them in the local food market to support the family.

Ouch K. H. has asked for a loan of US$ 1000 to diversify her family's income and improve her standard of living. She would like to purchase some piglets to raise and sell for additional income. She sees this, not only as a profitable venture in the short term, but also a business that might be able to provide for her family in the future. With any leftover money, she would like to repair her family's home. To provide for the comfort and safety of her family, she sees this, too, as a valuable investment. .

loans.use: Purchase pigs; repair home

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea S., age 44, lives in Phnom Penh, with his wife and two children ages 17 and 1. Their 13-year-old child lives away from home in order to attend a good school. Mr. Chea works as a soldier, earning around $2 each day. Mrs. Chea operates a business outside of their house. In the front she operates a grocery store.

To improve their standard of living, she would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, to open another business, ordering clothes from a garment factory to sell around her community. The loan would also help her to expand her grocery store's inventory. Between the two businesses she can now generate $8-10 in profit. (Mrs. Chea is pictured in front of her store selling groceries.)

loans.use: Add to their grocery store's inventory and order clothes to sell

loans.name: Kilibaki Women's Group

texts.en:
Edina M. is the chairperson of the Kiribaki Women's Group in the Bugembe, Jinja District. She is 49 years old and married with 4 children. Her oldest child is a civil engineer, her second child is a teacher and her third child is studying medicine at Mulago Hospital. The youngest is still in school; in senior five.

Edina has been able to pay school fees for her children's education with the money she earns from her restaurant business. When she started getting loans from Pearl Microfinance, she was able to add a retail shop to her restaurant and open a business keeping cattle. Edina now has 4 cross-bred cows and two calves, which generate a total of 20 litres of milk every day for sale. With the money she earns, she is able to pay her workers who help to feed and milk the cows. With the remaining funds, she and her husband are constructing a residential home.

The group is sitting at Edina's home. Behind is the new house that is being constructed. One of the workers is holding a spade.

Edina needs a loan to help build the inventory in her shop. She would like to buy more cold drinks and cereals to sell.

loans.use: Edina Muzaale needs a loan to help her buy more cold drinks and cereals to sell in her shop

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Nigina K. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 28 years old, unmarried, and has a high school education. For the past five years she has been selling children's clothing at her stall in the market in Dushanbe. Nigina lives with her parents, and her business is the family's only source of income. In order to increase the volume of sales, Nigina decided to take out a loan to be paid back over 15 months. This will help her increase profits and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Нигина Алматовна жительница города Турсун-Заде. Ей 28 лет. Она не замужем . Имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей детской одежды. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города Душанбе. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 5 лет. Живет с родителями и единственным источником дохода их семьи является ее бизнес. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот планирует получить кредит сроком на 15 месяцев. Это поможет ей увеличить доходность бизнеса и улучшить условия жизни.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng R., age 47, works as a housewife looking after the children and cooking food for the family. Her husband, Hun Tao, 45, has a business catching fish and selling them at the market, earning around $5 in profit each day. This couple has four children, one of whom is a construction worker building houses; one is married, and two are students.

To catch more fish, as it is currently the rainy season, Mrs. Eng would like to borrow fR. Kiva to purchase more fishing implements and nets for her husband. (Mr. Hun is pictured with fishing net.)

loans.use: To purchase more fishing implements

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 55-year-old entrepreneur who runs a retail shop in Bware Migori, Kenya. She is married and has 2 children. She has received and paid back her previous loans from KMET. She now requires US$600 to further expand her shop.

loans.use: To expand her retail shop

loans.name: Has

texts.en:
Has S. H., 45, lives with her husband, Moul Rath, and their five children in Sa Ang. She and her husband work as farmers in the rice fields and make about US$ 2.50 each day. Their children also all work and they too are farmers who grow rice or different types of vegetables to help support the family.

Has S. H. has asked for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase seeds to expand her current farm. She sees the growth of her rice farm as a good way to increase her family's income and improve her standard of living. Inflation has made it a very difficult time economically for many Cambodians and loans that are used to expand businesses and increase incomes can be very helpful.

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut C., age 21, is the mother of one little child and works as a housewife staying at home looking after her child and cooking food for her family. Her husband is a technician, making around $5 each day.

To make more income, Mut C. would like to borrow from Kiva through Credit, Kiva's local partner, the sum of US$ 600 to raise pigs and purchase feed for pigs. (Mrs. C. is pictured with the proposed pigpen at her house.)

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Mr. Pisey S., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Vanno Kok, 40, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study in the local school, and the youngest one is still too young for school and stays at home.

Mr. Pisey has been a mason for sixteen years. He does his work in his village, a nearby village and in Phnom Penh City as well. His wife grows rice in the farm not too far from home. 

Currently, Mr. Pisey needs new materials for his business because his old materials are broken and cannot be used anymore. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase construction materials for continuing his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his construction business.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke K., 42, is a housewife with four children and resides with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Her husband, Un Chanthy, 46, is a construction worker building houses, making around US$ 6 each day. Two of their children are construction workers like their father and the others are students.

Mrs. K. would like to borrow from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, US$ 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to commute to work. This will reduce the sum that Chanthy pays a motor-taxi driver every day to get to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for the commute to work

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Miss Sokha B., 46, is single and lives in a small village off of National Road Two, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, with her elderly mother and her sister's family. 

Miss Sokha has been in the business of selling small trees and flowers since 1979. She sows tree and flow seeds in her farm around her house for selling in the village. 

Sokha and her family members live in an old house and they have saved some money from their business to repair the house. Now the family lacks the money to finish some parts of the house. Therefore, Sokha is requesting a loan of $800 to buy materials for repairing her house.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more stock of consumables

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin C., 38, lives with her husband, Kis Thy, in Phnom Penh with their three children. She sells duck eggs and yams, typically making US$ 7 per day, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver who makes around US$ 3 each day.

Phin C. has asked for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband's motorbike. This trailer would really serve two purposes that the couple could benefit from. First, it would allow her husband to transport more passengers and increase his income each day. It would also allow Phin C. to transport her yams and other vegetables to better reach customers. She believes this investment can help her family improve its standard of living and increase its income in the long term.

loans.use: Purchase trailer to attach to motorbike

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Mr. Saret P., 28, and his wife, Mrs. Sarith Pho, who  live in a small village off of National Road Two about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have one son. The couple lives with Sarith's mother.

Mr. Saret has been a construction worker for two years. Now he wants to create another business driving a motor taxi (Tok Tok). His wife sells small trees and flowers at her shop in the village. Currently, she is learning to weave silk for creating another business as well.

Saret is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a trailer for driving Tok Tok. He hopes that this new business will provide a good income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for driving motor taxi (Tok Tok)

loans.name: Ton

texts.en:
Mrs. Ton P., 24, a farmer who lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province, grows rice on her farmland and earns approximately $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Nov Khoeurn, 26, sells pieces of wood that he finds in the forest to customers in and around his village. A hard worker, he earns approximately $2 per day. They have two children, both of preschool age. Because of transportation difficulties, Mrs. P. is now requesting a loan of $500 to purchase two buffaloes to transport the wood to her husband’s customers with the remainder of the funds being used to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop. This loan will help to increase the family's income and raise their standard of living.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase two buffaloes to transport wood as well as buy fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Teoung

texts.en:
Teoung Y., age 52, lives with her husband and has had a business selling groceries from her home since 2000, making around US$ 3 in profit per day. Her husband, 59, is an older father and so stays at home and helps his wife selling groceries as well. This couple has three children and all of them are married and no longer live at home.

Mrs. Teoung Y. would like to borrow from Kiva to purchase wood, sand, cement and rock to build rooms to rent out. The loan will also help her to increase her grocery inventory.

loans.use: Build rooms to rent out and add to grocery inventory

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P., 46, and her husband, Mr. San Thorn, 51, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh, have been married for twenty one years and have three sons. Two of their sons have full time employment and the other one is in the local school.
 
Mrs. Sopheap has been a silk weaver for seven years - a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh.  Mr. San has been a hair dresser for thirty years.

Sopheap is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal C., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Neang Kim, 50, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1982 and have only one daughter who is in school.
 
Mr. Sophal has been a mechanic for twenty eight years. He learned to repair many types of machines during on the job training from his friend in 1980. He started his own business after he got married in 1982. His wife does house work and looks after their daughter.

Sophal is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase some spare machine parts for his stock.

loans.use: To purchase some spare machine parts for his stock.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay L., 56, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia.
