She has had a business selling rice and noodles in the village since 2005, earning around US$ 12 each day. Her husband, Nuon Srouy, 61, is a motor-taxi driver, making around US$ 4 in profit each day. Four of their children are married and no longer live at home and the last child is a student.

Lay L. would like to borrow from Kiva to invest in her business; any remainder of her loan will be used to purchase wood to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs so as to increase rice and noodles customers and repair their house.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng C., 28, lives with her husband, Nov Virak, and their four children in Dangkao. She works as a tailor and makes about US$ 5 each day, while her husband transports passengers in his tuk-tuk (a motorbike with an attached passenger cart). She has asked for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's business. His bike is frequently in need of repair and the family believes that it can save them money to purchase a new one.

They are seeking out ways to support their large family and are faced with the same difficult economic environment as many other Cambodians. Inflation has been very high and soaring food and gas prices have made it difficult for many Cambodians to improve their situation.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorbike for business

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mrs. Nov T., 52, is married and has four children. She lives in Kampong Channang province, Cambodia. She has a stand at her home selling a variety of grocery products and food products to the people in her community, making about US$ 4 in income. One of her daughter also works at the stand, helping her.

Because her customer demand is growing from day to day, Mrs. Nov T. is requesting a loan to expand her inventory so that she can provide many options of products for her customers. (One of her children is pictured because Mrs. Nov T. was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to expand her inventory

loans.name: Tafrosa

texts.en: Tafrosa V. is a member of Buchwa women group in Migori Kenya. She is a 50 year old married mother of seven children. She runs a retail shop in Bware where she sells fast moving consumables mostly used by the community. She requires US $ 500 to buy more stock of consumables.

loans.use: Purchase more stock.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem S., 38, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband, Tith Yorn, and their three children. She and her husband work together purchasing vegetables from the growers and reselling them in the markets in their area. They typically make US$ 3 each day, and they are also supported through the income of their daughter who sells sugar cane juice. The sugar cane juice business usually brings in US$ 5 each day in revenue.

The family is seeking to increase its income and improve its standard of living. Khem S. has asked for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase more vegetables and invest in their business. She can increase her income through increasing her inventory and she believes that she has a good business plan that will help the family in the long-term.

Khem S. was unavailable for a photograph, so her daughter and her sugar cane juice business is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables and invest in their business

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina B. is a 30 year old woman who lives in Khogana Dobato. Khogana Dobato is located in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. B. lives in a single family home with her husband and their two daughters. Her husband Mr. Rajan B. went to Malaysia for work. Her older daughter is studying in grade 5 and her younger daughter is just two-years-old.

Mrs. Rina B. is a grocery shopkeeper in Khogana Dobato. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop. These items include rice, maize, noodles, and other snacks. Due to her poor economic condition, she cannot afford to buy many goods for her shop during times of shortage. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy various types of grocery items for her shop.

Mrs. B. wants to use her income to provide a quality education for her daughters. She also wants to upgrade the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Sarswati Chand

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati Chand T. lives in Khogana-Dobato. There are five members in her family. She has two daughters and one son. Her older daughter is studying in grade 9 and her younger daughter is studying in grade 5. Her son is in primary school.

Mrs. Sarswati husband's name is Mr. Ram Chand T.. He owns his own micro bus. He drives the microbus from Kathmandu to Birjung. Unfortunately, he was in an accident and his bus was damaged. Therefore, to repair his microbus, Mrs. T. is requesting this loan.

loans.use: To repair her microbus

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala P. is a resident of Khogana Dobato. Khogana Dobato is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in farming.

Mrs. P. lives in a single family home with her husband and three children. Her husband's name is Damodhar and he works in a private office. Her daughter is studying at the BBS level. Her older son passed his +2 exam this year and her younger son is studying in grade 12.

Mrs. P. is a grocery shop keeper in Khogana Dobato. She opened her grocery shop 5 years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on. All her children help her in her shop. Now Mrs. P. is requesting a loan so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Tuzamurane solidarity group of hard working entrepreneurs from Kigali in Rwanda!

This group is composed of 10 members. Uwingeneye Jackline is 20 years and old single. She sells different items like soap and salt, and she operates a small restaurant. She earns $60 every month. Ndayisaba is 35 years old and married with five children. He owns a small restaurant and earns a round $60 every month. Mutuyimana A. is 37 years old and married with six children and one adopted orphan. She sells second-hand clothes in the local markets and earns about $50 every month. Uwimana S. is 49 years old and married with five children. She sells women's fabrics in the market and earns about $60 every month. Kabayondo Patricia is 66 years old, a widow of the Genocide with six children. She sells different items like Sorghum flour, corn flour, cassava flour, and kilograms of salt and sugar in the area. She earns about $30 every month. Mujawayezu is 30 years old, a widow of Genocide with one child. She sells tomatoes, potatoes, rice, sugar, salt, cassava flour, etc. Haragirimana Jmv is 36 years and married with five children. He sells Sorghum to the local beer breweries in the area. He earns about $50 every month. Bayiro is 50 years old and married with 10 children. He owns a small shop selling different items like sorghum, pieces of soap, salt, sugar, matchboxes, etc. He earns about $60 every month. Habumugisha is 45 years old and married with five children. He buys and sells sorghum to different breweries in Kigali. Rutayisire is 45 years old and married with seven children and four adopted orphans. He buys beans from the local growers and sells them to markets in Kigali town. He earns about $60 every month.

This group includes a total of 36 children and 6 adopted orphans. The loan request is 80,000 RFW per each entrepreneur. The loan will be used to expand their businesses.

loans.use: The loan will be used to expand their businesses

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth K. is a married mother of 6 children, all in school. She is the proprietor of a retail kiosk, which she initiated in 1985. She has received and repaid her previous loans from KMET and now requires US$500 to further expand and improve her kiosk.

loans.use: To expand and improve her retail shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 26-year-old widow and mother of 2 young children. Her husband died early last year. She has received and repaid her previous microfinance loans from KMET. Jane sells secondhand clothes at the marketplace. She hopes that her business will be able to generate enough income to support her young family. She requires US$600 to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Groupement Des Femmes De Aynoumane

texts.fr:
These women are part of the large Lingueres de Mbour association. They have a good history with the IMCEC credit organization, dating from two years ago. They buy vegetables, fish, oil and second-hand clothes, which they resell in their neighborhoods around the village of Mbour. They are mothers of families, very lively and hardworking. They will use this loan to augment their working capital, thereby increasing their stock and diversifying the products they carry.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Elles font parti du grand groupement des Lingueres de Mbour. Elles ont une bonne expérience avec l’IMCEC (deux ans). Elles achètent des légumes, du poisson, de l’huile et de la piperie qu’elles revendent dans leurs quartiers situés à la périphérie de la commune de Mbour. Elles sont des mères de familles très dynamiques et travailleuses. Elles vont investir le crédit dans le renforcement de leur fonds de roulement et ainsi, améliorer le niveau de les stocks et la diversité de leurs produits

loans.use: Supplementation of working capital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 58-year-old mother of 9 children. She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, and runs a grocery business she initiated in 1984. She has applied for a US$500 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 55-year-old married mother of 8 children. She buys vegetables such as sukuma wiki (kale), onions, and tomatoes in bulk and sells them to her clients in small quantities. She requires a US$500 loan to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables for sale

loans.name: Groupement De Keur Madiagne

texts.fr:
These women have a good history with the IMCEC credit organization, dating from two years ago. They buy vegetables, fish, oil and second-hand clothes, which they resell in their neighborhoods around the village of Mbour. They are going to use this loan to augment their working capital, thereby increasing their stock and diversifying the products they carry. They are part of the large Lingueres de Mbour association. They are mothers of families, very lively and hardworking.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Elles ont une bonne expérience avec l’IMCEC (deux ans). Elles achètent des légumes, du poisson, de l’huile et de la piperie qu’elles revendent dans leurs quartiers situés à la périphérie de la commune de Mbour. Elles vont investir le crédit dans le renforcement de leur fonds de roulement et ainsi, améliorer le niveau de les stocks et la diversité de leurs produits. Elles font parti du grand groupement des Lingueres de Mbour .Elles sont des mères de familles très dynamiques et travailleuses.

loans.use: Fortification of working capital

loans.name: Tafrosa

texts.en: Tafrosa is a 52-year-old widow. She lives with her 8 children in Migori, Kenya. Tafrosa specializes in selling omena (local language for a certain species of fish). She buys fish and supplies it to her customers. She has applied for a US$500 loan to buy more stock in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Married with two children, Habiba is a twenty-six-year-old trader. She trades in maize and beans. She has been trading for the past ten years and has since been a good resource for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize and beans to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in her country. She is a member of the trust group called Nyame yie. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support for each other to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize and beans.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en: Salina is 32 years old. She is a wife and mother of three kids. Currently, the kids are in school. She has been sewing for eight years. She is a specialist in female clothing. Her skills and designs are excellent. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers new looks, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She also sells sachet water as a distributor to give her extra income to support her family. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency, as well as sachet water. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called "Nyame yie Group". In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support to each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is twenty-nine years old. She is married with two kids. She needs to support her family with additional income so she decided to start a trade. She has been selling soaps and bleaches for the past eight months. She obtains her supply of soaps and bleaches from wholesalers and retails them to her customers who are mostly householders, food vendors, drivers etc.  She wants to use her loan to buy soaps and bleaches in bulk to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use proceeds from her operation to support her kids in school.  Gloria is a member of the group called Diamond. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy soaps and bleaches in bulk.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, a 51-year-old trader, is married with five children. Three of her children have completed senior high school. She is a very resourceful wife and mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Janet supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing and shoes. There is a very big market in Ghana for used clothing, as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling of used clothing has created opportunity for many women. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing and shoes to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store in which to trade. She is member of the group called Gold. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy increased bales of used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 44 years old and a married mother of four children. Two of them are in school; the first two have completed high school. She treks to the farming communities in the Volta region of Ghana to purchase local rice to sell in the market, as she has for ten years now. She says increased prices of rice and fuel have reduced her working capital. She hopes the loan will enable her to inject more capital into the business to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband in paying the children's school fees. She is a member of the group called Diamond Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and assist each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of local rice.

loans.name: Irizerwa A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Irizerwa solidarity group of hard working entrepreneurs in Kigali Rwanda! This group is composed of nine members, including Kabarungi M., Bayingana S., Mutegwaraba Gaudance, Nzaramba, Nduwamungu B., Mukagatare Domitilla, Nyirasafari Clemantine, and Umutesi E.. Members include three widows of the Genocide and one orphan. They have different businesses including shops, food stores, and selling dairy products, and each entrepreneur earns about $65 per month.

This group started accessing loans from VFC in 2005. The loan requested will be used to expand their businesses. The total loan amount is 1,800,000 FRW for all 9 entrepreneurs, and the loan repayment period is 8 months.

loans.use: The loan will be used to expand their businesses

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: For the past four years, Faustina has been trading in palm oil. She is a 50-year-old married woman, with two children who are in school. She treks to Asamang, a town in the eastern region of Ghana, to purchase palm oil from the producers in bulk so she can sell it to her customers. She says increased prices of rice and fuel have affected her working capital and she can no longer buy enough palm oil to sustain her business. She wants to use the loan to buy palm oil in bulk to avoid price hikes and frequent travel. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband in paying the children's school fees. She is a member of the group called Gold Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and help each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy bulk gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Mukamwiza

texts.en:
Greetings from Gakenke in the Northern province of Rwanda! C. is 23 years old, hard working, and married with three children.

In 1998, C. started a business operating her own small shop selling different items needed by her neighbors, like soap, salt, sugar, potatoes, maize flour, cassava flour, sacks of beans and sorghum, etc. Since 2004, she started accessing loans from VFC. She has been able to build her family house and pay school fees for her children. She earns about $40 every month. She employs one person to help her to run the business. The loan will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: The loan will be used to expand her business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with two grown kids who live with her. She supports her family with a business selling groceries. She has been in this business for only 7 months and has already gained some experience as an entrepreneur and as a sales person. One of the things she enjoys the most about her business is the opportunity to help her customers get healthy and nutritious foods. She tries to have a variety of products on hand so that she is able to offer a range of choices and meet each customer's needs. Presently, Nataliya has over $5000 in inventory. Her net profit is about $300 each month.

Nataliya's goal is to continue to learn and improve her business. She has requested a loan for 5000 Grivnas ($1075 USD) so that she can purchase some additional inventory. Summer time is a very busy season for many grocery market vendors in Ukraine. This loan will enable Nataliya to be prepared for increased demand and earn some additional income that will help herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Nzabanita

texts.en:
Greetings from Nyabihu in the Northern province in Rwanda! L. is 52 years old and married with three children and one adopted orphan. He has been doing business for over 20 years now, selling potatoes, cabbage, tomatoes, beans, corn, etc. In 2000, He started a small shop selling fertilizers, spraying chemicals, sugar, rice, nails for building houses, and maize flour.

In 2005, L. joined VFC to access loans to start his small shop. He employs one person and makes about $115 every month. The loan would be used to expand his business and to pay for the school fees for his children. He is requesting for a loan worth 515,000 RWF.

loans.use: The loan use would be to expand his business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with two kids. She is a small entrepreneur from the town of Znamenka where she sells inexpensive clothing for women and hot tea/coffee. Her business is located in a very good place -- right at the entrance to the marketplace. Tatyana started as a retail tea and coffee vendor. Then she rented a kiosk and stocked it with women's clothing which facilitated growth of her trade. She has been in business for three years. Currently, she has about $2000 in inventory. Her profit is about $400-600 a month. 

Tatyana is very experienced and skilled. She purchases only marketable merchandise for further retail sales in her kiosk. She is seeking a 3000 Grivna ($1075 USD) loan to re-stock her inventory and increase the assortment of clothing items for sale. One of Tatyana's long-term goals is to open a covered kiosk which would look more like a small store. As for her personal dreams she would love to fix some things in her old private house where she lives with her husband and two daughters.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi is married with two children: a 12-year-old son and a 14-year-old daughter. He sells audio and video devices, CDs, DVDs, video games, play stations, etc. in his little open kiosk in Znamenka. Valeryi has an individual approach to each client and sometimes does special deliveries of his clients' requests. He has been in the trade for two and a half years. He isn't challenged by high competition as there are very few other entrepreneurs who are working in this sphere of business. Presently, Valeryi has about $5000 in merchandise. His profit is about $600 a month.

Valeryi has been dreaming about a covered kiosk where he could store all his inventory and keep it unharmed. He believes a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($650 USD) will help him buy construction supplies to build such a kiosk and protect his products from the damaging effects of the climate in Ukraine. Moreover, a covered kiosk will help him work each day and be less dependent on weather forecasts. We believe this client will reach all his goals and repay the current loan without any problems.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to build a vending kiosk

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a grown daughter. She runs a small business selling socks and stockings in one of Simferopol's markets. Her clothing sale business exhibits good economic characteristics, consistent growth, and stability. Ludmila has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and meeting the needs of her customers which helps her gain success in business. She has been in the trade for 8 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $6000. Her monthly net profit is about $800.  

Ludmila would like to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($650 USD) to increase her working capital. Her natural ability to please her customers, anticipate their needs, and offer speedy, courteous service will help Ludmila achieve her goals, sustain her success and consequently win the entrepreneurial game.  

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria Angélica lives on Franz Tamayo Street in the Cotahuma area of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband and their two daughters who are 20 and 17 years old.

Maria owns the minibus her husband drives for fares. She is requesting a loan to repair the motor of the minibus. The minibus business is her only source of income.

Maria plans to use the loan to purchase replacement parts for the vehicle. This is her second loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Maria Angélica, vive en la calle Franz Tamayo de la zona Cotahuma, de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo y su dos hijas de 20 y 17 años respectivamente.

Posee un minibús con el cual trabaja su esposo; el crédito que ahora solicita es para la reparación del motor, ya que esta actividad es actualmente su única fuente de ingresos.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra repuestos para el vehiculo. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of replacement parts to repair minibus

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio lives on Arturo Valle Street in the Villa Esperanza area of the city of El Alto [suburb of La Paz]. He lives with his two children, who are 19 and 14 years old. His wife lives and works in the country to take care of their cattle.

Antonio is a welder working with freight vehicles. He rents a workshop where he performs this work.

Antonio will use the loan to purchase materials in bulk to reduce his costs. This is his first loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Antonio vive en la calle Arturo Valle de la zona Villa Esperanza en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 19 y 14 años respectivamente, su esposa vive y trabaja en el área rural cuidando su ganado.

Trabaja como soldador de partes de vehículos pesados, tiene un taller en alquiler donde cumple esa función.

El crédito lo destinara para compra de insumos, al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos. Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of welding materials for his business

loans.name: Kabengera

texts.en:
Greetings from C., a businessman in Kabuga Rwanda! C. is 28 years old and married with two children.

In 2006, C. started his small shop selling women's clothes. Besides operating his own shop, C. sells beans to a nearby secondary school. He employs two people to help him in his businesses. His working capital has grown up to $1500 in the last two years. He makes about $150 every month. The loan requested is 515,000 RWF. The loan will be used to increase his stock.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase his stock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth lives on Avenue No. 5 in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of El Alto [suburb of La Paz]. She is unmarried and lives with her parents.

Elizabeth recently graduated from university. Not having found employment, however, she makes desserts (pastries, cakes, etc.) which she sells in a busy part of the city.

She plans to use the loan to purchase ingredients in bulk to reduce her costs. This is her first loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Elizabeth vive en la Avenida n. 5 de la zona Puerto Mejillone en la ciudad de El Alto. Ella es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres.

Aunque ella es egresada recientemente de la universidad, por la falta de trabajo se dedica a la elaboración de productos de repostería, (masas, queques y otros) los cuales los vende en una zona principal de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para compra de insumos, al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos. Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk (wheat, eggs, yeast, etc.) for confectioner’s business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria lives on Julián Apaza Street in the Río Seco area of the city of El Alto [suburb of La Paz] with her husband and children. Her husband is a public employee.

She owns a shop where she makes photocopies and sells paper and writing utensils.

Victoria plans to use the loan to purchase merchandise (notebooks, pencils, etc.) for sale in her store. This is her second loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Victoria, en la calle Julián Apaza de la zona de Río Seco en la ciudad de El Alto vive junto a su esposo que es empleado público y sus hijos.

Posee una tienda donde realiza trabajo de fotocopias y venta de artículos de librería.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería (cuadernos, lápices, etc.) para su posterior venta en su tienda. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (notebooks, pencils, pens, paper, etc.) for bookstore

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel lives at #7 in Street C130 in the Villa Bolivar D neighborhood of the city of El Alto [a suburb of La Paz]. He is separated from his wife and lives with his parents.

Angel does printing work in his home for various organizations. He plans to use his loan to purchase a printing press, seeing he formerly worked for others but now will work independently.

This is Angel’s seventh loan from IMPRO, which performed an assessment qualifying her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Ángel vive en la calle C 130 # 7 de la zona Villa Bolivar D en la ciudad de El Alto. Ángel está separado de su esposa y vive junto a sus padres.

Realiza trabajos de imprenta para diferentes instituciones, en su propio domicilio. El crédito lo destinará en la compra de maquina de imprenta ya que anteriormente trabajaba de empleado y ahora lo hará independientemente.

Es el séptimo crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of a printing press to permanently establish a printing business

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata C. is 43, married, has two children and has been a member of the Lyndiane 2 village bank for three and a half years. She purchases rolls of fabric and dye and then sells the dyed fabric. She would like to develop her business in order to improve her family’s standard of living. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatoumata C., 43 ans, est mariée avec 2 enfants en charge et est membre du banc villageois de Lyndiane 2eme depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle achète des rouleaux de tissus et des produits pour faire la teinture et vendre le tissu teinté par ensemble. Elle veut renforcer son activité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and dye

loans.name: Nsengiyumva

texts.en:
Greetings from V., a businessman in Kabuga, Rwanda.  V. is 27 years old and married with two children and two adopted orphans.

In 2005, as an orphan from the Genocide, V. had to take care of his mother and sisters and started selling bananas in the market, transporting them on the local wooden bicycle, with a loan of about $110. He has been able to build his house and operates his own shop selling different items like bananas, soap, and cassava flour, fertilizers and chemical sprays. He grows tomatoes and bananas and sells them in the local market. He employs 3 people in his business. The loan request is for 515,000 frws to be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase his stock.

loans.name: Néné

texts.fr:
Néné Mané has six children and has been a member of the Lyndiane 2 village bank for four years. She has had a small farm for several years. She would like a loan to buy eggplant, tomato, pepper, cabbage, carrot and potato seeds, fertilizers and a new water pump. Her income will allow her to improve her family’s standard of living. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Néné Mané, avec 06 enfants en charge, est membre du banc villageois de Lyndiane 2eme depuis 4 ans. Elle a une activité de maraichage qu’elle mène depuis plusieurs années. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des semences de diakhato (aubergine), tomate, piment, chou, carotte, patate, des produits phytosanitaires et renouveler sa pompe à eau. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, fertilizers and a water pump

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel is employed as contract cleaning staff. On the weekends she works in a launderette. Isabel uses the income she earns from these two jobs to support her five children. Her home is located at 16 de Julio in the Zona Villa neighborhood of the city of El Alto [a suburb of La Paz].

Isabel is requesting a loan to cover her eldest son’s boarding and tuition at the Universidad Salesiana [local Catholic university].

This is Isabel’s third loan from IMPRO. Her loan application was approved on the basis of her good payment history. In addition, her support is providing her son with more opportunities for a better life in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Isabel, trabajo como empleada de limpieza a contrato; los fines de semana trabaja como lavandera y de estas dos actividades deriva sus ingresos mensuales con los que cubre la manutención de su cinco hijos que dependen de ella; su vivienda esta ubicada en la Zona Villa 16 de julio de la ciudad de el Alto.

El crédito que ahora solicita es requerido para cubrir las pensiones y matricula en la Universidad Salesiana de su hijo mayor.

Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar la solicitud de Isabel, además de que así ella está ayudando para que su hijo tenga más posibilidades de una mejor vida en el futuro.

loans.use: Payment of university boarding and tuition fees for her eldest son

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady D. is 31, married, has two children and has been a member of the Belfort village bank for five years. She buys fabric dyed in Mali and then resells it. Her income allows her to help pay her family’s daily expenses. She would also like to develop her business. Khady is requesting a loan that will be repaid in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Khady D., 31 ans, est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge et est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 5 ans. Elle achète des tissus teintés du Mali pour les revendre. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Khady sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of dyed fabric

loans.name: Nisveta

texts.en: Nisveta is a married woman from the town of Doboj.  Together she and her husband have 2 children.  Her husband works full time, and Nisveta does farming at their home, mainly planting & growing  vegetables to feed their family.   This is her 1st loan from Zene za Zene, which she is requesting in the amount of 1200 KM.  She wants to use this loan to buy a bunch of chickens, as well as food for them. She plans to fatten the chickens, and sell them at a time when their meat is most valuable.  It is Nisveta’s goal to earn income this way so she can help her family meet their household needs.

loans.use: To buy chickens and food for chickens

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Alimatou Cissé is 53, married, has three children and has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambienne village bank for two years. She would like a loan to buy and sell peanut butter and palm oil. Her income will allow her to maintain her household and improve her family’s standard of living. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Alimatou Cissé, 53 ans, mariée, a 03 enfants en charge et est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 2 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre de la pâte d’arachide et de l’huile de palme. Ses revenus lui permettent d’entretenir son foyer et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of peanut butter and palm oil

loans.name: Nyirimpunga

texts.en:
Greetings from I. in Kabuga Rwanda! I. is 32 years old and married with one child and one adopted orphan. 

In 2005, he started his business selling second-hand shoes for kids and adults. He buys the shoes from Uganda and Kenya in bulk and sells them in the local markets in Kabuga. Besides that, he sells beans, sorghum, and cassava flour to the neighboring markets. His capital has accumulated to over $2500 over the past three years. He employs two people and makes about $40 every month. The loan requested is for 515,000 frws to be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank of Santa Rosa is comprised of 11 clients. The bank is located in the Cangallo community, which is the capital of the Cangallo district in the Ayacucho department. Most people in the community grow fruit trees, and some grow cereals.

Maruja C. has a grain mill, and she also raises guinea pigs in her home, feeding them the waste from the mill. Maruja also sells vegetables. Maruja’s dream is to buy a house, as she now rents her home. She’d also like to send her children to school. At her community bank Maruja learned to save, to love herself, and to value herself as a person. Maruja applies what she was taught in the bank’s trainings and games. Maruja will invest her savings in additional mills, because her production is limited with only one.

Maura E. sells spicy herbal tea at the market, and at night she sells coffee with peppers. Maura also washes clothing and sometimes sells fruit. Maura thinks that the majority of women don’t value themselves, and there has never been an institution in her community that only works with women. The bank has taught Maura how to run her business, and now she wants to expand it and open a restaurant. Maura’s dream is to improve her food sales and to send her children to school so that they can become professionals.

Isabel García sells cereals in Cangallo. She also sells fruit in the market in Ayacucho. Isabel says that before she found the community bank she was half-dead, but when she joined she was born again. When they invited Isabel to stat work with a loan, she had her doubts, but she soon gained confidence in the partners. Now, Isabel says, they help each other, like a family. With her savings, Isabel would like to buy a house, as she now rents her home. Isabel would also like to expand her business while her children are still small. Isabel has many dreams, for example, she hopes to be the perfect mother for her children, and she’d like her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El Bancomunal Santa Rosa esta formado por 11 clientas, esta ubicado en la comunidad de Cangallo, capital del distrito de Cangallo en el departamento de Ayacucho, esta comunidad mayormente se dedica a la producción de frutales, pero es poco la producción de cereales y la mayoría de la gente se dedica al negocio.

Maruja C., tiene un molino de granos, se dedica a criar cuyes en casa con el desperdicio del molino y vende morón, ulpeada y 7 semillas. El sueño de Maruja es comprarse una casa, por que actualmente vive en casa alquilada, también quiere hacer estudiar a sus hijos. En su bancomunal ella a aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, se relaja con lo que se le enseña en las capacitaciones y con los juegos. Ella invertirá sus ahorros en comprar máquinas de moler, porque una sola con la que cuenta actualmente no le abastece.

Maura E., vende yuyo picante los días de feria y en las noches sale a vender café con charapitas. También lava ropa y otras veces vende frutas. Maura dice: “la mayoría de las mujeres, no nos valoramos”, en su comunidad nunca hubo una institución que solo trabajara con mujeres, en el bancomunal me enseñan como hacer mi negocio. Ahora quiero ahorrar para poder ampliar mi negocio y abrir un restaurante. Mi sueño es mejorar mis ventas de comida hacer estudiar a mis hijos para que sean profesionales.

Isabel García, Hace negocios con cereales, compro y los llevo a Cangallo, compra cereales, pero también realiza negocio con frutas de Ayacucho que las trae a la feria. Isabel dice: “En el bancomunal he aprendido a nacer nuevamente, por que yo estaba semimuerta y me invitaron a trabajar con el préstamo, al inicio tenían dudas pero luego me gané la confianza de Finca y de las socias”, ahora somos como una familia nos ayudamos a unos a otros. Con mis ahorros quiero comprarme una casa, por que vivo en casa alquilada y quiero aumentar mi negocio, mientras que mis hijos sean pequeños. Isabel tiene muchos sueños, como por ejemplo ser la madre ideal para mis hijos, y que mis hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: The partners need different loan amounts. Some need 300 soles, some 500 soles, for a total of 4,300 soles in loans to the Community Bank.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou D. is 32, married, has four children and has been a member of the Tenghory Transgambienne village bank for six and a half years. She would like to use this loan to purchase and sell beads, incense, “omo,” cologne, gum arabic, laundry detergent, “dacandé” and shea butter. Her income allows her to help pay her family’s expenses. The loan she is requesting will be repaid in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou D., 32 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Tenghory Transgambienne depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter et revendre des perles, de l’encens, de l’Omo, de l’eau de Cologne, de la gomme arabique, du bleu de linge, du dacandé et du beurre de karité. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Sale of beads, “omo,” gum arabic, “dacandé,” incense and shea butter

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia K. is 37 years old. She is married with two children who are currently in school. She says selling lingerie especially for women is very profitable and therefore has been selling ladies' jean materials and lingerie for six years to support her husband in taking care of their family's needs. Afia wants to use the loan to buy bales of lingerie and jean materials to increase her inventory and sales for a better income. She believes this loan will help her save some money to start paying part of the children school fees and utility bills. Afia is a member of the group called Confidence. Members of the group agree to guarantee for one another and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bales of lingerie and jeans materials.

loans.name: Fajardo Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank of Fajardo is maD. up of 16 clients from the Huancapi community, which is in the capital of the Huancapi district in the Ayacucho department. This community is primarily employed in farming cereals and alfalfa.

Raida H. has a small store where she sells office supplies, drinks, fruits, and photocopies. She also has a trout farm and she raises guinea pigs in her home. At the moment Raida has 200 guinea pigs, and the business is going well. At the Community Bank Raida has learned to save, to love herself, and to value herself as a person. She also receives loans easily, and she relaxed with the knowledge gained during the Bank's training sessions. Raida dreams of improving her guinea pig business and sending her daughters to school, even though they are also entrepreneurs. Raida would like to save money to open a poultry shop with her daughters.

Felipa G. sells groceries and hardware. She also buys cereals to sell in Ayacucho. Felipa raises guinea pigs and grows tomatoes and other vegetables to sell. Felipa says that she’s never had the opportunity to save or to take out loans, but in the Community Bank she learned to value herself, to work hard, and to get ahead with her family. Felipa’s dream is to improve her business and buy a car. Her son is graduating from the police academy and with her savings she’d like to send her other children to school.

Lucia Eudosia P. D. Fernández has a small grocery store. She also plants vegetables, and buys tara and suckling pig. At her Community Bank Lucia has learned to treat her customers well, value herself as a woman that has everything. Lucia says that while she is healthy she’ll do everything that she can to achieve her dreams. Her only dream is to save for when she and her husband reach old age, as they are older and their children are fully grown. Lucia would like to have savings available for when she needs them, especially for medical care.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El Bancomunal Fajardo esta formado por 16 clientas, pertenece a la comunidad D. HUANCAPI, esta ubicado en el capital D. distrito D. Huancapi, en el departamento D. Ayacucho, esta comunidad mayormente se dedica a la producción D. cereales y cultivo D. alfalfa, y la mayoría D. la gente se dedica al negocio.

Raida H., tiene una pequeña bodega, venD. útiles D. escritorio, bebidas, frutas, también cuenta con una fotocopiadora. Tiene su granja D. truchas y se dedica a criar cuyes en casa hasta ahora tiene 200 cuyes y va bien el negocio. En el bancomunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, también recibe préstamos con mucha facilidad, se relajo con lo que les enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño D. Raida es mejorar su negocio y tener su granja D. cuyes, hacer estudiar a sus hijas aunque ellas también ya tienen su negocio. Raida, quisiera abrir una pollería con sus hijas y para eso quiere ahorrar.

Felipa G. , venD. abarrotes y cosas D. ferretería, también se dedica a comprar cereales y llevarlos a Ayacucho. Felipa cría cuyes y siembra tomates y coles para comercializar. Felipa dice que nunca tuvo la oportunidad D. ahorrar y sacar prestamos, en el Bancomunal aprendió a darse valor, fuerza y salir adelante por sus hijos junto a su esposo. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y comprarse un carro. Su hijo esta graduándose D. policía y con sus ahorros quiere que sus demás hijos también estudien.

Lucia Eudosia P. D. Fernández, venD. abarrotes en una tiendita, se dedica a sembrar hortalizas, comprar tara y cochilla. En su bancomunal ha aprendido a tratar bien a sus clientes, valorarse como mujer que tiene todo, ella dice: “mientras la salud me acompañe haré todo el esfuerzo para poder cumplir mis sueños”. Su único sueño es ahorrar para su vejez y la D. su esposo, ya son ancianos y sus hijos todos son mayores. Lucia quiere que sus ahorros estén disponibles para cuando lo necesite, para su salud y otros.

loans.use: The partners need different loan amounts. Some need 600 soles, some need 1000 soles, for a total of 13,800 soles for the Community Bank.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice N. is 55 years old and a widowed mother of five children. Two of whom are in school now. She has been selling grocery products for three years in the town to support her family. She says business is doing well and she therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. Beatrice believes this loan would help her to increase her savings towards the welfare of her two children who are in school now. She is a member of the group called Anointed Ladies. Members agree in unison to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like tin fish, tin tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a twenty-eight year old lady.  she is married with two kids in school. She has been trading in grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tin tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc in the market of Obuasi, Ghana for ten years. Her experience in trading has made her one of the most successful traders in the market. Rebecca considers this loan a great opportunity to enable expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable and palm oil to increase her inventory. Rebecca is a member of  the community group called Anointed Ladies. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and assist themselves to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables and palm oil.

loans.name: El Aguila Group

texts.es:
Hello, we are the AGUILA group and we are situated in the village of Redonda. We have known each other for a very long time and have always worked together. Our activities are: Maria M.: I am a trader and have a small general store at my home. I have one son who is in 6th grade at school.
Albertina D.: she is also a trader and counts on a small general store located at her house. She is an elderly lady and her children are all married, but she one granddaughter who she helps with her studies. 
Amilcar S.: the activity of Don Amilcar is trade – he has a general store situated at the centre of the community.
Carina Naira: she is a trader and has a traveling sales business selling clothes and cosmetics which she also distributes by special order and has been doing this for a number of years.
The rest of us have worked hard to get ahead in our businesses and with our families, and thanks to the support we are requesting, we will be able to meet our familial obligations and as such improve our quality of life. Thank you. 

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.



hola nosotros somo el grupo el AGUILA, estamos ubicados en la aldeda Redonda, tenemos mucho tiempo de conocernos y siempre hemos trabajado juntos.
nuestras actividades son:
Maria M.: soy comerciante cuanto con una pequeña pulperia ubiocada en mi casa de habitacion tengo un hijo que esta cursando el 6to grado.

Albertina D.: ella es comerciante tambien cuenta con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, ella es de la tercera edad, Sus hijos todos estan casados, solo tiene una nieta a la que ayuda en sus estudios.

Amilcar S.: la actividad de don amilcar es el comercio, el cuenta con una pulperia que esta ubicada en el centro de nuestra comunidad.

Carina Naira: ella es comerciante, cuenta con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, cosmeticos, las que distribuye de manera ambulante y por encargo, ella tiene varios años de ejercer esta actividad.

nosotros hemos trabajado fuerte para salir adelante con nuestros negocios y nuestra famila, y gracias al apoyo que estamos solicitando podremos atender nuestras obligaciones con nuestras familias y asi mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.
gracias

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for general stores and clothes sales

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Hello, pleased to meet you. My name is Oralia L., I sell ladies’ wallets and I have done this for a number of years as it generates enough income for the maintenance of my home and to support my family. A few years ago I bought this small house which I remodel little by little and at the moment I would like to fix the courtyard – to lay down cement and to put bricks around it so that it is not made out of earth. For this reason I am asking for your help so that I can improve my home. Thank you. 
With the profits I make from selling ladies' wallets I can cover all of my obligations to this loan. Greetingsh. 

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.



hola mucho gusto mi nombre es oralia L. me dedico a la venta de carteras para damas, ya tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad la cual me genera lo suficiente para el mantenimiento de mi hogar y de mi familia.
hace varios años atras compre esta casita en la cual voy remodelando poco a poco, y en estos momentos deseo arreglar el patio de la casa, hacerlo de cemento y ponerle ladrillos de exterior, para que el patio ya no sea de tierra.
por tal razon estoy solicitando la ayuda a ustedes para poder mejorar mi hogar, gracias.
con las ganancias que me dejan mis ventas de carteras puedo cubrir todas mis obligaciones.
.saludos

loans.use: Purchase of materials to rebuild the courtyard and to pay for the labour

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Monica is 40 years old and the mother of two children who are students. She lives with her husband Edinson, who is a sales clerk and who always supports her in her business. Monica sells jewelry products (earrings, necklaces, hoop earrings among other types) as well as a variety of plush items, caps, clothing etc. She has been doing this for 5 years, taking up several hours a day. She very much enjoys her work, since learning the art of jewelry has been going very well for her and she is happy to see her business grow little by little.

Her desire, and her motive for requesting this loan, is to rent another shop and have a clothing shop, since it is a profitable business, particularly where it is located in a commercial zone. In the future she wants to be a large-scale exporter of these products, both of raw materials and completed jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Mónica tiene 40 años, es madre de dos hijos que están estudiando y vive junto a su esposo Edinson, quien es trabajador dependiente, y siempre la apoya mucho en su negocio. Mónica se dedica a vender productos de bijoutería (aretes, collares, aros, entre otras variedades) además de variedades de peluches, gorros, ropa y otros. Hace esto desde cinco años, ocupándole varias horas al día. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que aprende este arte de la bijoutería, y ya que le va muy bien y se siente feliz al ver que crece poco a poco.

Su deseo, y el motivo por el que pide este préstamo, es para alquilar otro local y poner una tienda de ropa, ya que es un negocio rentable, sobre todo en el lugar donde este encuentra ubicado, porque es una zona comercial. En el futuro quiere ser una gran exportadora de estos productos, tanto en materia prima, como en la joya trabajada.

loans.use: To rent additional business space in order to sell clothing

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, 57 years old, has two children now independent and with their own families. She lives with her husband Ruben, who works in the timber industry. Teresa has been selling meals inside her home for 20 years, which is how she kept her children moving ahead. Now she is very proud that they are professionals. She provides breakfast starting at 6 am and lunch from noon to 2 pm for the workers in an institution in her area (DREU). She likes her work relating to many people. Her motivation is to cover her daily expenses and above all to keep her business going.

She wants to have her business expanded, which is why she is requesting this loan, as well as to refurbish some parts of her home, in order to put a restaurant in the rear, which is her main intention.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Teresa, de 57 años tiene 2 hijos que ahora son independientes y con su propia familia, ella vive con su esposo Rubén, quien trabaja como maderero. Teresa trabaja vendiendo comida dentro de su vivienda desde hace 20 años atrás, actividad con la cual sacó adelante a sus hijos, quienes son profesionales y se siente muy orgullosa de eso. Desde las 6 de la mañana brinda desayunos y almuerzos al medio día hasta las 2 de la tarde para los trabajadores de una institución de su región (DREU), le gusta su trabajo ya que se relaciona con mucha gente. El motivo de su trabajo es para solventar sus gastos diarios y sobre todo para mantener activo su negocio. Quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio, por ello presenta esta solicitud de préstamo, además de refaccionar algunas partes de su vivienda, posteriormente poner un restaurante, que es su propósito más grande.

loans.use: Expansion of her business to convert it into a pretty and spacious restaurant.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 27 years old. She is a divorced mother of two kids who are currently in school. To support her children, she has been selling cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says selling cosmetics is very lucrative but her working capital is woefully inadequate to purchase quality stock to attract sales.  She needs the loan to enable her revive and grow the business. she wants to purchase varied stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory. she hopes the loan would enable to increase savings to sponsor her children education. Elizabeth is a member of the group called Confidence. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. She is in the photograph with one of her kids.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia D. is a thirty-one year old widowed mother of five children. She believes in hard work and dedication. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains and is taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Afia needs the loan to enable her inject more working capital into her business to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to beat up cost. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to support  two of her kids in school. She is a member of the community group called "Amen" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and provide support for members to repay. Afia's photograph was taken at her busy group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize,  cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia, a 50 year old woman, is married with six children. One is currently in school and five have graduated. Afia is a resourceful mother. She works with the motivation of wanting to support her children's education to provide them with better lives and future careers. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. Afia wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance her accommodation project. She is a member of a community group called God's Love Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Afia was joined by her husband as she took the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc.

loans.name: Luz Soledad

texts.es:
Luz Soledad, 40 years old, is the single mother of 3 children, two already independent. The third, a student, is the reason for her to keep moving ahead in her business, to provide for his needs and to have a quiet life.

She has sold chicken from a stand in the market for 6 years. Soledad, as she is known, begins very early and takes care of her daily duties until everything has been sold. Because she started this work alone, her success in getting ahead to where she is now is thanks to her brothers who always support her, above all in her time of greatest need. Soledad works hard to cover the daily expenses of her home as well as her son's education, whom she loves very much.

She needs a loan for expanding and running her business, in order to give a better service to her clients. Your help will make this working mother's goals possible.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Luz Soledad, de 40 años es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes, quedando el último estudiando y es la razón de seguir adelante en su trabajo, para darle lo que necesita y tener una vida tranquila. Se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo en un puesto del mercado desde hace ya mucho tiempo (6 años). Soledad como todos la conocen, se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus actividades diarias, hasta cuando se le acabe todo el producto que tiene por vender. Empezó en este trabajo, a razón de quedarse sola, sus ganas de salir adelante y llegar hasta donde está, es gracias a sus hermanos quienes siempre la apoyan, sobre todo en el momento de mayor necesidad Soledad trabaja duro para solventar los gastos diarios de su casa, así como también para lo estudios de su hijo a quien ama mucho. Requiere de un préstamo para la ampliación e implementación de su negocio y desde luego dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda, harás posible el objetivo de esta madre trabajadora.

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of her chicken sales stall.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a 35 year-old businesswoman.  she is married with two kids who are in school. She trades in foam mattresses and pillows. She obtains her supplies from the manufacturers and sells them at retail price. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of foam mattresses and pillows to increase her stock. She wants to expand  her business to include additional stock like doormats, bedspreads, curtains, etc. to meet the needs of her customers and increase her income. She is a member of the community group called Jesus and Mary Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer support to repay.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of foam mattress, pillows, door mats, blankets etc.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira is a 61-year-old single mother. She had 5 children who are now independent with families of their own. She currently lives with one of her daughters, whom she helps by paying for her accomodation in her home and they both work hard to get ahead.

Recently she has begun to loan out small quantities of money (between 100 and 300 soles). Previously she rented rooms, which did not produce an income. Therefore she chose to enter another bype of business, which is loaning money, and up to now it has been going well for her. She enjoys her work, because it is a way to get to know many people. She must do a lot of analysis when a new client comes before agreeing to loan them money.

She works to help her daughter and her grandchildren who are students, but also to feel useful to those who need her. She needs increased capital in order to continue this business. She will invest part of the money in her home as well, which needs several modifications.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Edelmira tiene 61 años, es madre soltera. tuvo 5 hijos que ahora ya son independientes y con familia, en la actualidad vive con una de sus hijas, a quien le dio ayuda brindándole alojamiento en su vivienda y ambas trabajan duro por salir adelante. Desde hace poco tiempo, se dedica a prestar dinero en pocas cantidades (entre 100 y 300 soles), anteriormente se dedicaba al alquiler de habitaciones, los mismos que no le producían ingresos; por lo que optó con otro tipo de negocio, que es el préstamo de dinero y hasta ahora le está yendo bien. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es un medio para conocer a muchas personas, ella debe analizar mucho cuando viene un nuevo cliente para acceder a prestarle dinero. Trabaja para ayudar a su hija y a sus nietos, quienes estudian, pero también lo hace por sentirse útil para con los que necesitan de ella. Requiere de mayor capital para seguir en este negocio. Así como también, parte del dinero invertirá en su vivienda que necesita de algunas modificaciones.

loans.use: Increased working capital for her business

loans.name: Marle Janet

texts.es:
Marle is 38 years old. Her 4 children are the meaning of her life and her reason to keep fighting to get ahead. She and her husband, Armando, have the responsibility to to get their children ahead, which Marle works very hard for.

She has sold groceries and necessities for some time, this business is the economic sustenance of herself and her children, for whom she supplies the necessities for their studies. She enjoys her work very much, and thanks to her charisma she has a large clientele. By this means she helps her husband, an employee of a company in their area, with some of the expenses.

Marle's proposal is to expand her business, to buy more edible products, and above all to improve her home, since she would later like to sell dinner in the evenings. For this, she considers it necessary to request a loan, in order to fulfill her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Marle tiene 38 años y cuatro hijos quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando por salir adelante, junto a su esposo Armando tienen la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos, para lo cual a Marle trabaja arduamente. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace algún tiempo atrás, este negocio es el sustento económico de ella y de sus hijos, a quienes les brinda lo necesario para sus estudios. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que gracias a su carisma cuenta con una gran clientela y desde luego, mediante esto apoya con algunos gastos a su esposo quien es trabajador de una empresa de su localidad. El propósito que tiene Marle es ampliar su negocio, comprar más productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, ya que posteriormente quiere vender comida por las noches, por ello que necesariamente estima de dinero que solicita en calidad de préstamo, para cumplir con su objetivo.

loans.use: Increase of merchandise for her grocery shop and to establish a space in her home to sell dinner in the evening.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Alimatou B., 38, is married with 3 children under her care. She seeks this loan to help with her family’s daily expenses. She plans to buy and resell dyed fabrics and costume jewelry. This is her first loan, which she will repay this loan after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Alimatou B., 38 ans est mariée et a 03 enfants à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 2 ans et demi .Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter et revendre des tissus teintés et des bijoux de petites qualités. Ses revenus lui permettent d'aider à assurer la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Ce prêt sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: to buy and resell dyed fabrics and costume jewelry

loans.name: Llina Asteria

texts.es:
Llina is 40 years old and the mother of 2 children, who are her motivation to get ahead and prosper. She wants to make her children into professionals that she can be proud of. At present, Llina sells carbonated drinks retail, which permits her to live without anxiety, but she would like to see her business become larger in the future. In this her husband Humberto always supports her. She also sells beauty products from the catalog of a well-known line of cosmetics.

To keep her children moving ahead, to support her husband with some expenses, and to get ahead is Mrs. Llina's byword. She is requesting the current loan in order to set up her business and even become a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Llina tiene 40 años de edad, es mamá de 2 hijos, que son su razón para seguir adelante y prosperar en todo, ella desea convertir a sus hijos en profesionales y así sentirse orgullosa Actualmente Llina se dedica la venta de bebidas gaseosas al por menor, lo que le permite vivir tranquilamente, pero quiere ver en el futuro a su negocio convertido en algo más grande. Es por eso que su esposo Humberto siempre la apoya en todo. Adicionalmente, también vende productos de belleza por catálogo de una línea cosmética muy conocida.

Sacar adelante a sus hijos, apoyar a su esposo con algunos gastos y salir adelante es el lema de la señora Llina. Solicita el presente préstamo para implementar su negocio y llegar incluso a ser distribuidora.

loans.use: Capital increase for expansion and improvement of her business

loans.name: Manuel Martín

texts.es:
Martin is only 39 years old. He lives with his wife Carol, with whom he has two marvelous children, who are in school and are his reason for striving onward. He is the owner of a motorcycle transport, which he has managed for the past 3 years with the same driver. He is multifaceted in the work he does, since he also raises turkeys and has his own popular dance hall. His daily activities of managing his transport service, his dance hall, and care of his birds is a routine that requires the whole day, but he does not get tired of his work, since he has visions of business for the future. He likes his activities because they keep him busy and with his charisma it enables him to be a decisive and proactive man. He wants to repair his motorcycle, as well as remodel some aspects of his dance hall, which is why he is requesting this loan. In the future Martin hopes to rent a space to open a business where he can sell turkey.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Martín cuenta en la actualidad con 39 años de edad, vive con su esposa Carol, con quien tienen dos maravillosos hijos, los cuales estudian y son su razón de seguir adelante. Es propietario de un motocarro, el mismo que lo hace trabajar desde hace 3 años con un chofer particular, él es muy polifacético laboralmente ya que también se dedica a la crianza de pavos y cuenta también con un local de baile muy concurrido. Sus actividades diarias de administrar su motocarro, su local y cuidar sus aves es rutina de todo el día, con lo que no se siente cansado ya que tiene muchas visiones de negocio para el futuro. Le gustan sus actividades ya que lo mantienen activo y el gran carisma con el que cuenta hacen de él un hombre decidido y pro activo. Quiere mandar a reparar su motocarro, así como también, remodelar algunas aspectos de su local de baile, para lo que solicita este préstamo, posteriormente quiere alquilar un local para poner su negocio de venta de carne de pavo.

loans.use: Repairs for his motorcycle and remodeling of his dance hall.

loans.name: Mariama Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariama S. is married with 4 children in her care, all of whom go to school. With this loan, she would like to improve her family’s living and health conditions; she would especially like to provide good schooling for her children. She is going to buy large quantities of palm oil at Diaobé’s weekly market and sell it retail in Ziguinchor. She plans to repay this loan after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Mariama S. est mariée et a 04 enfants en charge, tous scolarisés. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille mais surtout permettre une bonne scolarité à ses enfants. Elle va acheter en grande quantité de l’huile de palme au marché hebdomadaire de Diaobé et revendre le produit en petit détail à Ziguinchor. elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .

loans.use: to buy and resell palm oil

loans.name: Gomis

texts.fr:
Gomis P. is a 36-year-old widow with 5 children in her care, for whom she would like to provide good living and health conditions. She would like to buy palm oil, lemon juice, and brooms to resell them. This loan will allow her to grow her small business. She plans to repay this loan after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Gomis P. est une femme de 36 ans, veuve avec 05 enfants en charge et elle souhaiterait leur assurer une bonne condition de vie et de santé. Elle souhaite acheter de l’huile de palme, du jus de citron et des balais afin de les revendre. Ce prêt lui permettra ainsi de fructifier ce petit commerce dans lequel elle s’active. elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .

loans.use: to grow her business of selling palm oil, lemon juice, and brooms

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
For the past year Felicita has been selling food and beverages at a shop she has set up in her home. Her work begins at 8 in the morning and doesn't end until 7 at night. She offers finger food, liquors, soft drinks and snacks to neighbors and acquaintances in the area. She also works in the field two days a week. She worked cleaning her brother's hostel for six years as well. The loans that she has received in the past have helped her purchase the liquors and soft drinks she offers in her shop. In the future, she would like to convert her shop into a restaurant and offer daily meals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 1 año, Felicita trabaja vendiendo comida y bebidas en el local que ella ha acomodado en su casa. Sus labores empiezan a las 8 de la mañana y culminan a las 7 de la noche. Ella ofrece piqueos, licores, bebidas y golosinas a sus vecinos y conocidos del barrio. Felicita también labora en el campo dos veces por semana. También ha trabajado limpiando en el hostal de su hermano durante 6 años. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para la compra de los licores y gaseosas que ofrece en su local. A ella le gustaría convertir su local en un restaurante y ofrecer menús diarios.

loans.use: Purchase the liquors and soft drinks she offers at her shop / Para la compra de los licores y gaseosas que ofrece en su local.

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
S. Célestine is married and has been a member of the Belfort Village Bank for a year and a half. She sells vegetables at the Tilène market in Ziguinchor. Her business consists of buying and reselling cabbage, potatoes, tomatoes, okra, chilis, etc. She contributes to her family’s daily expenses and medical care. She will repay the loan she seeks after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

S. Célestine est une femme mariée et membre du banc villageois de Belfort depuis 1an et demi. Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché Tilène de Ziguinchor. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des choux, des pommes de terre, des tomates, des gombo, du piment etc … Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et aux soins médicaux de sa famille. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: vegetable business

loans.name: Aroumo Diminga

texts.fr:
Aroumo Diminga S. is married, 56, and a mother of 6. She would like to use this loan, her first, to contribute to her family’s daily expenses in order to improve her family’s living and health conditions. She intends to make a profit by selling vegetables and various foods at the neighborhood market. She will repay her loan after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Aroumo Diminga S. est mariée, âgée de 56 ans et mère de 06 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt qui est son premier participer quotidiennement aux dépenses familiales afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. Elle compte rentabiliser son activité de vente de légumes et produits divers au marché du quartier. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy and resell vegetables and diverse foods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia has had a repair shop for the past 16 years. It was her brother who inspired her to set up the shop, since they were both mechanics. Her husband is a mechanic as well. She is in charge of the administration. The loan she has requested will help her maintain her shop and pay off debts.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Cecilia tiene desde hace 16 años un taller de mecánica. Fueron sus hermanos quienes le animaron a instalar un taller, debido a que ellos son mecánicos. Además, el esposo de Cecilia es mecánico. Ella se encarga de administrar el lugar. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para mantener su taller y para pagar deudas.

loans.use: Maintain her repair shop and pay off debts / Para mantener su taller de mecánica y pagar deudas.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma learned how to make backpacks, handbags and wallets at the seamstress shop where she was working. It was this that motivated her 13 years ago to start her own sewing shop in his home. She takes her products to the country fairs and markets, where they are then sold. She also performs sewing services for customers too. In a week, she makes about 200 backpacks and handbags. The loans she has received in the past have helped her purchase the materials necessary to make her products. In the future, Emma would like to have her own post in the market and sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Emma aprendió a hacer mochilas, bolsos y carteras en el taller donde trabajaba. Fue así que hace 13 años se animó a poner su propio taller de costura en su casa. Ella lleva sus mochilas y carteras a campos feriales o mercados, donde los vende. Igualmente, hace servicios de costura para otras personas. A la semana hace alrededor de 200 mochilas y bolsos. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar los materiales que necesita para confeccionar las mochilas. A Emma le gustaría tener un puesto propio en el mercado y vender sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase the materials needed to make her backpacks, handbags and wallets / Para comprar los materiales que necesita para confeccionar las mochilas que ofrece.

loans.name: Señor De Luren Group

texts.es:
The Cangallo community is in the capital of the district. Most people grow fruit trees, but some also grow cereals.

Marlene sells clothing and small livestock that she sells at the Cangallo market. Marlene dreams of opening a clothing store, but right now her most important investment is in the education of her children. Marlene would like Finca Perú to teach her more about business and values.

Erika sells kebabs, and every afternoon she washes clothing in her home. Erika also sells vegetables on the weekends, and sometimes she buys and sells cereals. Erika would like to improve her family life, buying things for her home so that her children can have a comfortable place to live. Erika would like to save to expand her house. She’d also like to buy tools for her husband, who is a shoemaker. Erika says that before Finca Finca Perú, no institution has ever taught the people, or held their hands so that they can walk. She has learned that the best legacy that she can give her children is an education.

Lucydonia has a clothing store in Alcamenca. She also buys and sells cereals, as well as tara and suckling pig. Lucydonia was at a Finca Perú meeting in Huancaraylla, but she never thought that she’d also find a chapter in Cangallo. Lucydonia came to Finca through a friend, and now she is a partner. She’d like to build a house, own her own grocery store, and educate her children so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La comunidad de Cangallo esta ubicado en la capital del distrito, esta comunidad mayormente se dedican a la producción de frutales, pero es poco la producción de cereales y la mayoría de la gente se dedica a este negocio

Marlene, se dedica a la venta de ropa, también vende animales menores los compra y lleva a la feria de Cangallo Marlene sueña con abrir una galería de ropa, por ahora lo mas importante es la educación de sus hijos. Marlene quisiera que Finca Perú le enseñe muchas cosas más, como valores y les eduque sobre los negocios.
